Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT.......”
Reviews.Author: Nikita060
Reviews.Content: Our problem with Aston started just when we reached there.After a long flight we were tired but the only thing that kept us going was thet we will finally get our 1 bedroom OCEAN FRONT suite.To our dismay,the girl at the reception said that an Ocean Front was not avialable n we will have to stay in an ocean view for that night.Also,this is when we had got the reservations done way back in july 2011.This meant that we cud not unpack that night as somebody will have our stuff moved the next day to the new room,when we were out sightseeing.We finally got our ocean front the next day,which,i will be honest,was truly ocean front with awesome views of lanai n molokai islands.The landscapw is also very pretty with tall trees and koi ponds etc.the room wasnt the best of all,but the view was great.The dining table was shaky,the utensils dirty and scratched,and the bed was so light that it made noise even at the slighest of motion.the bathroom tub was small and sometimes the towels were also dirty.all in all,nothing very great.The day we were to checkout,i was not well n we had our flight a little later in the day so my husband called up if we could just stay a little beyond the checkout time,like 2 hrs.Our request was denied saying that they are booked.We checked out at the normal time and my husband also asked for an email explaining why our room was not ready even after booking sooo much in advance.but we have received no emails of apology or whatsoever.Needless to say we will neither go back nor reccemmend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel very much, want to come again”
Reviews.Author: Wei S
Reviews.Content: We stay here for 1 night, the place is a little far away to the airport, but the place is so quiet and the beach is very beatiful. It look like a family hotel, everything is perfect. They have washing machine in the room, even books and swimming things. We can even cook at room. We are at the first floor with the garden outside. It is quite beatiful and private beach also.

Reviews.Title: “We were very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bobheiple
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place with ocean front apts but the pools are to cold. They are always empty because they aren't heated. The ocean is freezing also, the lies of it being warm all the time really makes me angry. My idea of an Hawaii vacation is swimming, snorkeling, etc. Only people from the cold North dare go in. We are from LA Ca. and can't enjoy the ocean there for the same reason. Thought it would be different in Hawaii. Never again. Amusements were nice but very pricy. About $130. Per person. We are not fans.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: KristinaLT
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband (25 years old) stayed at Aston Papakea in October, 2011. Till this day I can't forget this place. We booked garden view studio, but when we came, we been upgraded to oceanfront studio, which was simply amazing! They have whatever you need in a modern, fully equipped kitchen. Our studio was at first floor, so we have a huge glass door infront of breathtaking ocean. Every day you could watch amazing sunset at your own terrace and every night you can enjoy the sound of waves. Grounds was very beautiful and clean. Yes, there is no sand infront of this resort, but it's not a big deal, you can go to neighbourhood beaches. Loved to spend our evenings at jacuzzi near the huge palm trees, looking into gorgeous sky with stars and listening sound of the ocean. Sooo romantic! Maui was our heaven on the earth. Thanks Papakea for best vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always...”
Reviews.Author: jaybirds
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit G404 for several days and found it to be a wonderful, comfortable and well-equipped unit. The Papakea was immaculately maintained just as it was on our last visit in 2007. The kitchen had all of the tools we needed even including barbecue tools, dishwasher soap, microwave popcorn, coffee, and filters. Our unit was privately-managed (many others are managed by Aston resorts) but it was very clean, up-to-date and well-equipped. There was an air conditioner that we never turned on (when you're coming from the State of Washington in February you are soaking up every degree of heat you can possibly absorb) but just let the sweet-smelling trade winds blow through the unit. We played tennis on the beautiful Papakea tennis courts, putted mini golf, did some time at the shuffleboard court, soaked in the Papakea hot tubs (102F), and washed sand off at the Papakea sand showers at the waterfront. Mostly, though, we were off around Maui trying to visit every nice beach on the island.

Reviews.Title: “A402 - What a delightful unit!”
Reviews.Author: 2Luvbrds
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this unit for a week in February and loved it. The owners have done an amazing overhaul on the unit and it is high quality top to bottom yet tasteful and comfortable. They are also very organized and strict with the cleaning which we really appreciated. Everything in the kitchen was classy and they didn't miss a thing. We kept discovering little extras as the days went by, it became quite the joke "and they have THIS as well!". We rented this unit through Chasin' Rainbows (a local agency) and they were very helpful with any requests we had. They also supplied a couple of boogie boards, tennis racquets, putters, nerf ball and nice beach towels for our use. The pool and hot tub were very close (and quite hot, I was impressed). The lanai was directly over the ocean - and this may be my only complaint - I never thought the ocean could be that loud! It was just the way the waves crashed on the reef. What a complaint to have though. We slept with the lanai doors open for airflow so I just slept with earplugs but no one else in my group had any difficulties with the noise - they loved it. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, would definitely recommend the unit to anyone who wants a clean quality vacation unit. This was the highlight of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Complex, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: 5CMs
Reviews.Content: Rented K401, 1 BR w/ Loft from a private party. The unit was nice and came fully equipped. Even had a couple of boogie boards and snorkel packages available for your use. The views are beautiful and you can lounge beachside and watch the whales. Although the beach is unusable (coral reef) it is still great to sip a POG & Rum drink or slushy Pina Colada. There are grills available for use if you wished to pick up fresh fish or steak at the local supermarket. (One across street and Safeway in Lahaina just 2 miles away).

Reviews.Title: “A true home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Maui_kai_mana
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Maui from 01/25/12 to 02/05/12 and had booked a flight, car, and hotel package through Expedia.ca. While I'd viewed the virtual tour on the Aston website, I had no idea how it would relate in person. It was better than I could have ever imagined! We were in an Oceanfront studio unit F203. When we first walked in the door, we couldn't even see the grass! Now that's ocean front. The sound of the waves crashing was so powerful... just amazing! It was loud at times but we found it strangely soothing as well and it sure helped to drown out any other 'noise' happening on the grounds or in other units... so it was perfect. The first morning we were there, we saw whales playing halfway between us an Molokai. Just stunning and so exciting. The ever changing surf and mood of the ocean, the way the sky looked, it was always so enticing. Papakea offers true comforts of home. With a full kitchen and washer and dryer in-suite, and the sofa was a sofa bed so it worked out well that we each had a bed to sleep in. It was SO clean and so nicely decorated. I truly felt at home there! The grounds were amazing, the concierge Sarah truly eminated the Spirit of Aloha. So kind! Everywhere we were there was beauty. The sounds of the frogs at night was so cool! Papakea is close to many ammenities, grocery stores etc. within walking distance. With a car, it's a quick drive to Ka'anapali beach and Lahaina. Already working on going back. Would be so happy to have the same unit again, but regardless, the Papakea is the place I will be staying when I return to Maui again!

Reviews.Title: “relaxation - wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Lily-Lu
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Honolulu for a conference for the last 15 years( How lucky) - we have been to Maui 4 times before - this was the first time at Aston Papakea. We splashed out on a front unit - and I just loved it. The sea is just in front of the unit - - so a loud noise from the sea all the time - which we loved!! So lovely to go to sleep with the noise of the sea!! and it was great for viewing the whales - grounds are lovely - really lovely !!! The resort is wonderful!! Don't take any notice of the beach not in front - you walk just a few steps - and there is a beach!! No problem. It really is a lovely place to spend a holiday. We were on the third floor beach front - in the middle. If you go to Dukes to eat - best book ahead - as there is a waiting list most of the time. A lovely night is at the Jazz bar over the road from the resort - good food also - and good company! Plus if you walk up the beach next to Papakea - there are two lovely resturants - both are good!!!! If we are lucky enough to go again next year to Honolulu - We would certainly come back again to Papakea - it was lovey - and would pick the same unit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice unit at Papakea”
Reviews.Author: gapcmp
Reviews.Content: We were in a VRBO ocean front unit at Papakea for more than two weeks this visit just ended. L-105 is an excellent choice for anyone desiring a 2 bedroom refinished very modern unit. While the noise of the surf can sometimes be loud in an ocean front unit, you are soon used to it's soothing natural noise. The whale watching from the lanai was fantastic. An endangered monk seal visited the beach in front of our building for about 14 hours. While parking is tight it is always available. This is a family property. The pools were clean and well maintained. The multiple gas BBQ grills were always available and the guests were from all over the world. A great place to meet others from varied backgrounds. Take part in the Wednesday evening Mai Tai get togethers. We will definitely stay here again as the location is just excellent in the Kaanapali area.

Reviews.Title: “great location with very friendly people and a helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: oksanakis
Reviews.Content: We booked this place and were very happy with the whole experience. The only real drawback was that it was almost an hour's drive from the airport, but that didn't play much of a significant role for us. The people around there are a mixture of owners and people like us, just staying for a few days. Great amenities for grilling, watching whales from the property, a grocery store within walking distance, along with a few wonderful local spots. We went the on premise person to book events for us and if I had to do that again, I wouldn't. We weren't told things about the excursions which would have changed our decision and I am pretty sure we paid more than we needed to, which added to an already expensive Maui experience. Rooms are nice, quiet, equipped for living. Loved it and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the draw, and also...”
Reviews.Author: cycleguyanon
Reviews.Content: I just read a review written by someone after their stay at the Papakea, to which a manager of the Aston responded. Essentially stating the review was inaccurate, the managers response is tooled to make the problems had at the resort simply a matter of misunderstanding or worse, false claims. I too, stayed at the Papakea and I feel compelled to write a review, especially after reading the manager's responses. I would have given the resort a 3 star, however the failings of the management staff pull my overall experience down a notch. My condo was also pretty run down. No granite and stainless steel kitchen for me either. 80's formica. Nothing like the photos. NOTHING LIKE THE PHOTOS. We were also told the managers would be gone for 2 days and they were unreachable. In addition, were were told that if they switched us, they would have to switch a lot of other reservations of those coming in after us to accommodate. As if that is a good reason. Basically, it is luck of the draw. Don't count on getting a room change at a busy time of year. Sure, maybe they can upgrade you if there is no one else there, but not at high season, baby. Everyone we met who had a nice place there had booked through the owners. I would only go that route in the future. It is easy to walk the compound at night and see in to the other condos--we did and saw just as many nice condos as beater condos. Another safety note: we were also at the Papkea when the power went out. There were no exit signs or emergency lights lit anywhere on the property. Indeed, there are light FIXTURES in the stairs, but they do not light up when the power is out. Outdoor hallways and stairs (the only kind on the property) were so dark you could not see a hand in front of your face. If indeed the management staff is available via phone, then I would guess they have trained their staff to "broken record", or "deal" with guests with complaints until they go away. I don't think we were told the manager was unavailable for 2 days because the desk staff wanted to rankle me. I think they have a directive. Another note: I would never go to the place in the hotter months of the year. The aircon unit in our condo was a single window/wall unit in the living room, a long way from the bedroom. It was noisy and did not blow cool air. Because we were happy to have fresh ocean air, we kept the place open all hours. It never got hotter than 84 while we were there and the breezes were great. But if you are the type who needs AC all the time, you'd be really bummed to have to live with that AC solution. Pros: Nice clean pools with rules like "no running, spitting of water, blowing of noses, no jumping in, no loud game playing, no ball throwing, no snorkeling ( yes, really--the security guy comes around regularly to enforce the rules and we found the no snorkeling a bit harsh, however germ aware)..." Beautiful ocean is right there. Not expensive, and it would have been even cheaper had we booked with an owner directly. Super friendly cleaning staff. Cons: Out of date condo is a strong possibility for you. It was reality for us. No hope to move to better unit. Unavailable management. No safety lights, exit signs or backup generators.

Reviews.Title: “We love staying at the Papakea!”
Reviews.Author: jaggsmith
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times and enjoy it more every time! We love the location as it's close to some of our favorite beaches: Ka'anapali, Napili and Kapalua. In the winter we see whales right from the resort. Although it doesn't have a sandy beach right in front, you can walk right across to the next door resorts where miles of sandy beaches start. All of the rooms have patios which face the ocean - we always enjoy our morning breakfast and coffee sitting on the "lanai" with a beautiful view of the grounds, palm trees and ocean. The grounds are immaculately kept with 4 lovely fish ponds filled with lilypads and koi. Beautiful trees, hedges, plants and tropical flowers of every kind and color fill the yards. There is a lovely putting green, tennis courts and 2 nice size pools and 2 hot tubs. The pools have wonderful gas barbecues right by them as well as gazebos and washrooms. We never even have to put on the a/c in our room as you always get a lovely ocean breeze coming through the screens. The Papakea is just a 10 minute drive to Whaler's Village with great shopping and a few minutes further to Lahaina where we spend our evenings as well (great restaurants and shopping!). We also love the fact that we are in walking distance of a wonderful local market where we buy fresh tropical fruit, muffins, jams, bread and bagels. Each room is different as most are owned privately. Each one we've stayed in is clean, fresh, supplied with all appliances, washer, dryer, etc and most of all QUIET! We love it here and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is a beautiful resort with pools and hot tubs that are in constant need I'd repair and security that makes it difficult”
Reviews.Author: travel995
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Papakea for the 5th time in 10 years. We love the amenities at the resort. The grounds, the putting greens, the pools and hot tubs are wonderful. We've never been there when at least one of the pools or hot tubs has not been broken. It seems to be an ongoing issue at the resort. According to the onsite workers the heaters in the pools are not adequate to heat the pools and the HOA doesn't want to spend the money to replace them. We also got really tired of the security guards constantly telling the kids to not do things at the pool. According to them they are hired by the HOA to enforce the rules. I'm not talking about diving in the pool, but jumping off the side, No balls, no toys, etc. I really love the property, but would not recommend it to people with children older than 6 or 7. I would not hesitate to recommend this resort to people traveling Without children or families with toddlers. If you are traveling with older children beware of the rules regarding their play. The security guards are not rude, but they are relentless in their hounding of the kids at the pools. The HOA needs to be aware they are chasing families away with some of their rules. I want to clarify that I was not personally affected by the rules, but my observations of their enforcement would make me weary to bring back my extended family including my grandchildren. Please HOA rethink some of these rules and fix your pool and hot tub pumps and heaters!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Maui, Papakea Resort, E402”
Reviews.Author: Dxer47_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night in early November. Got a free upgrade and did not realize that we now had a gorgeous 2 bedroom condo with a balcony and a spectacular view of Molokai on the left and the West Maui Mountains on the right. The property was kept in excellent condition by the friendly staff. When we noticed that the ice maker in the fridge was not working managment had it repaired within 24 hours. The Times Supermarket is across the street and they have a Friday night takeout dinner for 9.99, either shrimp or steak;generous portions. The only feature we did not like was the high pressure Club Wyndham timeshare session we had in Lahaina. Otherwise it was the best vacation we ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable resort!”
Reviews.Author: Sunchaser1104
Reviews.Content: This was our third time in Hawaii, first time in Maui, first time at a Papakea. We had a 3rd floor condo with an 'oceanview'. We paid $2900 for the flight, condo, and rental car departing from Toronto. CONDO- Was beautiful, spacious, clean and well equipped. It included laundry, dishwasher (unlimited detergent), standard size fridge and any other utensils or pots/pans you would ever need. It included a large lanai with a breakfast table and a sun chair. The main room was nicely furnished. The bedroom was great, comfortable mattress, sufficient sheets which they changed every other day. They also changed our bathroom towels daily, as well as swept the floors. The washroom included a single shower with a fantastic shower head. You will never complain about the pressure or water temperature. The soaps/shampoos were quickly replaced when low. Please note they do not include toothpaste and they only include a 1 load package of laundry detergent. After that you have to pay $1 for every additional one (which they will bring to your room) or you can purchase for 75 cents at the nearby ABC stores (walking distance). They provide each room with 4 pool towels which they launder upon request. They also replenish your Kona coffee everyday! The condo was quiet and we were never disturbed by surrounding noise. I should note they do have elevators for those who want a higher level, however, are physically unable to climb stairs. RESORT- Was almost at full capacity when we were there. Space was never an issue and the parking was convenient. The staff were pleasant and we never had any issue. The first day we had a nice orientation compliments of Expedia. I encourage you not to skip it. Free breakfast pickings and they raffle a free trip. It is not a timeshare and there is no pressure for anything. We never used the pool or hot tub but they appeared nice and many guests seemed more than satisfied as they would swim until very late at night. The resort is ocean front, however, swimming is not recommended directly out front. There is plenty of grass and sun chairs to use along the rock wall. If you want a sandy beach, walk to the resort next door and you will find a sandy beach that stretches for miles. You will also find other resort restaurants along the way. There is an easily accessible boardwalk that will take you the entire way along. The beach was great for swimming and snorkeling! Some days the waves would be plenty, other days not at all. Despite being close, this area was one of our favourites on the island. The resort was landscaped beautifully, there were never any issues of theft (in room or vehicles) and there were no bugs that we seen. We loved the location of the resort after visiting the busy and crowded South end of the island. It was convenient to travel and close to everything you wanted. Lahaina town was a favourite for dinner time, a 10 minute drive South from the resort or a cheap cab ride. Also there is no restaurant or fitness facility directly on the resort. There are fitness classes available. The restaurant meant nothing as there were plenty all around us. ISLAND- Maui wowee! We loved Maui (although the rugged Kauai still remains a favourite). There are so many things to do and travel is convenient. We traveled the entire island during our 10 days including a ferry trip to Lanai for a day. Its hard to list only a few things we loved... We watched the sunrise from the volcano summit one morning, woke up at 3am and drove up to the summit (there is a guy that sells coffee in a booth half way, it gets a bit chilly!) We were cognizant of the weather, ensuring it was going to be a clear night/morning for best view (although many of the clouds are below 10,000 ft and dont matter). We were shocked at how busy it was, park rangers assist in getting everyone parked at the top. You do pay a small park entrance fee per vehicle on your way in (cash appreciated). Bring a blanket. We also hiked after the sunrise, it was magnificent, almost like you're on another planet. Bring lots of water, food, and a comfortable jacket. Hana highway - AWESOME! We had a jeep and did the entire thing (it gets rough to the South). If you are not a skilled or patient driver, go very early in the morning or do a bus tour. We stopped many times along the way, swam in waterfalls, bought banana bread, pictures galore. It was incredible (especially if you pursue the South roads where many do not travel). The South roads loop you around the the main highways eventually. MAKE SURE YOU HAVE ENOUGH GAS IN YOUR VEHICLE. I'd also warn people not to get a late start or you will be stuck on the roads at night, which could be a disaster. The North part of the island was also beautiful. We would often see dolphins swimming and the beaches were nice. If we seen clouds coming in on the North we would just head South to extend our beach day. FERRY TO LANAI - The ferry trip we purchased online before we left. It was a package that included an off road jeep for the day. Budget rentals will give you a map for you to navigate the rough roads and hang out on untouched beaches. There is hardly anything on this island so do your research and be prepared for food and come with any other necessities you may want. It was a great time discovering the sights and shore line. LAHAINA TOWN - We went here every night for dinner trying a new restaurant each time. Famous Daves was our favourite! Lots of shops to walk through while you are walking off your dinner. Lastly the weather was great on Maui! and the people were nice. If you have any questions feel free to send me a message. Happy travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the draw”
Reviews.Author: Rickity1-x
Reviews.Content: Aston Papakea [aka Vacation International - Papakea] will not book a specific unit for you so it is the luck of the draw as to what you get. If you request a ground floor because of a wheelchair accessibility issue, or because you have a "chase-me" child, they will not even discuss the situation with you. If you go through the Aston booking systems - good luck. In this economy it sure seems like a dumb practice.

Reviews.Title: “Eh ... OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: dol1234
Reviews.Content: We reserved a one-bedroom ocean front condo at the Papakea based on the rave reviews I saw here on TripAdvisor. Overall it was OK, but ultimately I felt like I did not get what was advertised on their website. Be warned that many of the condos look NOTHING like the photos on the Aston website. Those are all deluxe corner units. The one we got didn't have as many windows and the kitchen was totally USED UP -- looked like it was last updated in the 1970s. At the advice of many other TripAdvisor reviewers, I'd asked for a "renovated" unit. When we checked in at the front desk, the woman said we had indeed been placed in a renovated unit. But that was clearly not the case once we finally got to our room. The next morning, I went down to the front desk and asked if we could switch to an actual renovated unit. There was a VERY rude and defensive blonde woman there who said they were sold out and there was nothing she could do -- and when I asked to speak to a manager, she said the managers were all "in meetings" for the next two days and that I could try checking with them on Wednesday -- already almost halfway through my vacation. This was the week before Christmas -- supposedly one of the busiest times for Hawaii -- and the managers are all "in meetings" and unavailable, even by phone, for two full business days???? That seems pretty ridiculous. On Christmas Eve, there was a power outage (I think much of the area was affected, not just the Papakea). However, they have NO BACKUP LIGHTS ANYWHERE. It was literally pitch black throughout the entire facility, including all the stairwells. My husband happened to be over at the main building and actually fell into some of the landscaping trying to make his way back to the condo. I can't imagine the fire marshall would be OK with the fact that there is no emergency backup lighting at all. This is a huge condo development, with several buildings, all of which are four stories. OK -- I do have some positive things to say. They have two pools, which are kind of small but totally fine. We always were able to find a chaise lounge to sit on. There are lots of families and "regulars" there and it had a nice community vibe about it. The condo itself was pretty clean (although the floors were all really sticky when we arrived ... we cleaned them ourselves and then it was ok). If you go to this complex, I highly recommend using vrbo instead of booking directly with Aston. If we'd done that, we could have saved a bundle of money. Also then you would be able to see photos of the exact unit you'll be in, and know whether you'd be in a totally outdated, used-up unit or not. I see the benefit of booking directly with the resort to be that if you have an issue with your room, you can switch, but since that wasn't gonna happen, I wish I would have booked directly from an owner. I could have stayed in a comparable unit if I'd booked through vrbo for about half the price I paid booking directly through Aston.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Papakea”
Reviews.Author: maxum2311
Reviews.Content: This is my first review of Papakea, however my wife and I have stayed there 10 times over the past 3 years. We always get ocean front; I think it is worth the extra money to wake up looking at the ocean, and listening to the waves at night. Not to mention seeing the whales play during the season. The Good. The staff are wonderful and helpful. The resort is convenient to everything you need from Pizza Hut, Farmers Market, and a full size grocery store called Times. Actually I found their prizes very reasonable and will not stop at the Costco Circus again. My only suggestions to Papakea: Internet is slow. Some of the rooms are much more modern than others (privately owned so it is up to the owner to keep them up) No beach - we don't care as we drive to the beaches, or there is one right next door. BBQ's don't get super hot. Disappointed that you have recently added a $10 resort fee. Papakea is the best bang for your dollar, we have walked from there to Whaler's Village and have toured most of the properties north into Napili, and Papakea has them all beat. I just thought I should write a review because we have stayed their so many times. Perhaps I didn't want to share as I don't want them to get to popular.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but all you could possibly need”
Reviews.Author: jpug2002
Reviews.Content: We are time share owners of Vacation Internationale and we booked this trip several months in advance. We weren't quite sure what to expect from the pictures, but as it turns out, the condo was good. Sure, it's very basic, but it has everything to keep you happy during your vacation: a full kitchen with dishes and appliances, a comfortable bed, a nice deck overlooking the property with views of the ocean (we stayed in unit D302), access to the fitness center at the resort next door, a convenient location, activities for families, and two pools surrounded by well-maintained grounds. Now, if you're looking for modern and contemporary design in a resort, this is not the place for you. Instead, you will get a structure built in the 70's that rests its laurels on a Hawaiian motif that attempts to be timeless. I will admit I wanted a bit of a more updated feel in the beginning, but after a few days I certainly settled into the simple and basic charm of the place. It was spotless when we checked in and in the end that is truly what really matters the most in my opinion. Maui is a beautiful place and at the end of the day it's about the island anyway. Spending too much time in your room is questionable in an environment like this one. You will be comfortable here if you're not a connoisseur or high-maintenance kind of person. Remember, the Four Seasons is always an option for 1.345 gazillion, but I think we all agree that's not easy to come by these days. Instead, go for the basic, save a few bucks and enjoy the intoxicating sights and sounds of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo facility- get the ocean front and rent a car”
Reviews.Author: carrieryan
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui, and the Aston Papakea was a great choice for us. The full kitchen and spacious condo was great for our one week stay. We had an ocean front 1 bedroom that had a great view and was really well equipped. We noticed several condos had been updated and renovated (at the owner's discretion and expense)- ours was old, but everything worked fine! The front desk staff was okay- not overly friendly or helpful. I think they were understaffed, which led to average service. The place was oversold while we were there. Housekeeping was also very understaffed- they missed our unit one day and confused us with another suite that asked for early service the next day. But they did a GREAT job- the place was immaculate every day. The grounds were lovely and there is a lot of chairs around for sunbathing. The location is perfect- central without being in the busy beach area. The Expedia Local Expert on site is terrific- definitely go to the orientation for some great advice and information, even if you don't want to book a tour. There are unlimited DVD rentals, and all the modern conveniences you could want. Cons- the place is noisy, no restaurants on site (but you can walk next door and eat there), very small actual beach front (sand), not much within walking distance. Pros- everything you could want in a condo, great location, great price, Expedia Local Expert, great ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Leanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea L202 for three weeks in mid December. What a beautiful resort. We have a spacious two bedroom (there are six of us), the grounds are lovely and the access to everything in west Maui is great! There are pros and cons to the resort so I wondered whether to give it three or four stars. No, the beach isn't swim-worthy but a big part of coming to Maui is trying all the different beaches so we had no problem with this point. Pros: Lovely property, not crazy busy and friendly staff. The grounds crew were fantastic (what a huge job), the pools were great, the barbecue facilities great. We had no problems with bugs, and everything in our condo worked (although a very slow dryer!). Would we stay here again...definitely but I would be a bit wary about our requests - maybe speak to Dave (the hotel manager). He was the one who convinced me to book here given his upbeat and honest responses to many of the reviews of this property. Cons: I guess just two complaints. We booked in March 2011 and requested a ground-floor unit, called monthly to confirm we still had our request recorded and...got the fourth floor. The next day we requested a move and got the second floor. Our in-laws requested to be moved also from their third floor to ground level but at that point, they ended up in a different building. Oh well. Because we stayed for three weeks, we were on the extended rate which meant weekly housekeeping. Funny enough, I spoke to a couple other people who were staying as long as us but received daily housekeeping?!? Our weekly housekeeping was every 7-8 days (not weekly) and pretty basic. Garbages weren't emptied, mirrors, soap dishes and bathtub not cleaned. I guess it is better than booking a condo with no services.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: judik
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid Dec for a 3 night getaway.Booked through Expedia so got a fantastic deal Check is was a bit slow but OK.The first room we were given was on the first floor,on the end,and seemed to have no privacy.The unit itself looked fine We went back to reception,explained our situation,and were upgraded to a 2nd floor room with ocean view overlooking the pool The room was well appointed,the kitchen had everything we needed and more.It was owned by someone(we met him on the last day) so well taken care of.There were boogie boards,cooler in the closet for picnic outings Air con was noisy but worked fine.Didn't need it the whole time Bedroom was utilitarian and dorm looking but comfortable The grounds were immaculate.Two pools and a jacuzzi was available.Plenty of deck chairs No beach to lie on,but that didn't bother me as i am not into that.There were steps leading down to the ocean to access the water if you wanted to swim or snorkel Accessibility to shopping was great,many stores within easy walking distance.an ABC right nest to the resort,a strip mall a block or so up the road to the right with restaurants and a nice supermarket which was convenient if you self cater.Wish I had known that before I stopped at the Safeway in Lahaina Further down the road to the left of the resort was another strip mall with fast food options,a massage place(very nice massages!)a place to rent snorkel gear and a well stocked natural foods market A small shop selling photos and trinkets was also there-we ended up buying two prints of the most amazing sunrises we ever seen in print All in all an enjoyable place to say However if you are into having access to a beach a place like Kaanapali beach club or the like might be a better option

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: PatnAnna
Reviews.Content: Very dated property and the room was not clean. As a matter of fact, it was bug infested. After two days of calling it was finally treated but the bugs were not eliminated. The bed was terrible and the property noisy. Would recommend never staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and good costumer service.”
Reviews.Author: Review_Hound13
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this resort. We stayed in a one bedroom then switched to a two bedroom when our other guest arrived. Both rooms were spacious and had amazing views of the garden or the ocean. Both our rooms had a full size kitchen and came equipped with a washer and dryer. For a long stay (10days) this was definitely convient. However you will need to purchase your own laundry soap. The ocean views are GREAT, but the beach directly behind the resort is not super (not a big sandy area, especial during high tide). They do have a great grass area with beach chairs right against the ocean though. The costumer service was very good, they were more than accomidating with early/late check in/check out. There are several restaurants, a coffe shop and grocery store within walking distance. There is also a great concierge service through Expedia in the lobby. If you are interested in booking trips or getting some inside knowledge Andrea is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Papakea Maui room D301”
Reviews.Author: Miker023
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room D301 - Owned by Vacation Internationale. It is a one bedroom with a Murphy Bed in the living room. Appliances are newer and the place is in good shape. I would rate this resort and room as a clean 2 star resort. One pain was that when we arrived at Papakea, we were advised that they could not check us in as we were with Vacation Internationale so we had to go a mile or 3 down the road to the Valley Isle to check in. Check in was slow and painful. There really is no beach to speak of at this resort. No restaurant, no bar. The 2 pools and 2 hot tubs were adequate. There are a dozen Webber Bar B Ques on site and they really did work well. If you can afford to stay at the Marriott or equivelant, I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Engle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio recently at Papakea and was fairly underwhelmed. The studio unit I had was pretty clean, the bed was horrible, the bathroom was old, and the furniture (what there was of it) probably looked good in 1985. On the other hand, Papakea is a decent family resort in the Kaanapali area and I would consider booking here again. Next time, however, I would not book in a Studio as these seem to be directed to the more budget conscious traveler. What I could see from the common areas is that the 1BR and 2BR units seem to have been updated and looked pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon Dream Suite!”
Reviews.Author: cande26
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Aston at Papakea Resort was everything we could ask for in a honeymoon suite. Well, okay, I would ask for one more thing: more time there to actually enjoy the resort itself! We stayed in room A-302, which was incredibly well-decorated and was right in front of ocean. We liked the A building because it was the more exclusive of the buildings in the resort, with less foot traffic in front of our porch. Alas, we showed up too early in the season to see whales in the ocean, but if any of you are fortunate to come during prime time whale watching season you should be able to see plenty! We didn't get a chance to utilize the tennis courts or (even more sadly) the shuffleboard areas (if you haven't played shuffleboard you're missing out in life!), but they looked great! We did utilize the free DVD rentals, which was really convenient and appreciated during the very rainy/windy parts of the trip, when everything else we had booked was canceled or rescheduled. The service was great at the front desk too. And we loved looking at the beautiful coy ponds on the grounds! All and all, a fun-tastic stay and perfect place for a honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: adbyr8
Reviews.Content: I researched many hotels/resorts in Maui to spend 6 of the 8 nights during my Maui trip (Dec 4th - 12th). I decided to stay the first 2 nights in Hana and then was looking for a resort in the Kannapali area. After reading through most of the reviews here, I decided to give this a chance. i booked for a Oceanfront studio using my Delta skymiles. The only hitch I had was at check in, when I was offered a oceanview studio instead of an ocean front. After showing them proof of reservation which stated ocean front, they agreed to give an ocean front studio (F-203). The studio was just as the pictures on their website. The bed was cozy and comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped. The daily maid service was prompt and good. However, the best part was the Lanai and the views. The lanai was huge with the ocean right in front (since this does not have a beach directly in front, the ocean was very close). The sound of the crashing waves was amazing. Sunset from the lanai was sublime. We ended up spending a lot of time in the lanai (nice lounger and chairs in lanai). The grounds of the resort was excellent. Pools were good, which we did not end up using much. The mini golf was a nice add-in. DVD rental was a nice feature too. The beach started right next door which great. Overall, this was a great resort. I would recommend this resort for anyone (couples or with small children). Let me know if you have any questions and I would be glad to answer. On another note, do try to stay atleast a night in Hana. If you dont, you will truly miss something spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: joycegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Papakea for only one night in unit K405. All the units are individually owned and then serviced by Aston. The unit was spacious and well equipped in the kitchen and baths. Beds were comfortable and we had an ocean view. The resort has 2 pools and some recreation. It is on the beach with plenty of chairs, etc. The neighborhood has a few small stores and restaurants within walking distance and there is ample parking.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Gina R
Reviews.Content: The people who work here were genuinely friendly. My Husband and I went for our homeymoon, and when we told them, they upgraded our room to a 1 bedroom suite, which was amazing and immaculate! I really love staying at a place that feels like home! Full kitchen, fully furnished, even with board games, reading library, dvd player, and video games. Not to mention all the dishes, beach chairs, snorkel gear, tennis rackets, and even washer n dryer ;) We even donated our ice chest to the room. Loved it and most definently will return and request the same unit. Take note, they are individually owned, so some may not have all the same things. There was also 2 pools, and even a putting green. Beautiful place! And great price as well. NOTE: If you play golf, the Kaanapali courses are emaculate, and Pukalani is a breathtaking and loving environment. There's 2 holes where you hit over a huge ravine, crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tropical gardens”
Reviews.Author: jkerrsd
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautifully landscaped and maintained. All the flowering tropical plants add to the Hawaiian experience. We paid for a garden view studio with a car. Auto was upgraded to a full size and unit was upgraded to a 2 bedroom. The view was fabulous and included ocean views. We booked through Lika at Blue Hawaii and were very pleased. The Papakea is a good deal for the location. We had our family of 10 in 3 units and all units were more than expected. Hope we can go back soon. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Great Retro Condo”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: We had room F-203 from 11/12- 11/17. The patio was 25 feet away from the ocean. The staff here are superb and the grounds are very well maintained. The atmosphere is low key and Donald Schneider does a wonderful job running the entire operation. Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “not 100% sure how to rate this one”
Reviews.Author: Captain_0veur
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say I booked this Hotel through Hotwire, as pointed out in the response to other reviews not all units in this complex are managed by the same company. So my comments on the room may not apply to bookings made directly through Aston. In any case we got this place for a reasonable price, parking is free and we did not have to pay the resort fee. Front desk staff was a bit overwhelmed when we checked in, so this took a while. The property itself seems well maintained, there is really not much of a beach but the views are really nice. The two pools seem quite small for such a big property. Concerning the beach and the pools the pictures on the aston homepage are deceiving (shot at just the right angle with what looks like a very wide angle lens). Our room was on the ground floor (garden view) with kitchen and bedroom. The room was clean and spacious and the kitchen was well equipped. But overall the room was a bit tired and in general needed some renovations. Only real complaints are that the shower head was placed so low that I could not use the shower in a normal way (I am ca. 1.9m / 6 ft 3). Also the AC (also of the neighbouring units) was extremly loud. The location might not be good for everybody. We liked it since it was on the quite side and there is a supermarket near by. In any case this was ok, since we did not plan to hang around the Hotel too much and got a good deal. However, if you book this directly through Aston to get a more modern room (as they frequently claim in responses here) it is no longer such a good deal. Also if you don't want to drive to a beach don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Papakea- family value”
Reviews.Author: classof78
Reviews.Content: If high rolling is your MO then this place is not for you. However, if you are looking for value and location/proximity at Kaanapali Beach, then this is one you may like. A good vacation is not determined by fanciness of the property alone. In all fairness though take a look at my pics and judge for yourself. I think not bad. I've been on vacations where the place was very fancy but would not do it again. The staff here is very friendly and there is a somewhat genuine-hometown feel to the place. There is no beach to the rear but a short walk in either direction gets you there. Hey your in Lahaina think overall- location, location. Barbecue pits by the pool and fun loving no pressure staff. I think this was just right for a party of seven (2 kids) without breaking the bank. This was a vacation getaway from Interval International. Actual travel time was July 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Only one word - amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Anastassia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea end October, beginning of November and we loved it! The resort has beautiful landscaping and is very well kept. The staff is very nice and friendly and Dave who is the hotel manager is very helpful with any concerns you may have during your stay. They also have a travel expert right in the reception area who can help you plan activities (we decided to book a last minute snorkel trip which ended up being one of the highlights of our trip). Our room (F101) was very nice, clean and spacious with all of the amenities you have at home; stove, dishwasher, washer and dryer (which came in very handy and we came home with a suitcase full of clean clothes). And the view was breathtaking, we enjoyed sunsets from our lanai every evening! Parking was never a problem and we always found a spot close to our building. The resort is well situated and we found it to be accessible to all of the destinations we wanted to visit while in Maui. Lahaina and Black Rock beach are just a 5 minute drive away and Kahului is about 40 minutes. The Cannery Mall has a grocery store where you can buy all of your necessities. I would recommend this resort to anyone in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “quiet and nice but not very lively”
Reviews.Author: jsgfy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last in March 2011, 30 year old couple with no kids. Found the resort to be average, rooms were clean, staff was moderately friendly. Parking got expensive. View was nice, easy beach access. Parents and kids crowd. Groceries were convenient across the street. In the end I'd it was clean and quiet, but a little to expensive for the adventurous type, who don't spend a lot of time in their room If i could do it again I would try vacation rental by owner, and stay in Paia area.

Reviews.Title: “A Jaw Dropping View From A Great Condo”
Reviews.Author: 2travelersasof2001
Reviews.Content: I think my husband and I looked at reviews for every place to stay in Maui before we decided on this place. We originally wanted to stay in Kihei so it would be more central but we opted for wanting the ocean front view that seemed so much better at the Papakea. We were thrilled beyond believe when we arrived and found ourselves in one of the corner units like we had hoped for. Our A301 unit was all we could have asked for. The place was totally updated and very clean. We had read reviews by other complaining about the units they were getting. We took the time to look further into these reviews and found that almost all of them were coming from units that were NOT managed by Aston. For that reason as well as for the better cancellation policy if we were to need it, we booked through Aston. Very glad we did. I do have to say that we did not spend as much time in the room as we originally thought we would but still would spend the money on the ocean front room again. Nothing beats having a great condo that has a lanai that you can have your morning coffee while watching and listening to the waves. Thank goodness for the A/C as well. Even though we went in October, it still got pretty warm and humid. I will say that the bedroom has a hard time cooling down as the A/C unit is only in the living room. When we stay here again, we are going to stop at Walmart not far from the airport and pick up a big standing fan to help blow the A/C into the bedroom. We don't mind the cost because it is so worth it. We lucked out with the parking because of being in the "A" building. The parking is right there. There is a grocery store right across the street but it is VERY pricey. We were also told about the Kmart that is not far from the airport and stopped there before knowing about the Walmart. Don't bother with the Kmart. They are expensive and not a good selection at all. Also think anyone looking into this place should be aware that there is no "beach" access with this place. They have a very nice "green" area that is grass to lay out right above the water area and you can walk down some steps to get to the water but there is no "beach" here. We did not have a problem with that at all. An actual beach area is not that far away and we did not have the extra noise from people hanging out at a beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the others”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2011. I booked a few nights here, a few nights next door, and a few nights in Kihei. Booked through Hotwire so I didn't know what I was getting myself into... After all, it was fantastic! As a couple in our 30s, the first night was funny because this place is full of families and retirees. But the condo was fully equipped, with a kitchen, a playstation 2, king size bed, and the resort had two pools and jacuzzi's to unwind in after a day of visiting. The whole place is well kept, well landscaped and has ample security. Don't shop at the stores next door... Things are three times more expensive here than in Kihei, Kahului or even closer Kapalua. It really is worth the trip to the Kapalua grocers store to make things affordable/normal!!! Enjoy your stay here! It really is the best for the price we paid.... But be mindful of the 10$/day resort fee that I had to pay for, even after I was told upon check-in that it didn't apply to hotwire clients.... Parking is included... and smoking areas are in the parking lots!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Papakea last Spring. We were a little disappointed to get stuck with a second floor room when we had specifically called a few times several months in advance to request a ground floor with easy access to the beach. We we also disappointed with how our room seemed very out dated compared to the pictures online. When we conplained to be moved to the floor we had requested we were greeted with a very rude attitude of "oh forget it it"....blah..blah..so we were not happy. We wer also not impressed at all with how the condo made no effort to assist guests during the 2010 tsunamie. We found out by fluke late in the night that a tsunamie was heading our way and the police were telling people on the news to evacuate. you would think that the condo would want to help their guests fiind a safe location to evacuate to. Being that we were on the oceanfront we were terrified of staying the night so we followed the crew of others leaving in their rental cars to park on the hill. When we checked out no efforts were made to ease our comfort after the horrific experience. And then wheb we returned home we heard of others in maui at the same time who had gotten free nights offered, etc..etc.... I completed a survey twice to the condo and still got no response. So in that reguard...i am not impressed. otherwise the grounds were amazing.and it is a cab ride away from everything exciting. unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but don't book with Maui Dreams”
Reviews.Author: Pam L
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful but the condo we stayed in was really outdated The pull-out bed was all springs and both beds had dirty sheets. Who wants to clean all bedding your first day in Maui. This was not the fault of papakea but Maui Dreams. They didn't believe me about the sheets. The air conditioner is in the front. The bedroom was in the way back. Did not make it that far. No central air. Also the dishwasher overflowed. They did fix this. Some condos looked great and some did not. Book directly through Papakea and get details because the resort is beautiful and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View - TIRED Rooms - Awful parking!”
Reviews.Author: Wdav621
Reviews.Content: We are here with 2 other couples, each with their own rooms, so we've seen three 1-bedroom condos... All 3 are very tired (worn out) and in need of renovation. We all have ocean front rooms and the views are great. One final note, the parking is horrible - extremely narrow spaces and long walks to the rooms are the norm.

Reviews.Title: “The Papakea is for Lovers!!”
Reviews.Author: KOREY K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Papakea for 6 nights on our honeymoon and we loved it! The staff was ultra friendly and the grounds are maintained perfectly. We stayed in unit C308 and couldn't have asked for more. It appeared that this unit had been "modernized" with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, and everything needed to cook a meal inside if you chose to. The resort is in walking distance to eateries, gas station, and a grocery store,which we took full advantage of. We cooked on the grill one evening, and had a pleasant dinner on our lanai watching the sunset. Even though there is no beach, we enjoyed traveling to the neighboring beaches for our daily dose of sun and fun. My wife and I were a little skeptical about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but we were blown away by the overall apperance of the condo and experience at The Papakea!!! We recommend this resort to anyone that is considering staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st time to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: kansastravelr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Papakea in August of this year, and it was everything we hoped for. Very clean and awesome view from our lanai. Parking was great also. Staff were very helpful and polite. The peaceful atmosphere at night was great too. Will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around”
Reviews.Author: Ashlyn T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aston at Papakea at the beginning of the year and have just booked our pre-deployment getaway again for Oct 2011. When I stayed at this resort in Feb, we were a LITTLE DISAPPOINTED that our room had no view even though we booked an ocean view (only $15 more on Aston website). It seems that almost every room, minus a select few, have some sort of ocean view. We had asked to switch, but were told that another fee would apply and since we were on a tight budget to begin with and already paid for the ocean view room and since minimal time is spent in the room, we declined to pay the increase. The grounds were beautiful, rooms clean, staff friendly, and the location in perfect. All in all - other than asking us to pay extra even though we booked an ocean view, this is a great resort and we are happy to be returning. Fingers crossed for a glimpse of the ocean from our balcony this time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family condo rental!”
Reviews.Author: qwertygord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at papakea for our vacation to Hawaii while on Maui for 5 days. The condo we stayed in was managed by Maui dreams, and all our contact with them was fantastic. To note; Maui dreams offered to book our rental car for us claiming that they get cars much cheaper due to a corporate discount. We found their price to actually be about $100 more for the week than if we just booked it on orbitz or the like. We did book our car through Maui dreams (they use Alamo) ad when we called Alamo they just gave us the online rate. So don't fret if you've already booked through them, just call o get te best rate. Now off that tangent, the condo was magnificent. Beautiful lanai with an ocean view. Large bedrooms. One with king bed, other with double and twin bed, and loft with queen and two twins. No central ac, only one window unit and fans. The beach was a little disappointing. I had read on here that there was no beach, when u called Maui dream I questioned about this and I was assured that there was a beach. There is not one right in front if the condos. You have to walk to either end of the hotel property, which is easy. But we pretty much did not spend any time there. We went down to kaanapali, and up to napili, all distances too far to walk. The condos pool is really nice and clean, watch out for the gate, it closes fast and bites backs of heels! The first morning they offer you a free continental breakfast, which is pretty much a trap to get you to listen to the "local expedia expert" tell you that you need to do all these tours that are very expensive in order to see Maui the right way. It was somewhat beneficial to see geography of the island and local beaches, but unless your question has to do with Vito hung one if his trips, Troy, was not interested in helping. Ie finding a surf lession etc. This may differ person to person, but that was our experience. We did no paid tours of the Island and had a great time. We went to Haleakala in the middle of the day, spectacular! Actually people say sunset us better than sunrise! You can't bike from the top, only from the visitors center wich is so far down anyways you miss most of the views. Back to papakea. Our condo had putters in the closet for te golf course. But you had to rent tennis rackets and shuffleboard stuff ad they were like $8 an hour. Seemed too expensive to me. They had a little bit of laundry detergent, you will need to buy more if you plan on doing more than one load. There was def enough dish soap for the week though. all in all we had a really nice stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Still Dream of this Place...”
Reviews.Author: SpaGirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family to Papakea Beach resort. We stayed in a one bedroom condo on the first floor unit F110. It was part of Kannapali Keys at Papakea. We exchanged here with Interval International. It had a panoramic view of 2 neighboring islands and our room was only about 25 feet from the sea wall. The views were breath taking and looked like a postcard everyday. The unit was newly renovated with granite countertops and a beautiful new kitchen and bathroom. The closet was stocked with beach toys, chairs, snorkel gear to use and books to read. There was also a washer and dryer in the unit. Each evening everyone would gather in the front of the resort which is where we were for the nightly event of sunset. The sunsets were the most beautiful I have ever seen and everyone gathered with cameras and tripods to capture it. The resort is within walking distance or a short drive from a local grocery store and not far at all from the shops of Whalers Village. You would need to drive to Whalers Village. The beach is rocky in front of the Papakea and you can only go out when the tide is out but just next door at the neighboring resort there is a sandy beach that you can use. The Papakea is an older resort but is still very well maintained and very clean. It was quiet here with nice pools that were also clean. There were also grills to use and it seemed like a friendly neighborhood community in the evenings with everyone out grilling or playing mini golf on their small area. Some people even own their condos and live there year round. While staying at the Papakea we drove down to the Sheraton and snorkeled off the beach at Black Rock. This was the best free snorkeling! We saw beautiful fish and sea turtles there. We also drove the Road To Hana and hiked down into Haleakala crater. We would definately stay at the Papakea again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: SantaRosaSantaRosa
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Papakea Resort. It lived up to our expectations.The grounds were immaculate. The rooms in our 2 BR unit were small for 6 people. It was pretty noisy until late at night due to small children next door. The location was fine, with a grocery store & shops within walking distance. The water in both pools was pretty cold, but the spas were nearly scalding hot. We knew the beach was nearly non-existant, but there was a nice sandy beach next door. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all ... except for the smoker.”
Reviews.Author: DiggidyD0g
Reviews.Content: Loved the Papakea. Our room, J206, was updated nicely. Ocean view was beautiful. The grounds are well kept. The resort felt quiet, as in not too many people around. The kids had a blast at the pool. At first we thought that not having a beach out front was a downside, but in retrospect we really enjoyed lying on the lawnchairs on the grass in front of the seawall. You still get the ocean, but no sand in your stuff. Overall a wonderful time. We would stay there again. The only downside was the smoker next door. He ruined quite a few moments while we were sitting on the lanai. Also couldn't sleep with the sliding door open because the smell of smoke filled our room when he went for his evening smoke. We told the front desk several times, even doing some investigative work ourselves to find out who was smoking. The front desk said they would send security, but the problem persisted. Only until we checked out did they admit that it was probably an owner who was smoking and they can't do anything about it. To put this into perspective, when we arrived at the resort just after midnight, one of the things the security guard felt it necessary to tell us whas the absolute no-smoking policy on the resort. There are also signs everywhere about no-smoking. But it seems like only lip-service. Anyways, we will be back but will try and stay away from the smoker in J205.

Reviews.Title: “3 condos - all very nice”
Reviews.Author: mickgene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in C-306 while my brother's and sister's families had 2 other units. C-306 was by far the nicest on the inside as it was the most modernized. New kitchen; all tile floor; new bath. Despite the fact that the other units were closer to the beach, the views in all of the units were superb. All of the kitchens were nicely outfitted for doing some real cooking if you didn't want to go out. The only real problem was the ability to cool the entire unit with the living room AC wall unit. We all ended up with fans in the bedroom to make it comfortable enough for sleeping. But we left the fans behind; so anyone else at a later date will hopefully have the use of them. As has been said, the beach was not the best for lying out all day or even swimming. But choosing the right time of day to snorkel - it was good for snorkeling albeit difficult to get past the rocks and coral close in. We would all definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: joybob
Reviews.Content: We love the Papakea resort. My husband has plenty of coworkers who stay here when they visit Maui and so it came highly recommended. I read the reviews and I was nervous about booking from the front desk because it sounded risky as to what kind of unit we would end up with. We really wanted ocean front. After much searching, I booked unit F404 through VRBO. The unit was clean, spacious, and roomy for our family of four. Towels and linens are provided. The one flaw with this unit is that the beds are extremely uncomfortable. The pillows were the worst! If you stay here, bring your own pillows. The kitchen had plenty of dishes and silverware but the cooking pans were worn and scratched. They provided only metal spatulas for the no stick frying pans so I guess it made sense that they were all scratched! There are many great take out places nearby if you don't want to cook. L&L BBQ, Okazuya Deli, and a Ohana Taco's trailer were all really great places to take back to the condo. We also used the BBQ out by the pool and it was clean and did a perfect job of cooking our tri tip. I'm reading complaints about the lack of beach on the reveiws but having stayed at a resort with sandy beach a few years ago I really prefer the grassy area to sit and enjoy the ocean. You still have the waves right there and I didn't mind getting a little bit of exercise and going down a ways to the sandy beach if we were snorkeling or just wanting to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “A family place with all the amenities of a house.”
Reviews.Author: Frenchamericain
Reviews.Content: Stayed two weeks in unit C403 highest floor, partial ocean view but far from the front. Enjoyed the fully equipped kitchen and large bathrooms. The living room has A/C but not the sleeping rooms which were above 80F every night surprising considering Hawai is very tropical. The free Wifi internet measured .15 down & .10 up on avarage, slower than 3G, reminissent of dial-up, forget watching YouTube. No beach in front of the condos areas. Average pool. Great for families with young kids would not recommend for singles.

Reviews.Title: “A great home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: NNewbie07
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay if you are only staying on that side of island(lahaina). Far from airport about 30 mins. Hotel had all amenities you would need,just like home. We had b106,very clean,back patio was convenient to visit the pool &terrifc views,especially the awesome sunset-priceless! I would recommend &we will be back to this hotel whenever we stay in lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: TravAmerIntl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom ground floor garden view unit in building D. Our rental was a timeshare through Vacation Internationale. VI has standardized furnishings and accomodations in all it's locations so you know it will be clean and attractive. We loved being on the ground floor with the pond and fountain just off our Lanai, we even had a small ocean view from the lanai. What I don't like about the ground floor is that the bedroom is where the walking paths and elevators are. Regardless of how many signs there are about quiet hours, people ignore them and we heard all kinds of interesting conversations at the elevator when we were awakened in the middle of the night. Papakea no longer has a beach, but there is one next door which is a short walk. We didn't mind too much because Papakea is located so close to Kaanapali, Kahana & Napili beaches. Just took a couple of minutes in the carto get to get to any of them. Napili is excellent for snorkeling. I did not use the pools at all. I tried, but the pool was just too cold and the hot tub was too hot. The grounds were kept up very nice and were very attractive. Free Wifi is available in all units. Papakea is in a great location, I would recommend it if you are looking for a good valued condo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: DrOllie
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to an ocean view room because we were polite, it was amazing! We had a wonderful suite and gorgeous views! The only drawback(if there is one:)) was that they don't have a sandy beach, but walk 5 minutes and you'll find one. All in all great location great place and people!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! It just gets better and better”
Reviews.Author: mrwxman
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Papakea. It was supposed to be a weekender but we kept extending "one more day" for 3 additional days. Thanks to the awesome front desk staff for being so accommodating! As I said earlier, this was our 3rd trip and the 3rd different type of room we've stayed in. The first time we were in a 1 bedroom, ocean front. The second time we did an ocean view 2 bedroom and this time we did an ocean front studio. While all of the rooms are beautifully decorated have similar amenities, we've decided that the studio is our favorite because the bed is next to the sliding glass door so while in bed you can see and hear the ocean. This is one of the few resorts that look as good in person as it does on the website. The grounds crew works their tails off from sunrise to sunset - Speaking of the Ka'anapali sunset....The Papakea ocean front is the place to watch it. While there isn't much of a beach at this resort, the sister property to the south (a 2 minute walk) has a great beach and about 1/2 mile to the south is airport beach with some of the best snorkeling on the island. You won't regret a trip to the Aston Maui Papakea - for us, it's like going home.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean views, beautiful gardens and excellent service. Outstanding vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Skidaddyo
Reviews.Content: Taking a family of six, on vacation 4000 miles from home is complex and expensive. My wife and I spent a great deal of time researching prior to our trip. As you can imagine where to stay was a major consideration. This resort is managed and run professionally. I have to compliment Dave, Angela and the staff of Aston at Papakea Resort. Everything promised was delivered. Theyâ€™re truly hospitable and extra effort was taken each day. Iâ€™d encourage everyone to book directly through Aston and work with their employees. Resort grounds were very clean. Almost every room has a view of the ocean. The pool area was in good condition with plenty of loungers, tables, chairs and even gas grills surrounding the perimeter. It was nice to prepare family meals outside by the pool and maximize our relaxation time. The beach is close by and easy to access. There is a sea wall to stand on and watch the sunset each evening. Tennis courts, putting greens and shuffle board are available to enjoy. A mid-size convience store called ABC is just left of the resort entrance providing everything from groceries to t-shirts. Snorkel Bobâ€™s, across the street, rents gear by the week. The larger grocery store in the same mall carried inexpensive beach toys like boogie boards. Cheaper to buy than rent. Our experience with Aston Papakea was nothing short of outstanding. Weâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family gathering”
Reviews.Author: travel-len321
Reviews.Content: Ten family members gathered at the Papakea for a week of fun and relaxation. We had 2 three-bedroom oceanview units (on the 4th floor), and 1 one-bedroom ocean front unit (on the ground floor). While not all of the units had been updated, they were all clean and comfortable, and the kitchens were well-supplied with dishes, utensils, etc. The location is fantastic, with unbeatable views from all three of the units. The grounds are immaculately kept and the two pools never felt crowded. There are numerous propane grills on the grounds. The nearby market and ABC store were very convenient. This was a quiet and relaxing place to be. It was family friendly, catering to the needs of all of us from age 7 to 67. The ample free parking was appreciated as was the free wi-fi. This will be our go-to place for future trips to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Trip”
Reviews.Author: sblibra86
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Papakea Resort in Maui Hawaii! All staff we met were kind and courteous. Our view was exactly what we expected. Some Cons about our stay: We had a mishap with the oven it was consistenly beeping however they moved us to another vacant condo and took care of us swifting and kindly. All the condos are not exactly the same. Ex. 1st one had an ice chest 2nd one didnt. Not all of them have the same exact decor nor the same stocked items in the kitchen. Our a/c leaked and had to be repaired while we were there. You have to walk to the next property over for a sandy beach its all rock and no sand right in front of papakea. Pros- View- watched the sunset from our lanai at dinner almost every night. Location- right across the street from a grocery store, some restaurants, snorkel bobs,shops and a nail salon. all within walking distance! Grounds- The grounds are gorgeous i just got lost taking pictures of all the amazing plants. Quiet place no loud partiers very respectful common areas. All in all it was a great experience and i would definitely choose Papakea again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing home away from home in the middle of it all!!”
Reviews.Author: WmandEm
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation through Costco Travel and never having been to Maui, took a chance on Papakea...we were not disappointed!! We were traveling with another family and we each booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit. Our unit was E402, and it was not updated, but very clean, comfortable and roomy. Our friends got E405 and their unit was updated with new cabinets, granite countertops, stainless appliances, and beautifully remodeled bathrooms. It also had a fun "surfer" themed decor. Both units had awesome views of the beautiful grounds and the ocean. What I loved the most about Papakea was that it felt secluded and quiet even though it was located on a stretch of many other ocean front vacation resorts. I think this is because there is no swimmable beach out front. At first, I thought this was a bad thing, but then when I walked the very short distance to the beach next door, I realized that the beach attracted a lot of people and noise. It was nice that we were so close to the beach, but we didn't have to deal with all of the people. Other good things were the sparkling clean pools and spas, absolutely gorgeous landscaping, many clean poolside BBQ grills, ample FREE parking, daily beach towel service, daily housekeeping, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, ideal location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelflower12
Reviews.Content: Go to the orientation run by Expedia. They can suggest best adventures. Ask for Troy. The decor in the rooms is a little '80s style but the condos are so spacious and you won't be in your room much anyway. The kitchen is fully stocked. The staff and service was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: 4fun5games
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days, very satisfied with the accomodations. Even though you had to walk to the beach it was not bad. Also was able to walk to the ABC store for coffee in the morning. We ate at Lahaine on the Beach also our favorite was Aloha Mixed Plate. We ate there twice, this is were the locals eat. Lahaina Harbor town was nice but if you find a souvenir made out of wood you should just get it there. We went to Oahu and the souvenirs that we saw in Maui we did not see in any other Island. We also went to the road to Hana, I highly recommend to get the travel book from Frommer or Maui for Dummies. Very helpful, I borrowed it from the library.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Beautiful to Boot!”
Reviews.Author: Kev38
Reviews.Content: Here for only two days on business and stayed in condo G104. For the $$, you can't beat this place. It's quiet and the condos have all the amenities of home. I've stayed everywhere on this island from the high $$ resorts to timeshare condos and i think this place is the best value on the island. I'd surely come here on my own dime!

Reviews.Title: “ok but would not stay in D401 again”
Reviews.Author: Dale15
Reviews.Content: The resort was ok. Grounds clean, pool clean. There was a security walking around which was nice but they liked to enforce alot of rules. "No jumping in pool, no throwing a ball in the pool, no drinking at pool, ..." There was no beach, just rocks. D401 was where we stayed. The actually condo advertised view which was a huge stretch. It was surfaced clean but dont look under the bed or dresser. Definetly no recent updates in the last 50 years. Minimal cupbards to put food away and fridge small. Dont expect any left over spicies or butter the maids clean up and take everything. No towels, no toys. Other condos closer to the water would have been nice, and many of those were updated.

Reviews.Title: “We love it here and we ALWAYS come back”
Reviews.Author: 2mauime
Reviews.Content: This place is great....beautiful grounds, friendly staff, and close to all things wonderful. We rented from Maui Dreams, we have before on several occasions and have been very happy with our condos, and their customer service. We stayed in H 301. It is on the corner, has a great view of the property and the ocean. It is close to the elevator and the parking. The pools are nice and well maintained. It is homey. The bed is wonderful! The tv was on the fritz. We called and spoke to our special rental person, Misty, and she made arrangements to get us a new tv. She was on vacation, but she had it purchased and installed for us. Might seem dumb on our part, but vacation is the only time we get to watch tv! In the past we have rented from other companies but for the quality of the privately owned homes and the value it is the best. We are planning on coming back in the fall. We will stay here again. Thankyou Misty....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip!!”
Reviews.Author: islabound
Reviews.Content: We just got back home from an awesome 7 night stay at the Papakea Resort and absolutely loved it . We had a great room H204 . It was clean, updated,and comfortable . We had a great view and met lots of friendly people . The grouds are absolutely beautiful. We also liked the Expedia first morning informational breakfast . We booked our package deal through Travelocity , and had flawless check in / out.
