I would definaltely recommend Papakea ,there is great snorkleing just a few blocks away at Kaanapali, and the Piiholo Ranch Zipline is a blast!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at Nice property”
Reviews.Author: gm4pack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 3rd week of April 2011 for 7 nights in one bedroom condo through Aston with a ocean/garden view. Check-in was fairly easy although we did have to wait until slightly after 3pm to be able to get into our room. The unit we stayed in had a newly renovated bathroom and kitchen which were very nicely done. The things which could have used updating were the carpet, bedroom decor and A/C to make it superb, but overall we enjoyed our stay. The single A/C unit in the living room would struggle to cool the bedroom, but we made do as there was ceiling fan and floor fan available, plus it's not like it gets really hot, but someone who likes their room freezing might complain. There was an Flat panel TV in the living room and bedroom. Housekeeping is available everyday if needed. The grounds are very nice, with two pools. Although we were told only one (Lanai) was heated, both pools were comfortable and were well used by the guests but never too crowded. If you are here to lie on the beach at your resort this is not place for you as of now. Due to numerous factors (tsunami and extra high tides due to moon being closer to Earth this year), the beach completely disappears at high tide. You can walk down to your left on the beach across the little bridge to the beach at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. We were fine using lounge chairs on the grass above the beach. A previous reviewer said something about it being a sewer drainage point being right beside the hotel, but it appears actually be a stream bed that is only active when heavy rain water flows down from the West Maui mountains from the Honokowai reservoir. We snorkeled right out of the hotel in clear water - saw many fish even a couple of turtles. There are BBQ grills available near the pool for those who want to grill out. The location is pretty good although as one reviewer noted this is really in Honokowai rather than in Kaanapali. There is a shopping center right across the road with several restaurants and a large grocery store. It is about a 10 minute drive from downtown Lahaina. The free high speed internet worked fairly well with many connections available, but strength could be better, and at peak usage times it could be pretty slow. Full kitchen allowed us to cook several meals here rather than always eating out which can be expensive in Hawaii. If you stay in the units (x01 or x08) at the end of the building you will get extra light in the until as you will have side window. From the outside it's hard to tell which units are Aston vs. personal units but most looked pretty good. All in we really enjoyed our stay. This is probably the our preferred Aston resort of the ones we saw on Maui - quieter and less crowded than Kaanapali Shores, the Whaler or Mahana (which were all nice), with a better location and more up to date than some of the others we saw (Banyan, Lu and Kaanapali Villas). All in all I would say this definitely met our needs while in Maui. We checked out many beaches (Old Airport has nice park and Kaanapali Bay is nice but can get crowded), did the Haleakala sunrise (a must but not sure would do bike ride again). road to Hana, Trilogy Molokini snorkel trip (very good), Surfing Goat Dairy (yummy) plus much more. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Ocean front”
Reviews.Author: Msjaguar
Reviews.Content: We rented an ocean front studio here and were very satisfied. It was only 3 star but it worked. We could fall asleep to the sound of the waves. The grounds were full of torch ginger and very well maintained. We had a murphy bed but it had a very comfortable thick mattress. The decor was up to date with full kitchen. On the down side the A/C needed updating as it was right next to the bed. ( Needs a wall mount). The beach disappears @ high tide. They do have a large pool and jacussi.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Property”
Reviews.Author: lawlords
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another stay at Papakea (our fifteenth). There is nowhere else we would consider staying in Maui. Five minutes to the world famous golf courses of Kapalua and Kaanapali. Seven minutes to lovely Lahaina Town. Oceanfront views of Lanai and Molokai. Three tennis courts, twelve barbecues, two putting greens, two swimming pools, two koi ponds, two hot tubs all situated on an idyllic piece of property directly on the ocean front of Maui. It truly is paradise. There is nothing like barbecuing dinner poolside as the sun sets between Molokai and Lanai off the coast. Unit was a direct ocean front unit that looked like you could walk off the balcony directly into the ocean. Left the sliding glass door open all night listening to the crashing of the waves outside. PURE PARADISE! If you never get the chance to stay at Papakea, you will have missed out on a wonderful experience. Staff was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “I miss this place already......”
Reviews.Author: virgintrvlr
Reviews.Content: This is with regards to Condo C306 or VRBO listing #129942. I was really leery about staying at this condo only because there werenâ€™t any reviews for some time, didnâ€™t know to much about Maui other then the research I was doing online. Didnâ€™t really want to stay at one of the fancier hotels but didnâ€™t want a dump either. The only thing that I had nailed down was location. When planning our trip we thought if we could stay somewhere close to Lahiana but not to close cause we really wanted a place to just relax but close enough so that it wouldnâ€™t feel like an hour long car ride into town. Somewhere where basic necessities IE: grocery store, restaurants and Oh yeah the beach. These would have to be close by. Though we didnâ€™t have a wake up and walk onto the Lanai and have the Ocean right in front of us experience. This 3rd floor one bedroom condo was just fine. We loved the place. Iâ€™m so happy that we choose this location, this resort, this condo. It worked out so well and after visiting a couple of the resorts down the street (Westin, Sheraton etc etc) I cant begin to tell you how satisfied we were to have chosen this condo. The one and only downfall of this resort not condo but resort is that you have to walk at least 10-20 mins to get to a nice stretch of beach. I mean the beach is right there but you still have to walk a little to avoid the rocks and make it to a better part of the beach. Just something to think about if you are into staying at the beach all day long. Thatâ€™s it though. The owner of this condo was friendly and very accommodating and reasonable as well. Resort wide free WIFI was very convenient. Having Times Supermarket and Paradiso Pizza across the street was just great. ABC next door was perfect for a quick beer run. We would and are planning on returning to Maui and will stay at this location again. Thanks BD.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great anniversary at the Aston at Papakea!”
Reviews.Author: Galacticcelt
Reviews.Content: We were referred to the Aston at Papakea by a friend who had been in Maui several times, so we booked our room for a week of anniversary fun! Afterward, I began to read several of the trip adviser reviews that were fairly negative and began to be concerned. Happy to report that our experience was definitely a positive one. We had a great time, enjoyed the lovely views from our lanai (especially our first morning there, where we got to see a beautiful rainbow) and walking the grounds. I wish there was beach access on grounds, but it's a small complaint - everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: 154913Jen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Maui with our 2 very young children not knowing how lrelaxing our trip would be. Luckily, Misty at 'Maui Dreams Come True' helped us book a room on ground level, close to the pool and ocean, with a fantastic view, G108! Exactly what I specified! The condo was in such a great location, we could easily come in and out of our room right to the pool or ocean! My children loved playing with bubbles every morning at 5:30am on the grass right outside our lanai while we had our breakfast and KONA coffee! The facilities were clean, the grounds were beautiful! We watched whales from our lanai and the sunsets were amazing! I loved the morning yoga session at the waters edge! We were pleasantly surprised that the farmers market, shops and grocery store were all within walking distance! We will definetly recommend this resort to our friends and family and will be back soon! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at Papakea”
Reviews.Author: DL16
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent a week at Papakea and we had an amazing time. It is a beautiful resort, very well maintained and extremely well located (there is a grocery right in front, Kaanapali beach (and the whalers village) is at about 5 minutes and Lahaina at 10 min). We rented the unit (1 bedroom, garden view, with full kitchen and living area) directly through Aston's website following the different reviews on trip advisor and I'm assuming it was the right decision because the unit we got was beautiful. There was room service every day and there is sufficient parking spaces for everybody. The people working at the reception are nice and professional. All of that to say we had an amazing time and would not hesitate one second to come back to Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome back!”
Reviews.Author: wewannagoagain
Reviews.Content: We came back to the Papakea for an all-too-brief stay at the end of March. We stayed there for 2 nights, but wish we could have spent more time at the Papakea. We were in unit L103, which is ground level ocean front. The view from our room was amazing, and the first view we had of the whales was directly from our living room! We took the beach chairs provided and sat at the edge of the lawn watching the whales frolic for hours--that is what we went to Maui for! The kitchen was well stocked, although I don't cook on vacation. There was a toaster, so we were able to fix some bagels to get us going early in the morning. The master bedroom had a nice bathroom, and the second bathroom was in the hallway. The second bedroom had twin beds, which my daughter said were not very comfortable--otherwise everything in the unit was perfect! We arrived late in the evening and were greeted with warm alohas and big smiles. The check-out experience was equally pleasant. The concierge did a great presentation on island activities as we munched on fresh fruit and pastries the morning after our arrival. We didn't book anything through her, as we had booked with our travel agent at home. If there is something that you HAVE to do while in Maui, don't wait until you arrive to book--activities sell out, so book with your travel agent. If you are so-so on an activity, then book while there. There is lots to do, and sometimes just winging it is better than having every moment planned in advance. The staff that we encountered on property were so friendly--the gardener, housekeeping, and the security guard all made us feel very welcome. I can't wait to return to the Papakea again!

Reviews.Title: “good location, reasonable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ajs4travel
Reviews.Content: We rented an owner rental through the management company "Maui Dreams Come True". Aston handles all the front desk for them, and were as helpful as they could be given the circumstances. They also do a good job maintaining the grounds and facilities. We ended up satisfied with our stay, since MDCT did provide a clean & comfortable unit, on the ground floor with ocean & pool view, K103. However if you needed to communicate with them, other than giving them your money, good luck. It was windy enough during our stay for the unit to stay fairly cool with the ceiling fans. One bizarre thing about the kitchen was that there were lots of frying pans but only one pot, and no lids for any of them! The unit was reasonably priced (probably at quite a discount from Aston) so is being rated as a good value. We were just glad that we didn't need to contact MDCT while on-site. It might be worth paying extra to get the peace of mind from Aston, but then we might have chosen to stay on a better stretch of beach (you can't swim off Papakea's beach).

Reviews.Title: “Will stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: ymakins
Reviews.Content: We rented a 1 br 1 ba with loft from Maui Dreams Come True, a private rental company in Lahaina. The unit (D 401) that we rented was privately owned. We did not plan ahead too much, so getting a sort-of-2 br unit for the price we paid (225/ni incl tax and cleaning) was very difficult. Price quote from Papakea directly was much higher, but the unit was probably nicer. The rental company was easy to deal with, but Misty was not entirely honest. When I asked if the resort is on a sandy swim beach, the answer was that it's on the end of Kaanapali Beach. Well, Kaanapali beach gets smaller and smaller until the ocean comes right up to the sea wall, right at Papakea (which ironically means 'white sands'). There is also a storm drain outlet right next to Papakea, so swimming in the ocean there was not appealing. You can walk to Kaanapali, but it takes about 15 minutes before you get to a quality beach that is wide enough. She also said that you can walk the entire length of Kaanapali beach (2 mi) on a paved trail. Not true. You have some beach, some sea walls, some paved paths and some trespassing. The grounds at Papakea are very nice and clean. Beautifully manicured gardens, pretty plants, koi ponds (beware the sound of frogs at night if this bothers you), shuffleboard, putting, 2 pools with hot tubs and grills. The pools are COLD, even the "heated" pool was too cold for us to dip in. The staff is adequate but not overly friendly or helpful. Don't bother showing up a second before 4pm if you rent from Maui Dreams Come True. They will not lt you in early even if the condo is ready (per the rental co's rules). People staying there were retirees and families, so it was quiet at night. It was REALLY windy when we were there, and seemed to be windier at Papakea than other areas on that part of Maui. The gusting palms made for really poor sleep. The buildings are made of concrete, so you don't hear the people next door. The location of Papakea in my opinion was bad. Everything says it's on Kaanapali, but it's really Honokowai. It depends on what you want. I wanted to be on a swim beach, so Napili would have been the best with a toddler. There is a grocery store across the street from Papakea, some stores, and a beach park a 5 min walk away that is protected for small children with an ok playground. Don't bother with the "Farmer's Market" it's just stuff from the grocery store put on tables in the parking lot. If you want to go to a bar, there's one at the resort next door (I wouldn't stay there either - the place was so crowded, the pool looked like people soup). The unit was almost adequate. Washer/dryer was convenient. There is a window AC unit that we didn't use that's blocked by the entertainment stand. The place is really tired and needs a fresh coat of paint and new furniture. The bed in the loft is horrible. The bathroom needs to be gutted. The kitchen was supplied with the bare minimum. Not enough pots and pans to cook a meal for 4 adults and poor supply of utensils, servingware and bowls. No baggies, foil, tupperware, etc. Only enough detergent, paper towels and TP to start off with. No blowdryer. Enough towels for 4 people only (unit can sleep 7 which I do not recommend). No beach chairs, towels, coolers or beach toys. My advice: plan ahead and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “G 103 , awesome”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo9596
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, checkin was smooth and informative . Unit G103 is privately owned and stocked with coolers,flippers,boogie boards,beach chairs. The layout is great, roomy for a family of four, BBQ area is great as is the choice of pools. Upon checkin(Saturday) we inquired about the kids camp which is offered on monday and thursday. We were given a brochure detailing the ages and activities the kids could do. We were told we could book the next day for the Monday camp . On Sunday we went to Aston kaanapalli to book and ask a bit more about it. We were told we could phone and make a reservation for the kids or just show up the next day at 7:50 am to book for the 8:00 am camp. We left a message with the kids camp reservation line stating our unit and contact info. We did not receive a call back so assumed everything was on. We had made plans for us while the kids where away for the day. Upon arrival at the kids camp we gave our unit number and were informed that since our unit is privately owned, insurance would not cover the kids. They were very disappointed not to be going , as was I . My husband had left already to golf and had the car and I had spa treatments booked which I had to cancel. When I told the front desk my dissatisfaction with the misleading information, I was given a , oh sorry, and was rudely spoken to. The resort it self is great yet the front desk clerks could be more informative and not hand out info that doesn 't apply to every unit.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo”
Reviews.Author: standpood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Papakea last week and had an amazing customer service experience. Not only is all the staff friendly, welcoming, and terrific at this resort, but the Concierge made my trip! When I left to go to Oahu, I realized too late that I had forgotten my eye glasses on the night table next to my bed. I called housekeeping, who was holding on to my glasses for me, then Troy Yamauchi, the Concierge. Troy immediately leaped into action, retrieved my glasses from housekeeping, obtained the proper shipping materials, and at 2:00 had my glasses ready for UPS to pick up. Although I am sure that Troy had lots of other guests to help that day, he made me feel like I was the only one. Thank you, Troy, for saving my trip and for being the highlight of my stay! Your guests are lucky to have you and all the other wonderful staff at the Papakea!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Willcox1
Reviews.Content: There are nicer hotels/resorts on Maui no doubt about it but Papakea is also very nice and well worth the money. It is ridiculous what some resorts charge for half the amenities. Not every room here will be the same since many are individually owned and the views will of course vary but this is a great, relaxing, resort with everything you need. Why stuff yourself into a 300/400 square foot box when you can have 600+ with a full kitchen and living room. They have nice propane grills around the pool to use, elevators, hot tubs, tennis courts and beach front views. Great mix of people, adequate FREE parking, great location, security, family friendly, and much more. It is far from the airport is the only negative I can find. We saw whales breach from our patio, heard waves crash at night, met nice people and would come back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “so relaxing !”
Reviews.Author: cuin5
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks here - loved it very much !! the condo was great - the gardens are gorgeous. We saw whales from shore every day - it amazed us each time ! the grocery store across the street has everything . We loved the access to the long walk way along the beach and hotels nearby. We wish we could go back already! a wonderful place to wind down, renew your energy and your spirit !

Reviews.Title: “This resort is amazing”
Reviews.Author: tomcatauto
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let you know that our stay at Papakea was most excellent, as usual. We canâ€™t say enough about your Misty, you have a gem there Jim. As my mother stays on at Papakea when Tom and I come home she changes to a smaller unit. Misty makes sure she has either her new unit ready early or that she can stay in the existing unit later than 11 am. I canâ€™t tell you how good that makes us feel as my Mom is getting a little older itâ€™s so nice to know that she is takin care of by Misty. I just wanted to let you know that you are very lucky to have her as your front line spokesperson, in having our own business we know how important that is. Aloha and we look forward to our next years stay at Papkea. Ann and Tom Lowery Victoria, B.C Canada

Reviews.Title: “Call ahead to make sure your getting the room you reserve!”
Reviews.Author: rashirley
Reviews.Content: I booked a "ocean front room" about 9 months in advance of my trip to Maui. This was to be a special occasion trip and we wanted to see the whales from our room. Upon arrival we were told that they were overbooked and could not accomidate our reservation. so we were put into a "ocean view room". After a little complaining to the manager the next morning, we were given a hefty discount on the room, and one night was thrown in free. Other than the room mix up this is a great resort. Great ocean views, and we did stil get to see the whales right from our room, and from the shore. All in all we will not hesitate to go back to the Papakea again, but next time I am calling them to make sure I get the room I reserve!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: invilia
Reviews.Content: i was there with my husband & my parents for 7 days in late January. we originally booked a two bedroom (one + loft) & 1 bathroom. they upgraded us to a 2 bed + loft & two bathrooms which we are thankfull for so each couple had a separate bathroom to use. the condo is a bit dated, we were in d405 which is on the top floor. the kitchen was fully equiped with a dishwasher & dishwasher tablets provided, a coffee maker, microwave, cutleries, dishes. the laundry had a dryer & washing machine & the washing powder was also provided which was nice. they also provided beach towels & towels, soap, shampoo, etc. the rooms were spacious & we had a balcony overlooking the ocean & pool. the resort had two pools & spas, one is heated & we mainly used that one because the water in the other one is too cold. the pools were never too busy. they also provide beach lounges along the beach. we spent a lot of time just looking out for whales. it was so amazing that there were so many & you didn't need to go on a cruise to see one. there's an abc store right at the front gate & several other stores nearby which was handy overall the resort was quiet & wonderful. we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “MAUI great, Papakea okay”
Reviews.Author: jmpaul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Papakea resort for a week with my extended family, we stayed in the "K" building room 101 was dirty and outdated. The property manager "Misty" was extremely rude and unwilling to provide any assistance. We also rented rooms 103 and 105 whcih were okay but they really need to be updated, lamps should work, screen doors should open and close with ease. It was extremely unfortunate that the property management companies did not take more of an interest in what they were renting out for an incredible amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea resort stay”
Reviews.Author: elphiebird
Reviews.Content: I rented several condos at Papakea resort while we were on the island for my son's wedding. We loved the location and proximity to everything. The grounds were great. What you need to be careful of is that each unit is in a different condition. We were unlucky to have rented ours through a property management company named "Maui dreams come true" they claim to have hand picked the units they rent and that each one is recently upgraded and refurbished. Also that they are giving you 50% discounted rates. Do not believe them. Our unit through them was in terrible condition. It had not been either upgraded or refurbished and it was also only surface cleaned. The furnishings and decor were in poor condition also. They claimed to have given me the lowest rate but rented a unit next door to my son for 100$ a night less...When I talked to them after arriving the contact person (Mitsy) just denied all my claims even though I was in the unit living with the filth. I sent pictures and she still was not willing to agree. Unfortunately it is the only flaw for the week of our sons wedding.

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back, Great location for excellent value”
Reviews.Author: beachforever
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through VRBO, these condo's are privately owned (We stayed at K101). Our stay was from Dec 11-20 and we were then heading to Honolulu/Waikiki and then Kauai (staying at the Outrigger Kiahuna Plantation - See my other review on this). Now that I have something to compare this condo with to another one in Hawaii, this condo by far was MUCH better in terms of the feel and atmosphere of living accommodations, especially because I was travelling with a 10-month old baby. CAVEAT...each unit and what they provide will differ as these are individually owned. So my review can only speak to this specific unit. To fully see the island, must rent a car. We rented through dollar and I kept checking every few weeks for the best price. I just kept rebooking every few weeks and eventually the rate went down over $100 from when I initially booked. GOOD THINGS: - location location location: walking distance to a park for kids, farmer's market, grocery store (ABC Store, Times Grocery), take-out food (DO TRY THE L&L HAWAIIAN BBQ!). - 5-minute drive to the Safeway grocery store and small mall. Across the street from Safeway is a small strip mall with about 20 stores (Boarders, Foot Locker). There are free hula shows on certain nights. - free WiFi (although it runs very very slow - putting green (which was fantastic for baby to crawl on the soft grass) - gas bbq's (we used them 3 times) - the grounds are in excellent condition and well-kept, koi ponds clean. UNIT SPECIFIC - we were on the ground floor very close to the pool and ocean. With a baby (and stroller), it was key to be on the ground floor. It was nice to just walk out on our lanai (porch) and head to the pool or beach from the lanai - pack n' play available in the unit (I don't think all units have this and you may have to pay to rent one or just buy one at the store). - the kitchen was fully stocked (unlike at the Outrigger). You truly feel at home with the appliances and kitchen utensils. Sandwich bags, foil, salt/pepper/spices, coffee filters etc...all provided - keyless entry (punch in a code affixed to the door) ONLY COMPLAINTS: - front desk only available until 11pm. Although we didn't have any problems, we were informed that we had to check in to get a parking pass and we arrived after 11pm. Not a big issue - parking was hard to find in our building area ("K") if you arrived late in the evening (but we were there in high season so we understood. THINGS TO DO/SEE: - Drove to Kapalua (DT Fleming Park), we watched the surfers and checked out the golf courses (apparently you can go on a free tour of the course) - Baby Beach (off of Front Street, very calm waters for babies/kids) and Big Beach (gorgeous - waves are rough) - Molokini Tour - we saw whales, sea turtles and a rare monk seal along the way! - Drove to Keihi and Wailea and checked out their beaches, shopped at the malls (Shops at Wailea) and walked along the grounds of the Marriott and Grand Wailea - If you go to Whalers Village, if you spend $15 then your parking in the parking garage is free

Reviews.Title: “Get the oceanfront room! Beautiful views and beach access!”
Reviews.Author: AggieDaner
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay in one of the oceanfront rooms on the first floor in this hotel and it was SO worth it! You are literally just steps away from the beautiful beach, and in the living room you can leave your patio door wide open (screen closed if you want) and just completely bliss out to the sound of the waves. We loved having a kitchen and living room! The bedroom was OK, but we spent the vast majority of the time out by the beach and out enjoying everything Maui has to offer, so it didn't bother us in the slightest that it wasn't the pinnacle of luxury. You're right next to several other hotels, so even though this particular place doesn't have a restaurant or spa, you don't have to walk more than 5 minutes to get to one. I'm not sure how much I would have liked it if we hadn't gotten the ocean front room, though. I PROMISE that upgrade is 100% worth it! Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: luv2tlk2
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Maui and Papakea. Last year we had an ocean view room and this year we booked an ocean front room which was wonderful. We stayed in F109 and it was so nice to be on the ground floor with green grass and ocean right out the slider. We spent two weeks and we enjoyed every day there. I know that some people write bad reviews about Papakea, but my husband and I love it there and we are all ready planning our trip for next year. The people who work there are friendly and so very helpful. We are always impressed with how the grounds are taken care of. It was great using the BBQ's for cooking dinner and having the grocery store within walking distance. My husband and I love Papakea and hope to make it our annual vacation spot for years to come. Thanks to everyone at Papakea for making our trips so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “"Overpriced outdated old condo"”
Reviews.Author: Missy47619
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the big island, Hawaii, before coming to Maui. We got a lovely 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom full kitchen modern condo with huge wrap around lanai on the golf course, Aston Shores, for $600 less than the 1-bedroom, 1-bathroom, slum apartment condo in Maui. We were horrified. The manager wouldn't even give me the time of day when I complained. Reception was unfriendly and I talked to another vacationer that had her travel agent move her to another Aston resort from this one for $1500 more which she said she will not pay. We will never trust Aston resorts again. And the beach is all walled off you have to walk to resorts down the beach to enjoy the sand and water :( The bathroom door is a slide-closet like door.

Reviews.Title: “Mice also using A307”
Reviews.Author: Claireknits
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long day of travel to the Aston Papakea and the resort is certainly not one of the newer properties on the island but at first glance looked maintained. We had booked and one bedroom ocean front room with a King bed. We headed over to our room in building A unit 307, the view was wonderful and that was pretty much it. The unit was very small, and the kitchen and bathroom had been renovated. Iâ€™m not exactly sure when the cleaning crew had last been to our room as the kitchen needed to be wiped down and surfaces certainly werenâ€™t clean. I donâ€™t mind cleaning but not the day I arrive, before I can put our things away. The bathroom was very small but thankfully it was clean. The king bed that we thought we would be sleeping in was really a full. Iâ€™m not sure how it can be booked as a king and we get a full. Realizing that the unit might be a bit small for our family I called down to the front desk to check availability on a larger 2 bedroom unit and was informed the property was completely booked. While on the phone my oldest son starts to open the pullout bed. When you hear â€œMom can you come hereâ€� you know something is up! Yes it was, in the middle of the bed were brown droppings. I put said droppings in a tissue and on our way out to meet friends and have dinner stop by front desk. I must have been tired because the gal at the front desk didnâ€™t even seem fazed, she was apologetic but not shocked or surprised. She immediately called housekeeping to change the linens and we headed out to dinner. After picking up a few things in Lahaina for breakfast we get settled for the night. As my kids are getting ready for bed Iâ€™m reading through the information the front desk gave us and come across a pamphlet about the feral cats on the propertyâ€¦I should have clued in at that point we might have mice or rats but tired I put it out of my mind and went to bed. As Iâ€™m falling asleep my husband comes in and says there are more droppings in the carpet around where pull out is. I mumble Iâ€™ll look again in the morning and try and get some rest. Upon waking I head into the kitchen to make some coffee and investigate around the pull out bed. I look on top of the fridge and some pull apart bread we had bought at Foodland for breakfast had been nibbled. At first I thought one of my family members may have tried it. Nope no one had touched it since I put it on the fridgeâ€¦.after some investigating behind around the pullout I look behind and the first picture is what we found. No denying that there were mice or rats running around in our room during the night! My husband immediately got on the phone with the front desk and Expedia. As we were packing up and leaving we see the notices on the door about the routine pest spraying in the units. I donâ€™t really go on vacation so that I can have my family subjected to pesticides! We were supposed to stay at the Papakea resort for 8 nights and instead headed over to the Westin Villas. The only real positive that I can say about the property other than the view is that George at the front desk was very helpful. Called to make sure that we were able to find another place to stay and helpful in getting a refund through Expedia. After looking at the negative review on trip advisor and seeing another guest with a mousetrap in the room I was more surprised by the indignation of the General Manager who said this in November; â€œThe statements regarding a mouse are absurd we have not had a report of a mouse or rat since I have been here three years. We maintain a constant pest control spraying program with a licensed pest control company. We have one ferral cat per acre, 11 total and there are no mice anywhere to be found. That is an insult to the entire property.â€� I think they may need a few more cats, and certainly around building A and let guests know that when you plan your quarterly pest control spraying so they could make other arrangements if they are bothered by such things!

Reviews.Title: “Needs an Update - Highly Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Meadowlark1959
Reviews.Content: The units in this complex are individually owned, but managed by Aston. I'm not quite sure what Aston charges for their services, but the owners are getting ripped off if part of their 'fees' to Aston includes regular maintenance on the units. The units themsevlves had excellent views (F Building) and exceptional beach access - literally walk across the 50 or so feet of lawn and there was the ocean. However, both of our units were in desparate need of a complete overhaul and update, including the furniture (think 1980's pastel pinks and greens). The walls were disgustingly dirtly, there was evidence of extreme, but poor patching jobs in the door jams, walls, etc. The kitchens were dated, but well appointed with necessary equipment for cooking light meals for families, and of course, the necessary washer and dryer. I would suggest this resort for families with young kids (they are everywhere!) as the kids could not do much damage to the already dilapidated condition of the units. Also, be aware that some of the units have air conditioning and some do not. This is not a problem during the day, however, when you close up the units at night for sleeping, the musty, stagnant smell of the unit is very irritating and makes a comfortable sleep nearly impossible. Our unit owner placed an irrtating fan (airplane engine noise) in the bedroom and a barely functioning ceiling fan - no help there. The bathrooms contained a single person 3x3 shower stall and one bangs his/her arms on the walls when one attempts to wash hair or body. Very uncomfortable for those who exceed 5'9 feet in height. The bedrooms are in the rear of the unit along the pathway that unites each of the units. The noise from passersby is extremely irritating. Due to the type of windows (slated glass panes) - there is no solution for this problem. For what they charge at this complex, you can stay at the Hotel Maui with much nicer (and quieter) grounds, yet no beach access. I would not stay here again and definitely do not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds, Nice view”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiigirl44
Reviews.Content: Our suite was a one bedroom with a full kitchen. Very nice view of the grounds and partial ocean view. The bedroom was in the back of the suite and it was an interesting layout but I slept on the couch in the living room. Nice pool with hot tub and barbecues. Close to a grocery store. Close to the best snorkeling beach I have encountered, Kaanapali beach. The room seemed clean and tidy. Staff was pleasant to us. Parking was easy. There was a washer and dryer in our suite. There were little ants 'nonos' around but that's all part of staying in an ocean front hotel on this side of Maui. They didn't bother us, just keep your food in the fridge or sealed. Beautiful grounds at this hotel. Nice chaise lounge chairs on the strip of grass right on the ocean, great place to watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: mkram
Reviews.Content: We had booked an Ocean View, but we were given a room (J206) which was a partial ocean view. The room itself was well maintained, clean and the kitchen well equipped. Other guests and staff were very friendly. Mini golf was good as well. We did our laundry and after running the dryer for 15 minutes, the smoke alarm went off. It took us a few minutes to figure out that the dryer was the culprit. So we had to disconnect the smoke alarm and restart the dryer. High Speed internet was only as fast as dialup. Other than these small annoyances the place was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Bunkie101
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a quiet place to spend a holiday. The grounds are beautiful and the maintenance staff does such a good job of keeping them up. The two pools are a treat - families seem to gravitate to one and seniors to the other. The hot tubs are clean and well maintained. The office staff was friendly and checking in was easy and hassle free. But do check to make sure the unit has been upgraded. We saw several of the units that still had the original carpets, counters etc and they are not nearly as nice. Many units are privately owned and can be rented through local management companies or VRBO.

Reviews.Title: “Fit our dream vacation like a glove!”
Reviews.Author: Hemayan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day Thanksgiving vacation at Maui and rented an oceanfront condo (F306) at Papakea. From the moment we walked in through the door, we fell in love with the place. You can hear the waves crashing below the lanai all day and night. On moonlit nights, the scene is especially enchanting. We didnt see any direct sunrises or sunsets from the condo, but could see them if we walked down to the ocean, and looked to the east or west. We booked through Maui Dreams Come True and Misty really went out of her way to make things easy and pleasant for us. We could see and hear the waves crashing abt 15 feet from our lanai. On clear nights the sky seems to come down like a blanket scattered with a million stars and a bright moon! The condo was clean and in good condition. All appliances were working. We didnt need the AC at all, as the ocean breeze did the job. There were all kinds of imaginable utensils in the kitchen. The bathroom was clean, there were plenty of towels, beach towels, linens and even a beach chair. The sofa turns into an extra bed in the living room which was convenient as we were traveling with a toddler. The resort itself was lovely with two pools, jacuzzis, a mini golf, a green oceanfront walkway and cute fish ponds which delighted our daughter. The pools are lighted with tiki torches at night and we grilled dinner every night by the pool. The resort is very quiet and close to grocery stores, farmer's market, a fresh seafood market and fast food. It is also close to Kanaapali beach and Kapalua bay.There is no beach in front of the resort, but there are plenty close by. Thank you Misty, and thank you Jim and Martha Troughton for making our stay memorable! Definitely try the sweet smelling tomatoes at the Farmer's market! Here is their ad on VRBO if you want to book this exact condo http://www.vrbo.com/102597

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful picturesk experience of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: nana6019
Reviews.Content: We booked our condo thru Maui Dreams Come True. This was a trip of a lifetime. Maui is the most beautiful place I have been at so far. Our condo was G-303 which was perfect for us. Beautiful view of the koi ponds, pool and the view of the ocean was spectacular. We stayed 5 nights. Took the tour to Hana, which was awesome. Our tour guide was very professional and very knowledgeable of the island. He kept our interest the whole trip. I have never seen so many rainbows in one day in all my life. Spent a day at Big Beach, which by the way was a very clean beach and we felt safe to be there. The management of Maui Dreams Come True, which I believe her name was Misty, was very courtious and helpful in a lot of ways. We highly recommend this resort and plan on returning for another breath-taking experience.

Reviews.Title: “The management at Papakea went out of their way to please us.”
Reviews.Author: mauimamaEugene_Or
Reviews.Content: The management at Papakea went out of their way to see that we received just the type of room we wanted. They ask what type of room we wanted and we got just what we wished for.The unit was large and had been recently updated. We ask for and received an ocean front unit. The room was quite and very comfortable. We were very happy with our stay for 12 days. The grounds were always very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed- Rooms were old and needed renovation”
Reviews.Author: BC_CanadaBC_Cananda
Reviews.Content: We were very dissapointed with our room @ papakea. Had reserved months ahead of time and was assured we would get a ground floor unit. Not the case. Was also assure rooms were kept renovated. Also not the case. Our room was in need of some renos and had dirty carpet. Also carpet on the patio which dosent even make sense. Room were not clean to hotel standard, they also have a rat problem. Service was poor, had a couple problems in the condo with appliances not working and they did nothing about this. I would reccomend booking through an owner- as these suits seemed to be renovated and keep in better condition as family of ours had done this and no complaints. Location was good and grounds were beautiful. We will NOT stay at Papakea again, very poor managment company. So many other beautiful places to choose from in Maui !

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous vacation, a fabulous resort!”
Reviews.Author: WayneConnie06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary in Maui (first time visit) and spent 8 incredible days at the Papakea Resort. Many thanks to Manager Dave Schneider (a very warm and charismatic gentleman) and his friendly staff for our magical holiday. Our accommodations were first class - a beautifully appointed condo overlooking the wild surf. (By the way, the name Papakea is Hawaiian for 'the mist of the waves'). The grounds of the Papakea are truly amazing and so very well manicured, The torches burning every evening added such a romantic touch. The low profile of the resort (4 storeys) added a very comfortable, homey ambiance. Will we return to the Papakea? IN A HEARTBEAT!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany1234055
Reviews.Content: Our trip was incredible from the instant we arrived to Papakea. We were nicely greeted by our concierge whom carefully reviewed all necessary information and referred us to a wonderful tour guide whom later recommended the most fun-filled Maui excursions. The unit was exceptionally clean with breathtaking views. Very friendly staff and residents.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love Papakea!”
Reviews.Author: Trippy_dippy_one
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed here year after year, and find it always to be excellent. We especially like J401. The view is perfect, overlooks the pool and putting green,with a great view of the ocean. The kitchen was recently remodeled and is well stocked. Papakea is close to Lahaina and has easy access to the best that Maui has to offer. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean....Sunsets.......ahhhhhh so much beauty!”
Reviews.Author: LENEA01
Reviews.Content: The Papakea is the place to stay. The ocean front condo's are the best. Drink your morning coffee out on the Lanai. Watch the sunsets sipping on your favorite beverage. The sound of the ocean is with you constantly. Come to Maui for a relaxing vacation. Stay at the Papakea. Make memories you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Exceedingly Well Maintained!”
Reviews.Author: SeasonTraveler2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a beautiful, completely remodeled two bedroom, two bath unit with an ocean view that was not only terrifc, but extremely reasonable. The condos are located just a short drive from Lahaina and about 45 mins in traffic from the airport. You cn relax, do activities, or just enjoy the lush and well maintained grounds. Use VRBO.com to find a unit privately owned and save a bundle! I strongly recommend the Paparkea!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely, BEST TRIP EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmquenga
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this place! It was our very first trip to Maui and we met up with friends. We planned our vacation around where our friends were staying and could not have been happier with our choice. The pictures of the resort do not do it justice, not at all! The staff are very friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room was an Ocean Front Studio and the view was spectacular! We slept with our slider open (screen locked) every night and never had better sleep than when at Papakea. The grounds were GORGEOUS, enough so in fact, that I shot my friends' engagement photos there before we left. I could never say enough nice things about this place, we just loved it. We will DEFINITELY return and we can't wait to do so! I'd recommend any of you out there searching for a place to stay to call Papakea, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: zithelp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days, our first trip to Maui in 25 years. We are Marriott timeshare owners and also own worldmark and VI that we resently inherited. We used our VI points for this reservation. The VI uses certain units here at the Aston. We were apprehensive as my in-laws used to come here and always liked it but that was 30 years ago. We stayed in a 1 BR unit E101 and what a great location. The unit was as described, clean, comfortable and good size for 2, maybe too cramped for 4 adults. The unit was clean, well appointed and the resort was right on the water, closer than many other resorts. The views were excellent and the grounds beautiful. All the staff were friendly and check-in was easy although we did have to wait until the appointed 4 PM checkin time. It is not a fancy â€œMarriottâ€� or Westin but it was certainly up to our standards and very comfortable and relaxing and had all the ammenities we needed. We plan on returning to this resort the next time we come to Maui

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at the Aston Papakea”
Reviews.Author: vishwasbhat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in a studio ocean view room. The room was clean and tidy and had all the amenities. The view and the closeness to the ocean were fantastic. Had a relaxing time at the swimming pool and the chairs near the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “The right way to stay if you are staying for more than a few days.”
Reviews.Author: Jefsin76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and were exceptionally pleased. The room was very clean and provided all we could need from the kitchen to the laundry. The grounds were very clean and again provided more than we could have taken full advantage of, and we tried. Papakea provided the perfect setting for what we were looking for, which was a place to call our own. I booked this specific hotel because I wanted to escape the resort style rooms that lack the anonymity to come and go as we pleased, and allow us to cook our meals and enjoy our trip at our own pace. I do recommend this location more for families and less for romance as you cater a bit more to yourself, although the few interactions with the staff were all above average from a customer service perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel (Ocean front)”
Reviews.Author: vk10
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hawaii, we booked a 1BR Ocean front room from priceline. The room was fully equipped with Kitchen utilities and laundry and had a great Ocean front view. I would certainly recommend to book Ocean front (not ocean view) for first-timers. The place is very calm and friendly place. Most of the activities that you would wanted to do is just 10 mins drive from this place. And if you would like to book for any activities, they have a dedicated person (Sarah -she was very very helpful !! ) who can book the activities for you with a special discount. This hotel also provides free Internet and parking Thank you Papakea

Reviews.Title: “J201 at Papakea is a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: rosebud11
Reviews.Content: I didnt stay here, but I sent my besfriend and his wife here for there honeymoon. Heres what they had to say: Dishwasher had a Do Not Use Sign taped to it, found out is has been out of service for months. Dust every where, mold in the bathroom, caused congestion problems. TV remote didnt work, had to get up to change the Channel. Very outdated. Owner Grant of mauivacationrentals is terrible to deal with. The pictures provided are not of his unit. Terrible place to stay. I feel the unit was misrepresented. In defense of the Papakea resort, the views and grounds are beautiful. Would stay at the resort again but would rent directly from the Aston at Papakea Resort, not a timeshare owner.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea K203- Would go there again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: Prsctnative
Reviews.Content: I'm sort of apprehensive to write this review because I want to able to rent this unit again! But I can't help but let any potential renters, with understandable trepidation , know that this was a great unit (K203). We had read reviews for other units at this resort and were concerned we might find this to be on the list of "Won't go there again". We had read the staff at the check-in desk was not particularly friendly or helpful to those renting condos from private owners, but we did not find that to be true. They were kind and helpful. There were a few things that could use an ungrade or minor repairs, but this unit was perfect. It was a joy to sit on the lanai in the morning, drink coffee, and watch the ocean and the kids in the pool at the same time. Everything we needed was in this very clean condo, it had its own keyless entry, the A/C worked wonderfully, and the beds were super comfortable. The grounds at the Papkea are kept superbly and it was only a short two minute walk to the beach. Eveything you need is within a short distance from the condo such as: ABC or ITimes store on the main road, snorkel rental next to ABC, farmers market, and a short drive north to Napili for most excellent snorkeling with turtles). If you want to venture a little farther, it was only a tad bit further drive to Lahaina were you could do all the touristy stuff and find do better prices for groceries at Safeway at the Old Cannery Mall. My only suggestion about the grounds is: if you want to use the barbeque be sure to get one early. They fill up fast so plan ahead if want to get one at dinnertime. To summarize, we would go there again in a minute and would rent this privately owned unit again. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JnSmom
Reviews.Content: We rented a 3 BR unit(actually 2 BR with loft) for our group of 2 families. 8 people total including 4 young people in their 20's. It was a bit snug for 8, but are used to vacationing and camping together, so it was fine.Our unit was individually owned, so we did not rent through the office, but found our unit online. I really do not know how our price would compare to renting through the resort itself. The unit was a bit dated, but clean, and everything worked OK except 1)The A/C was minimal. I guess there is not a lot of central A/C in Hawaii.The unit was comfortable enough most of the time except when we all came home from a long days excursion, and 8 people had to shower, blow dry hair, use curling irons, etc to get ready for dinner. It was quite warm at those times 2) We supposedly had free wifi, but the reception was terrible-slow and spotty. Since our unit was privately owned, there was some snorkel equipment we did borrow, and there were some books and games in the unit for our use. The grounds were very nicely kept and there were putting greens which we used.Small beach next door- not great, and there are stairs at Papakea that you could just take down to the ocean. Not a lot to do close by, there was a Mexican bar across the street that the young folks could walk to. Kaanapali beach nearby was great.We booked a lot of excursions through the concierge at Papakea, spent a LOT of money, but felt that she steered us wrong on a few things.We stressed that we had 4 young people who wanted FUN and ACTIVE activities and asked about a few things we read about on Trip Advisor, and she talked us out of them, steering us to other things she said they would enjoy more. WRONG! I think she was just making more money on the ones she pushed on us.We used the grills one evening and had dinner out near the pool, which was nice.All in all, we were happy with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Calm and serene.”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlans
Reviews.Content: If your idea is a calm and friendly place, this place is great the grounds are well kept, parking is easy, there is always a place and open chairs on the lawn to bask in the sun or take shelter under the shade of a palm tree. It seems like this area which is to the North of Kaanapali is on the path of trade winds. During our 8 day stay the sea was never calm. It's also a bit of hassle to negotiate the reefs to get to clear waters. There is not much of a beach. The pool is smaller than most but we never use the pools. There are several gas grills around the pool after and easy to BBQ in the evening

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: gandp0729
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews I was skeptical on where we were staying. I was pleasantly surprised! Our room was great and we had a great view. We traveled with our 16 month old daughter and the resort had a crib for us to use. The room was very clean and the grounds were impeccable. I can't say enough. We stayed in room E301, I would recommend it to anyone that needs a 1 bedroom. We traveled to Maui for a family reunion and my Nana rented a total of 8 rooms, so we saw everything from a studio up to a 3 bedroom and they were all very nice. I would definitely recommend this place to others. The only down side is there isn't a beach but there is a nice one right next door and they had nice lawn chairs on the lawn in front of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Property was nice but units could have used some upgrades/repairs”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSFMama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Papakea Resort last week in unit J306. The unit was small and dated. We were only there in this 1BD/1BA unit for 2 nights. I've included a few pictures of units J306 for your reference. The one thing that drove me crazy were the sliding doors throughout the unit. None of them glided easily and most of the time, I was trying to put adjust them back into the tracks! I wasn't just going to leave them the way there were in case my kids were to try to open the doors and have it fall on them. Other than that, unit was in working condition. Could use some upgrades though. White countertops were a bit outdated and carpets were a big muggy. Beach wasn't super great as it was full of rocks. I would drive 5 minutes to go to the Ka'anapali beach where the beaches were nicer - no rocks and was able to snorkel there too! Kids said they saw a sea-turtle out there! SCORE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: travelgalPeoria_AZ
Reviews.Content: I booked this condo through Maui Dreams Come True. The unit was K102 which was on the first floor with a walk-out that looked out directly to the pool. We had a partially obstructed view of the beach but it was steps away from the beach. The unit is very quiet and clean. While the decor is a bit dated, it had a dishwasher and washer/dryer. The area is very convenient to a grocery store, other beaches and downtown Lahaina. All in all, I would absolutely return to this unit and also recommend it. I would say it's a great place for a family to take an affordable Maui vacation.

Reviews.Title: “decent accommodation at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: debnath
Reviews.Content: We spend 6 nts in this resort from June 29th till July 4th and found it to be a decent oceanfront accommodation for our family with two 12 year olds.We had a oceanfront 1 bedroom unit and the view from the lanai was outstanding.We attended the complimentary breakfast and orientation the next morning we arrived. Our suggestion would be to shop around a bit before you buy anything from them. We bought the Molokini snorkelling trip and the Drums of the Pacific Luau from them. The Molokini trip organised by the Pacific Whale Foundation was superb , although a little pricy! The Luau at the Hyatt is a good show with great food. Papakea is not a fancy and luxury accommodation but decent,clean and provided excellent ocean views-perhaps about 20' from the ocean. And in Maui, you are out most of the day. We used the kitchen 3-4 times. The drive to Hana was memorable one and we returned by the unpaved road to enjoy some of the astonishing views.Actually it wasn;t too bad if you get good weather.

Reviews.Title: “Book with peace of mind”
Reviews.Author: bindyboo42
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous when i booked my room at Papakea due to some of the reviews i read online. We could not have been more pleased with our room. Our room was ocean front with a kitchen, the place had EVERYTHING you could have possibly needed. We will definately stay there when we return, it was cheaper than other hotels and i can't imagine the others were better. At any given time you could find 4-5 workers manicuring the grounds which were beautiful. We found the staff friendly and helpful. I just can't say enough good things about this place, we normally have a knack for getting really bad hotels and were just elated when we saw our room.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is great-totally recommend. Dont book through "Mauidreams.com"”
Reviews.Author: agoble
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very affordable and right on the water, we tried to book through Maui Dreams Come True (www.mauidreams.com) but ended up being taken advantage of. Jim Troughton, the owner, if very unprofessional. The hotel itself is really nice. Most of the condos have either an ocean front or oceanview and the grounds are lovely. There are cats around, but we didnt hear them crying like other travelers. I recommend booking through vrbo, but making sure you get someone legit. We love this resort and would come back again and again! Good for single couples or large families! Close to many shops, as well as a private door (which you can use your room key to get through) off of the parking lot that goes directly to an ABC store. Cant wait for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from the busy resorts”
Reviews.Author: mehyde
Reviews.Content: We went to celebrate my husbands 50th with our two teenage daughters. I read mixed reviews regarding this property and I was impressed with the Aston managers' responses. He was dead on. I called him ahead of time to make sure I got an updated unit and I must say Dave went out of his way to make us feel welcome. He had a special welcome present for us and our unit was excellent we had a 2b2ba with a great ocean and pool view. The sunsets were gorgeous. The beach is just a few steps away and you can snorkel on Papakeas waterfront. The grounds are well maintained, there is a nice grocery store across the street and an ABC store within walking distance. It wasn't crowded and we walked to Dukes for drinks at night. This place is wonderful if you book through Aston and use it as a home away from home. we bbq'd in the evenings and explored the island all day. It was so nice to have the separate bedroom for the girls. I can't imagine it would be as relaxing sharing a hotel room for a week! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Could Use Some Updating From 10 Years Ago”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time to Papakea. I have not been here since 10 years ago, I really loved it then. My husband and I came here on our honeymoon, our family has a timeshare with VI. I have to say I was a little underwhelmed after coming back here, since visiting Pono Kai in Kauai which is similar but bigger and nicer. We had a first floor garden suite in the D building, it was easy to get in and out of, but the walls are pretty thin and it's very noisy with people checking in and out all hours even 11 pm and later. The bedroom is right beside the main walkway that goes to the main office. I wouldn't want to be in this building on the main floor again. We came in July which in case you did not know is fruit fly season all summer. So the entire main floors and our hotel room was swarming with fruit flies before we even checked our stuff in. There were dead flies all over the floors and clinging to the windows. I complained at the front desk and was told they couldn't do anything about it. About 4 or 5 days into our stay someone came to spray while we were gone and magically the fruit flies had dissappeared. I do not know if this was because we complained or was standard. The flies blow in from the pineapple plantation and are all over Kaanapali Beach, all the hotels have this problem it seems in the summer. The hotel had pretty much everything we needed, except for a bathtub. I forgot how much I HATED these tiny showers. Every VI place seems to have a bathtub so this really kills the overall appeal to Papakea. The bathrooms are pretty small. The bedroom had a really comfortable bed and really good pillows. Better than other places we stayed for similar rooms, so this was nice since there were a few let downs in other areas. The washer and dryer were pretty old as well, not as good as we were expecting. The grounds are very pretty, you have shuffleboard or mini put available, but the grounds are rather small. There is a nice sized pool and hot tub which is larger than most of the surrounding hotels. There are about 5 barbecues available at the pool area. There is no sauna or gym which was disappointing since other VI resorts have this as well. Every other one seemed to have a sauna. The beach is really non existent here you have to walk down to the other hotels to walk along the beach and enjoy it. We found the guests to be pretty noisy here. For 2 nights there was a couple screaming like we were in a trailer park, threatening eachother, shreaking like the women was being chased or abused. She was shouting so everyone could be a witness. This went on for a good while, maybe up to an hour. Finally security found them and got them to shut up, but the next night they were screaming again. The buildings are all really close together so I'm sure everyone had heard this. I think next time we will want an ocean view because the islands of Lanai and Molokai are very beautiful to look at. We were not bothered by the activity desk at all, which was nice, a previous VI resort had a huge problem with this. On a plus this was the ONLY VI resort in Hawaii that we had free wireless internet. It was not that fast, but it was free. Other places we paid $7 to $10 a day, for our 10 day stays. I would also hope that this place gets a reno and some updating because the lighting is very very dim and poor and the place looks much better on the outside than the inside. Not bad... just not bright and resort like.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GeorgesGirl09
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in beautiful Maui. We were quite disappointed with Aston Papakea and would definitely not return. The customer service was horrible. We called for towels four times before we ever received any the first day and had to make more than one call each time we needed anything. The rooms were just ok and very dated. The shower backed up but most importantly there was NO CENTRAL AIR. Something I really wish I had know that before we booked our stay. There was a little window airconditioner in the family room but it only cooled that room. When I questioned the front desk about it, she assured me that you "don't need central air".... but apparently she never tried to sleep in the downstairs bedroom... it was far from comfortable. I will say that the grounds were pretty and view from our room was gorgeous....but that is really the only positives I could say.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, but property is a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: BSFord
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a nice experience and the resort is will managed and in good condition. We had a 1BD + Loft on the 4th floor which was roomy and a good fit for our family with two young kids. The challenge with the property is that each unit is individually owned, so there is quite a variety in each unit - make sure you understand the condition of your unit before booking. Finally, while the physical property is maintained, it's dated - it has glass louvered windows in the main bedroom, which are all along the walkway. In other words, it can be noisy at times. I would rate it a solid B-.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for being in Maui, Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: kwk21
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at Papakea directly through the Aston website. I don't know if I had too high expectations, but I would say I was just a little dissapointed with our room. Everything was just at par for us. The room had pretty much everything we needed, but it was just out-dated stuff. The toilet had a mind of it's own of when to flush and when not to flush, the shower was very small, but did the job. There plenty of plates and utensils. Air conditioner worked, wasn't cold, but was cool enough. We stayed in E-308. We got a sneak peek at the other condo next door when it was being cleaned and it was absolutely gorgeous compared to ours, which dissapointed us a little, but then again it was privately owned and maintained. So for being on the beautiful island of Maui, with a fantastic ocean view and at an affordable rate, I was content with the room. The grounds were kept at a very high standard, the pools and spas were fantastic, we grilled on the BBQ's a lot (saved lots of money), and were right on the beach. By the way, fantastic snorkeling right outside Papakea!

Reviews.Title: “Papakea Resort L-303”
Reviews.Author: cruisegirl_7
Reviews.Content: This is a great condo vacation rental. Close to all the events but allows some area away from it all too. It's a ocean front unit. This unit is a 2 br/2 bath with sleep sofa. There were 5 of us & it was fine. Has a fully functioning kitchen, living room, Lanai, wash/dryer in unit. There are elevators, 2 pools, hot tubs, Lanai area by the pool, several BBQ's, concierge service with Expedia in the lobby, tennis courts, putting greens. Loved this resort. The only things that makes it not excellent on eveything is no on site restaurant but not a big deal. One next door, several in close promitiy. And the fact for sleep quality. Not the units fault but people tend to forget that some might be sleeping. While the resort itself seems quiet, voices carry horribly and can be disruptive. Had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Maui value”
Reviews.Author: idahodan
Reviews.Content: I would rate this a super value in Maui. The view was great, with nice sunsets. The room we had was a little aged, but it served us well. The condo had about everything we needed. The beach is pretty short, but a nice walk south offers more. The pool is OK and several BBQ's to grill your food on. The grounds are keep neat and the staff and security was helpful. Chase 'N Rainbows was great to work with and I would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Chico60
Reviews.Content: The Papakea Resort is a beautiful resort. The grounds are gorgeous, staff is incredibly helpful. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite, that was immaculate. The view is awesome, especially during whale watching season. We watched many of them right from our private lanai. I would highly recommend the Papakea Resort to any traveler to Maui, and hope they will enjoy their stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Comfortable Rooms, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gj330i
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Papakea in two different units, L-408 and B-102. One was an ocean front which was excellent, and the B-102 was perfect for my stay with my girlfriend because it was fitted out great, and just a walk to the beach. All in all it was a very comfortable apartment with ocean views, great sunsets, bbq's and a great pool. I especially liked the shuffle board and the fact that it is right on the ocean with a small beach where I could swim. The walk to Kaanapali was great too. I would recommend it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What fantastic ocean views and facilities”
Reviews.Author: orene1923
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for our son's wedding. Almost all the wedding guests stayed at Papakea and they loved their rooms, the pools, spas, etc. Everything that we needed was within walking distance. We had a wonderful rehearsal dinner just next door at the Kaanapali Shores Beach Restaurant--walking distance. The Aston manager worked with the Beach Restaurant to make the food, slideshow--everything perfect! We also had an "Aloha Brunch" in the Papakea gazebo. The staff was very helpful. We'll certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccomend this property as a travel agent for 20 years”
Reviews.Author: jeanettestravel
Reviews.Content: We just got back in 2010 after staying 8 nights in g208 at this resort, I couldn't ask for anything more. Everything about the place makes it worth it, Whales almost every morning were seen, Rainbows -double rainbows, were often showing up to greet and say goodbye. The STAFF is One of the Best I have ever seen, One thing I would like to set staright when booking this property, The Condo's are individually owned and rooms just cannot be changed once booked. Know what you are getting- ocean front is ocean front here with patio's to walk out onto. The condos' have everything you need from internet to washers dryers, pots pans, ect. One of the best things is being able to walk to everything so close-right behind the rsort is ABC stores like walgreens, dvd's, surf needs, farmers market for fresh food- fish market for fresh fish daily, Java jazz for entertainment nightly, and Great FOOD,,,so no drinking and driving, Just wlak to whatever you need... Front street not to far of a drive say 5 mins,,,,I was highly impressed with my oceanview room and location of this propetrty and would come back again and again, It has two ppols, you can walk to a bigger beach very easy. The sunset melts into the water and oceanview rooms are really worth it-even partial- just see it, It had all the comforts og home, I am a travel agent for 20 years and I watch for everything. Feel free to contact me for an upgrade and pleasant surprise in your room upon arrival. I LOVED IT !!! Take advantage of the expedia breakfast- you will get good prices and information from the reps and best seating for events, They buy blocked space and know alot about the island. I would be happy to answer any questions and help you book. Jeanette Bucy American Express and AAA travel agent for 20 years now independent Jbucy777@aol.com Jeanette Bucy

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: xantippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at the Papakea while celebrating my parents' 50th wedding anniversary with the rest of my family and their spouses and children (teenagers and small children). We all stayed in various condos, all at the Papakea. All units were nicely updated and clean, and all had nice views of the ocean. We stayed in a studio with partial ocean view, but we could easily watch lots of whale activity just off shore from our lanai. Our maid seemed a bit stingy with soap and towels (only 2 sets of towels and 2 bars of soap for 2 sinks and shower, and no liquid dish soap), although she left extra after we asked. Other family members did not experience this issue, and none of us had any other inconveniences. The grounds and pools are beautiful, and there are shuffleboard areas, putting greens, and children can spot frogs with flashlights in the evenings. The beach is lovely, and much quieter than south Kaanapali. We enjoyed walking from North Kaanapali to South Kaanapali (the Sheraton's grounds on the lava rock connect the two). It is a lovely beach walk that is 3-4 miles round-trip. Much of the area also has a boardwalk if you tire of sandy walks. Lastly, a grocery store is within walking distance of PapaKea (just across the street). Papakea is a great value, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the Draw”
Reviews.Author: SKGodin
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom/2 bath ocean view room directly through Aston. Key points: 1) if we were basing this review off of our first room (J305) then every rating would have been terrible. Everything in the room was original 1983, including the carpets which were truly filthy. There were dead bugs in the sunshine ceiling over a very dingy kitchen, grime all over the floor, dirty hand prints on the dishwasher...to name a few. After traveling for close to 10 hours with small children, arriving at such a place almost made me cry. The ocean view was also non-existent unless you stood on one corner of the balcony. 2) The next morning the staff at Papakea assured us that they had a nicer room for us that we would be moved into by 2 pm. We packed up our luggage and went for a really nice breakfast next door before heading out to Lahaina for the morning. When we returned to the hotel we were given room K205 which was in fact, beautiful. There was tile throughout the main areas, a lovely kitchen and updated bathrooms. I could even see the waves crashing on the beach from the kitchen area. 3) As many people have noted, the grounds are beautiful and the staff friendly. They had an Easter egg hunt Easter morning which I thought was nice. I really struggle as to whether I can recommend this hotel to a friend. I find that traveling with small children can be stressful enough without worrying about what sort of room you're going to end up in. In the end we had a fabulous time and Aston did move us without any hassle so I am giving them a "thumbs up" with the proviso that your first night may be a disappointing one.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Elenasun
Reviews.Content: Aloha! What a total disappointment! 1. We had booked 2-bathroom unit, but got 1 bathroom with no explanation! The extra bathroom was important for us since we traveled with my mother and a 5-year old. The desk person was helpless - everything she could say was "You have to talk to the manage." The mysterios manager did not show up for 3 days of our Maui visit. I wonder if it is the only manager for the whole resort!!!??? :) Yes, they did offer another room, but who wants to spend vacation time on that if you stay only 3 nights? Nothing, but trouble! 2. "Ocean view" I consider as a scam expression. We could see the ocean, yes... about 1% of the picture (unit D406). The pool and landscaping are nice, but they are NOT ocean! :) 3. The separate rooms are NOT actually separate - they are connected with a part-open window. If the second part of your party snor, forget about nornal sleep! 4. The condo is OK, but needs a lot of updates (the carpet is the first one). My suggestion? Try to find another resort! Do not make the same mistake - this place has a lot of bad reviews... I wish our travel agent did a better job... :(

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE ! KNOW BEFOR YOU GO”
Reviews.Author: GS079
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through COSTCO. No where on their site they list as this is privetly owne condominium, so all rooms are completely diffrent. and it basically a luck of draw to what you get, regarlesss of how much you paid. but lesson learned. I should have come to trip advisor before i booked. My fault. and i accept that. with that in mind, here are the pros and cons of this hotel. PROS + amazing view of North Kanapali Shore (but only from OCEAN FRONT balcony. any other room do get blocked + location, near by restaurants and easy access to highway. + neat and clean grounds CONS + No way of knowing what you will get + They dont look at your reservation details (Since we were travelling with 15 months old daughter who loves to run and be chased, we asked for room that is not on the ground floor - we asked specifically anywhere but ground floor. - they gave us F103 - Absolutley on ground floor - I told front desk to move me, and she gave me A305, if it were available, why in first place they would stick you in to ground floor? + PARKING is a huge problem. there are no assigned parking - so everybody parks near the entrance to the beach, regardless if you are staying in that building or not. you can never get parking near your building. + We asked for CRIB. When we got in to the room. No CRIB. we called and asked. Front Desk said they will send it out. 1.5 hrs later (seriously, 1.5 hrs ) we called again, and they said they will send it out. another 1/2 hour later called again. and they said they were on their way. 20 minutes later maintannce person (Vincent - nice and polite guy actually ) shows up with pack n play. its dirty but in functional state, fine. we are okay with it, untill we found there is no mattress. so i asked the guy to get a mattress. finally we got a mattress. and sheet. the point i am trying to make is it is always a hassle with front desk. +SERVICE (Specifically Maid Service) Does not exists.
