I was told there is daily maid service when i checked in. later i found out that there is actually no maid serivice. all they do is replace towels and make bed. they dont clean floor, (our floor were not carpeted) +ROOM itself : Our room was not updated. it means it still had 1970 decor. to be fair, i must said it had all the stuff we needed but not in best condition. dishwasher was loud and inaffective, washer and dryer were also very loud. if you have young children you know it matters. furniture was uncofortable and outdated. bedsheet had odor and bed was not really confortable. AC was behind the 23 inch box tv. the best part of the room was the view. (we saw raibow, whales,and sunset right out of the balcony, i will surely add pictures later) +Bathroom. - Bathroom was clean but no tub. also cold water from shower. We could not get hot water. if you turn all the way to "HOT" side you get luke warm water. We had to grab water from the sink in beach toys to give bath for our daughter. radicoulous. front desk could not help. + Concierge/Activity Desk. - I tried get information about places to visit, best times, weather, stroller access etc. but in turn they keep getting me to buy activities. and never gave me those information, and handed me the map. they are not really concierge or not intrested in helping you plan out your day, or tip for the first timers they are only there to sell you an activities. that's pretty much sums it all up. - When i asked about Haleakala national park upon chekcking in, the concierge (Didnt get his name,) scared me about rain and sky and aske me rather join them in to free breakfast where they "inform" you about maui and places of intrest --- turn out to be all the activities you can purchase. so in summary dont trust them. last day room did not get either cleaned or towel service. we called and called and called 3 times and then they sent towels. In summary, I would not stay here again, the biggest thing that bugs me is all rooms are completely diffrent, although you paying the same or more, you have no say in it. they way the advertized is "each rooms have unique decor" i think that is completely mis-representation. If my room have shower but no tub, non-carpet floors, outdated furniture, broken dishwasher, old tv, AC Behind the TV, no hot water in shower - but room next to me have been updatd recently and do not have all these issues, how is that fair? to me, worst thing about papakea is there is no minimum standard of the room.so basically you should nto expect anything if you choose to stay here. If it was just me and my wife and this was absolutey cheapter then any other place on same area. Yes go ahead, and draw your luck. you may actually get updated room. and then dont have any expectation from maid service, front desk, concierge, parking, and dont believe them in any of their litreature and you will be perfectly fine. Front desk do not care, as it is ultimately owners' problem. Owners don't care as they never have any interaction with their guest. and agencies like costco do not care as they are just the middleman. it is amazing as actually no one is responsible for anything except you becuase you selected them. This is really really up to your luck. Either you paid really great price, or you got lucky. i am sure i am forgetting something, but i think this is enough info for you to make decision.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea D308 is great!”
Reviews.Author: bellasadierubie
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed in this condo from March 7 - 14, 2010. We couldn't have been happier! The location is very convenient to parking, the office, the ABC store next door - - everything. Despite being close to everything, we never heard any type of noise except crashing waves, wind through the palms and the fountains in the beautiful koi ponds. The views from the lanai across the meticulously groomed tropical gardens to the ocean are so relaxing and beautiful. Although we were at the back of the oceanfront complex, we could still see lots of whale action from the lanai, and even from the sofa! The condo was "white-glove" clean. I couldn't find a speck of dust or dirt anywhere, and, showing the incredible attention to detail, the kitchen utensils in the drawers were even lined up like little soldiers. The furnishings are tasteful and comfortable and everything is in great condition. The murphy bed in the living area is a great feature - - so comfy and convenient. We also appreciated the coolers, boogie boards and other beach equipment available for our use. The new, full-size washer and dryer worked perfectly and were quiet, too. I can't say enough about the comfort and convenience of this condo and the ease of working with the owner. We can't wait to get back to "our" Papakea condo again. Michele and John Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT rent suite J201”
Reviews.Author: VancouverDFamily
Reviews.Content: This condo unit was misrepresented. It was listed as having air conditioning and a dishwasher. Unfortunately, although these appliances were present they were not functioning at all. Neither was the smoke detector. We notified the owner who was aware that the dishwasher didn't work but didn't bother to inform us. A technician came to see the air conditioner and he confirmed that it was indeed broken and needed to be replaced which couldn't take place until after our stay. We contacted the owner who refused to compensate us for the poor condition of the suite. The decor is also very dated and the linens were old and not in great shape. The response by the owner was just terrible. The resort itself is not bad but the beach is rocky and only one of the 2 pools was open and very crowded. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for retired folks...”
Reviews.Author: mhunsinger
Reviews.Content: The resort is very attractive. Everything is well landscaped and the resort overlooks the ocean. There are bbq's around the pool area which make the pool side a great place to have family dinners. We traveled as a family of 7 with the 'children' being early twenties. There is limited activities for young adults- the pools while attractive, limit activities to swim only; no goggles, no dive sticks, no jumping or diving and no marco polo. If you are looking solely to lounge and keep your activities to a minimum this pool would work for you. The decor in our room was more than interesting... I guess you could say it was splattered with so many themes and designs it is hard to narrow it down to one description. The resort specified there was a fitness center but really it is at the sister hotel and you have to pay 40 dollars a week to use their facility.

Reviews.Title: “Know about the room you are staying in”
Reviews.Author: oliverchicago
Reviews.Content: Did not realize these were timeshares - Very important to know about the room you are booking - Our master suite did not have a TV, the teenagers were upstairs in an open loft which was very hot and did not have any privacy to the downstairs living area, our deck did not have any chase chairs (I could tell that some units did not have any outdoor furniture), we called the front office about the outside chairs and they stated, you get the unit you get with what is there, front office was not friendly and/or accomadating - As you can tell, not very happy about this property - Will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Be Informed”
Reviews.Author: legendlady1
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and tried but were unable to rent from an owner. We rented from Costco and boy were we sorry. Our unit (D-103) has not been undated since it was built (1970's) and included peeling paint from the walls, unbelieveably dirty carpet and a bare-bones kitchen. Our complaints to the front desk were not well recieved however with some convincing after one day they found us another unit that was better. So here are the facts about the Papakea. All one bedroom units are 450 sq ft which is very small and none have bath tubs, only showers and queen size beds. The only air conditioning the units have is a window unit near the slider and depending on the layout of your unit this may be behind the TV. We are in our 50's and we are almost the youngest folks here. No kids and no activities at all. It is very quite. I am not complaining but some would not like the atmosphere. 2 pools, both very small and when everyone wants to go to the pool they become crowded early in the day. Housekeeping has left pillows on our bed without pillowcases on them. It is windy today with lights blinking. We just realized that our unit has no flashlights or candles. My recommendation is to only rent from an owner and be sure you get pictures of the unit and a complete description of what the unit has in it. This resort has no amenities other than the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Breathless”
Reviews.Author: JackieT4
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful, the ocean was literally right there. The view was beautiful in any direction. Shopping was convient. The sunsets breathless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay BUT Some Issues!”
Reviews.Author: HighRiver
Reviews.Content: We spent our first week on the island of Maui on the Kaanapali coast at the Aston Papakea. The resort is located about 10 mins north of Lahaina and is situated close to a grocery store, some restaurants and shopping which is ideal when you are staying in a condo. The positives about the Aston Papakea first... the grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The pools and pool areas are well managed and cleaned every morning. The BBQ stations are very handy to use and easily accessable. We didn't get housekeeping every day but they did come around to see if we needed more towels or toliet paper every second day or so. We stayed here with extended family and we had a one bedroom unit on the 2nd floor (Bldg J, 202) and we had a fabulous view of the pool and the ocean. The kitchen was recently renovated and was great, the living room was all tiled and clean. We had a small icky TV for the first 2 days, then on the 3rd day a brand new flat screen showed up. The bedroom was small but okay, however the bed needs to be changed out. We hate sleeping on a mattress where you roll into the middle of it all the time. The rest of our family had booked a 2 bedroom unit since they have 3 teenagers (5 total), but the Aston Papakea screwed up the reservation and had them in a 1 bedroom. The resort was fully booked so they couldn't move them. The resort did absolutely nothing to accommodate them even though they admitted it was their mistake. They could have at least offered a discount, or free meals or excursions. Imagine 5 people living in a small 1 bedroom unit for a whole week. Plus their fridge broke down and they had to bring in a 2nd fridge for a few days until the other one was repaired. Not a nice way to spend a week of holidays. For this reason we would probably not go back to the Aston Papakea. Other resorts would have done something and we knew there were still some 2 bedroom units available throughout the week. The other problem is the lack of beach. There is none, even when the tide is out. You have to walk a bit to get to a nice one. The ocean is rough in front of the resort and down the beach. Be very careful when swimming or snorkelling, while we were there 3 people had drown. Never turn your back on the ocean. Overall, our trip to Maui was fantastic and our stay was okay. There are a lot of nice resorts in and around Lahaina, so take your time researching.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: singingtrees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days and found it a great value. Unit G-402. Nicely appointed, newer kitchen, beautiful ocean view, nice grounds. While there is only one AC unit in the living room, we found that the rooms cooled nicely at night with open windows and ceiling fans. Definitely a family oriented facility with many seniors as well. We travelled with our adult (late 20s) daughter and her partner. They may have been the only people in that age-group at the resort. It wasn't a problem as the resort was home-base for us, not the center of our vacation. The staff are fine and responsive, but we found we needed to be proactive. For example, there is daily maid service, but until we expressed a need for coffee filters, paper towels, etc, they were not automatically provided. When we noted their absence our maid happily restocked, but she did need the reminder. For the price, I don't think you can beat this for value on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful condo!”
Reviews.Author: blondeinMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Papkea J203 condo booked through the Aston website Feb 13-20. This is a 2br/2bath unit that has been updated beautifully! The owners need to be commended for their work to the place. We saw several through the patios that did not come close to this unit! It was spacious and clean. Beds were comfortable! I cannot complain about the condo or the resort. The one thing I do have complaints is the noise from other tenants and or people walking in the parking lot. We liked our windows open and we could hear the tv from another unit loudly every night. Mainly, it is other peoples lack of common sense! I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone. I had decided that I wanted to extend our stay so we didn't have to check out early our last day. I called the reservation number and although they tried to keep us in the unit, another group was coming in. They did give us a 1 bedroom unit B202 for the day and it too was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great family reunion”
Reviews.Author: DoddSquad
Reviews.Content: We just finished the best family reunion ever. The Papakea Resort was perfect for our large group. The grounds are beautiful. We stayed in room G406 which was an ocean view that looked right down on one of the two swimming pools. Our family made great use of the extra large Jacuzzi next to the heated pool. We bar-b-qued most nights and never had a problem getting access to one of the 5 bar-b-ques at the pool side. The putting green was a big hit with our grandson. We are definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: gunnySouthWales
Reviews.Content: Room B109. We are in fact still here. Been here 3 days out of 2 weeks and we cannot get over how nice it is. Friendly staff at check in, very efficient, helpful and thorough. Arrived late at night, they were great. Fabulous Expedia staff for all the trips and stuff esp Chip. Good guy. The room is ace, newly refurbed, ocean view, we could not believe our luck. The hotel gardens are kept in immaculate condition, great sunsets from the gardens and our room. Whale action all day again from the room but plenty also from the lovely lawns which go to 6 feet from the water;s edge. Wow!! We love this place, can't fault it in any way. Will be back like a shot when we can do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Jessicat_Meow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Papakea Resort and it was a great place to stay. We had a 1 bedroom unit plus loft with an Ocean view. Unit H-401 The ocean view was totally worth the extra $ as we were able to see the whales at play off our balcony. (winter months only) The owners were very friendly and easy to deal with. Each condo is individually owned so make sure that you do get an upgraded suite. Ours was clean and comfortable and we thought it was quite nice. Then we went to our parents 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom condo 2 doors down and our jaws dropped there. What a renovation! Have a big family? Try to get unit H-413 As for the grounds there are lots of things to do here. A putting green, hot tub and pool and it is right on the beach. There is also a Coy pond there too. Every thing is very well maintained that I saw. Recommend the Farmers market that is within walking distance of the property. Hmm yummy banana bread...... Other than that, the resort is about a 50 minute drive from the airport. If you are visiting Kihei, eat at the "Cafe O'Lay" in Kihei (about a 45 min drive from the property) Ed Robinson's Dive Shop does fantastic work with Snorkeling and Scuba. Loved the Road to Hana. (not recommended for motion sicky people) Swim with the Turtles off Makena Beach Enjoy Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Descent condos - pretty average everything”
Reviews.Author: rpmotocross
Reviews.Content: This resort is pretty average for the Lahaina side of the island. The location is good, with a nice beach out front. You're close to Kaanapali and Lahaina which is nice. The condos are clean, the grounds are clean, but nothing is impressive - hence the "average" comment. One big down side I can see would be staying here in the summer. The condos have one window AC unit. I would anticipate it not being able to cool the whole condo well at all, especially the back room. The windows in the rooms don't seal up well so they let what cool air does reach the bedrooms out and let lots of noise in. If you do stay here, make sure you're room is not near the elevator because you will hear everything! Also request a room that doesn't have the bedrooms facing the road as you will hear road noise. This resort is full of families, so if you don't want to listen to screaming kids dive bombing into the pools you might want to go elsewhere. It's amazing how parents are clueless as to how their children ruin things for others. It's a descent place. There are far worse on the island, but there are also lots that are nicer too.

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: nkdallas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Papakea two other times and think it is a great place to experience Maui. We just returned from a stay at Papakea, Jan 20 thru the 26th. We stayed in Bdlg A, which is an oceanfront condo, in a one bedroom. We could throw a rock and hit the ocean from our living room. We stepped out to the patio the first morning and saw a stunning view of Molokai, and humpback whales breaching right off the coast. My kids, 12 and 8, loved Papakea. The beach in front is below a sea wall and is a very small strip of sand. However, because of the row of rocks/coral off the beach a few yards, it was a great place for them to swim. They still had the wave action, but it was buffered by the coral further out. They also had a great time snorkeling along the calmer side of the coral/rocks. The pools are unheated, but the hot tubs are perfect after a swim in the ocean. It is a quiet complex, with quite a few older people, who did not seem to mind my children being around. Our unit was not updated, which was okay with me, since I really like being close to the water more so than updated countertops. But many of the units can be rented directly from owners, and these units tend to be updated. Papakea is close to Kaanapali and Lahaina. It also borders a really great sandy beach, if you want to walk just a few minutes down toward Kaanapali. They keep the grounds spotless, I saw security people patrolling the property frequently, the parking is free, and it is close to restaurants, grocery stores, a farmer's market, and an ABC store, just to mention a few things.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Papakea, booked through "Maui Dreams Come True".”
Reviews.Author: To_Maui_soon
Reviews.Content: This is our second time booking ourselves at the Papakea with "Maui Dreams Come True", and unit B-308 was perfect for us. Great view, clean, nice lanai furniture, and listen to the waves all night. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: luv2tlk2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui for the first time on December 1st 2009 and stayed 10 days. Our travel agent set us up at Papakea and we were both totally thrilled with the resort. We were upgraded to a one bedroom ocean view, D207, and we loved it. It did lack AC in the bedroom, but having the windows opened caused such a nice breeze that an AC was never needed. Everyone took care of our room and the grounds so nicely. Also the General Manager, left us a box of macadamia nut chocolates, a cute 3D bookmark and a bottle of champagne. My husband and I felt very special. We are already planning on going back next year. December is a beautiful time to be in Maui. It was 84 everyday and only rained once in 10 days. We also didn't mind not having a beach in front because we thought it kept all the people from walking through. It was very personable there.I have recommended Papakea to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Even We Locals Love It!”
Reviews.Author: A-Maui-Local
Reviews.Content: After selling our home on Maui, my husband and I lived at Papakea Resort for the month of November while looking for a long-term rental. Everything about Papakea was so wonderful that we would seriously love to find a long-term rental there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: capark
Reviews.Content: I did not want to write the review so as to keep the hidden gem hidden. This is an amazing place ..with breathtaking ocean views . We had an oceanfront balcony and i used to spend hours sitting there ...and infact its beautiful in the nights with the moon rays and the trees Condo had the regular amenities which we are satisfied with. The beach has waves and it is small. We actually did not even venture there..if we wanted to do the beach thing we went to Kapalua or other beach beaches

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: LJAOregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate my 60th birthday in December. I researched a lot of places and decided on the Papakea. I made a perfect choice and it was everything I had hoped for. Beautiful grounds and the condo itself was charming and immaculate. So cozy and perfectly decorated with ocean theme and equiped with everything we could have asked for and more. I wish I could contact the owners directly because this place was great! It was peaceful and not a noisey high rise like some are. If you are looking for a loud party place, this isn't it. I will defintely go back to this condo! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: semper24
Reviews.Content: We had a 3rd floor condo with a beautiful ocean view. The room was decorated tastefully and was well kept. Lacked AC, but was bearable with fans on and windows open. Never had an issue with noise or surly staff. Pools were clean and never too busy, hot tubs are big enough for plenty of guests to sit in and chat. Beach was a little narrow, but you can walk to a bigger one or drive to any in minutes. This is a good place for someone looking to do more than sit inside all day. It's an quick and easy drive to Lahaina or Whaler's Village where you can easily spend the whole day shopping or just enjoying Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Relaxing & Breathtaking Room”
Reviews.Author: tpiersanti
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui for our anniversary trip. After faithly checking this website for reviews on the Papakea, I'm so glad we booked here!! It was absolutely the best rate and view I could've asked for. We had a studio oceanfront room, A103. It was perfect on the first floor. We would just walk out to the lounge chairs everyday or go for a walk along the beaches. This was our first time with a condo and it was a great experience. We ate breakfast every day on the patio & watched the sunrise. At night we'd open the windows to hear the beach waves crashing. I think I'm still on Island time lol! Yes, there is a seawall in front of the property, which wasn't a problem at all. If we wanted the sandy beaches, we only had to walk to the properties next door. We were informed that any beach in Hawaii is open to the public, the hotels do block off or limit anyone to be on them. We had a breakfast orientation with Expedia, and Chip was very helpful with our bookings. I definitely recommend the zipline with Piiholo Zipline. It was our first time & the guys were great!! Our room had full accommodations and plenty of closet storage for our luggage. I bought a bag of Kona coffee & realized the next morning I had mistakenly gotten the whole bean instead of grounds. Thank gosh our room had a coffee grinder, what a relief for a coffee lover! Anything I came across, we found in the room. The staff was very friendly as well. ABC store is within walking distance & we made plenty of trips. There are markets in the area, but I recommend Safeway for the best prices. Ask the cashier for the rewards card if you don't have one, they'll give you an app on the spot & you'll save alot more. Downtown Lahaina is about 10 minutes away. It's great for some nightlife & late night shopping. You can park behind the Maui Theatre shopping center for $4 for the entire night. Don't get stuck paying a high rate per hour. Plus, most restaurants will validate, giving you a 2hr time span. Overall, we paid a great price for our stay and I'm extremely happy we decided to stay here. Since my trip is over, I'm jealous of anyone who's planning to go here in the near future lol! Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rottiesX2
Reviews.Content: We rented a 3 bedroom/3 bath unit in the "D" building. Our group consisted of 2 couples and 1 single. It was great that we each had our own bathroom. The unit had 2 bedrooms (1 queen and 1 king) on the lower level and 2 twin beds in a loft area. The kitchen had regular sized appliances. The place was clean and bug free; which is a surprise for anywhere in the islands. We had a view of the ocean and of Molokai across the grounds and the pool. We had some problems with the fans and lamps (blown light bulb) when we got there, but maintenance quickly came to fix everything. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We wish would have stayed longer. The area is nice, quiet, and peaceful. It is a short drive to Lahaina, and an even shorter drive to the nearest grocery store. There is no beach access right on hotel grounds, but looked like you could access it a little bit down the road. The pool was clean and well maintained. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, Surprise, Surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonioGolfer
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this well kept resort. Great grounds, staff, security, and cleanliness! I must say we were one of the lucky ones in our group which asked for and received a ground floor ocean front room. Wow! 20 yards of freshly mowed green grass through the palm trees to the sandy beach. The resort shares beach property and a restaurant with the next door Aston property where the best part of the sandy beach is located. During our stay they had a large seal occupy part of our beach which kept if off limits to swimming. But just a few yards down the beach we could still get ourselves wet! Only drawback for us was parking was tight down by our room. But the walk was still less than 60-70 yards. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, great price & location”
Reviews.Author: apdretired
Reviews.Content: ..we stayed in the "D" units, which afforded a nice ocean view and of the grounds. The unit was very clean, not one bug found! ~ house keeping service good too. The Resort location was in the middle of beautiful beaces, close to Lahaina and walking distance to stores. There is no sandy beach in front of the unit, but we did snorkel just to the left where it is easy to enter/exit. A rental car was a must for us, allowing access to the other famous beaches and interesting touring around Maui. Do not miss out on the area snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent oceanfront room”
Reviews.Author: wewannagoagain
Reviews.Content: Stayed in condo unit f-304. It was a one bedroom, one bath oceanfront unit. We were to have been in a garden view, but were upgraded to oceanfront, which was amazing! I can honestly say that in all of the oceanfront rooms I have ever stayed in, this was the closest to the water. I felt like I was on the balcony of a cruise ship. The condo itself was well maintained, and clean. The bed was queen size, and we are used to a king size bed, so we had to adjust to that. The property is a little older, and the units are reflective of that. It is definitely not a 4 star property, but definitely a 10 star view! The grounds are immaculate. There is no beach, no restaurant or lounge on property, but that is not why we stayed at the Papakea. It is cozy. The staff is friendly. FREE PARKING!! A real bonus in Maui these days!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: theshig
Reviews.Content: Thanks, the room, grounds, service was perfect!!! The grounds were very nice, pool nice, close to shops.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap choice, but there are newer, shinier condos nearby for not much more”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at two Aston properties in Hononkowai that are right next door to each other. This one was the cheaper option, and boy, did it show. The condo unit was indeed oceanfront, which was great. But it was obviously an older unit, with a small, difficult-to-use and tiny shower and dated furnishings. Everything worked OK, but overall, it was cramped. Still, free parking and fast high-speed internet were fantastic. In comprasion, the other condo I recently stayed at was the Aston Kaanapali Shores, which was a much better value. By spending just $25 more per night there, we got a heated swimming pool (the one here is pretty chilly) and a more modern condo with totally upgraded fixtures. Plus, the resort itself has more amenities, including shops, restaurants and an exercise room. Overall, I'd try to book a better, newer Aston condo resort property before returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: met8
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Aston was great, ocean view was beautiful, good service, well equipped condos and they even had boogie board, towels, beach chairs and a complementary breakfast session that tells abt places to see in maui. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Kama'aina Staycation”
Reviews.Author: lyketotravel
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this resort. Quick check-in, clean room. Kama'aina upgrade to an ocean front for the price of a garden room. Free Wi-Fi. Don't know that I have a bad thing to stay. One word of caution, the "free" welcome breakfast is really an Expedia sales pitch and it wasn't that great a breakfast. If you don't want to sit around for an hour, go buy your breakfast and enjoy West Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings, relaxing, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: sl215
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night during a scouting trip for our upcoming destination wedding to Maui. We arrived way early and our room wasn't ready yet, the gentleman at the counter saw we had just raided the farmers market and offered to store our food in their fridge until our room was ready. He was very helpful and had a lot of great tips for places to visit and restaurants to try. The grounds are well kept and charming. Our room had a great view, spotless and was great. They are like small condo studios so don't expect a ton, but you definitely get your monies worth. There's a kitchen if you want to eat in. The beach is right there, there are lounge chairs for guests, putting greens (which my fiance of loved), koi pond and other activities on site as well. We didn't stay long as we were island hopping but we are recommending it to all of our guests for our upcoming destination wedding!

Reviews.Title: “best deal around”
Reviews.Author: r_degeorge
Reviews.Content: got a free upgrade from ocean view to ocean front, had a heart attack when i opened the door. great water front view. peaceful and pleasant.. waves put you to sleep and cheer you up when you wake up.. clean and stocked with everything to make any meal. f203 was my room and it was perfect. if any thing pool i would of wanted more, it could use a nice bar in the resort. pool was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular comfort!”
Reviews.Author: mrwxman
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to the Aston at Papakea as a surprise for her birthday. It was our first trip to Maui so I shopped on various travel sites to find a resort that would fit our needs. We wanted a well kept resort with oceanfront rooms and a 'family' atmosphere (we've outgrown the 'party atmosphere'). This property exceeded all of our expectations. Again, my wife was in the dark on this trip and had no idea what to expect. When we walked into our room (1 bedroom oceanfront), her jaw dropped. It was well appointed and beautifully decorated with an oceanfront lanai. She looked at me and said "it's perfect" (coming from my lovely bride, that means a lot). The whole property from the grounds to the pool is immaculate. The thing that impressed us the most was the serenity. Granted, we were there during the off season, but it was peaceful. We never heard the people in the pool or heard music blaring - it was serene. The staff was always courteous and helpful with a smile on their faces. All of the rooms have a kitchen, so we stopped at the Costco outside of the Kahului airport to stock up on our adult beverages and food. We only left the resort to snorkel (check out airport beach in Ka'anapali a 15 minute walk or 4 minute drive). The Boss Frogs just down the street was a good place to rent snorkel gear and get tips on where the snorkeling hotspots are. The beach on the Papakea property is very small but right next door is another Aston property with a perfect Maui beach and it was less than a 5 minute walk from our room. We watched every sunset from our lanai while we were there. On our last night, just before sunset, we watched 2 sea turtles swim by from our lanai, how awesome is that???!!! If you are looking for a relaxing getaway in paradise, this is the place! â€“ ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Check out Papakea K404!”
Reviews.Author: RaeDVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Papakea a number of times and have always loved the friendly old-Hawaii feel of the place. However, the quality of the rooms has been somewhat spotty so this time, we decided to rent directly from an owner so we would know exactly what room we would be getting. All I can say is wow, I wish I had done this years ago! We stayed in a beautiful 3 bedroom unit, K404, that was exactly as pictured on VRBO and the owner's web site. The condo was completely remodeled, with a great kitchen and 2 bathrooms. It has an awesome view and we enjoyed many of our meals outside on the lanai looking at the ocean and, after the sun went down, enjoying the glow of the tiki torches around the pool. We saved a lot of money by cooking many of our own meals, which was easy because the condo's kitchen is stocked with everything you could possibly need and there is a Star market right across the street. Most nights, we picked up meat or fish and threw it on one of the poolside barbecue grills. The younger members of our group thoroughly enjoyed Papakea's pools, shuffleboard and tennis courts and putting greens, when they weren't down at the beach. The beach directly in front of Papakea is somewhat narrow (great for little kids), but there is a wonderful boogie-boarding beach right next door and snorkeling just a little farther down, about a 5 minute walk. The adults enjoyed just lounging on the beachfront lawn, reading and enjoying the view. If you're there between November and April, make sure to bring some binoculars and watch the whales in the channel between Maui and Molokai! At the end of the day, we retired to the condo, played games and watched TV. There is a TV in every room and a couple of DVD players, so everyone was happy. And when we were ready for bed, we hopped into some of the most comfortable beds I've ever experienced in a vacation rental. It is clear the owners of K404 take pride in their home and want to make sure you have a good time. They provided invaluable information on restaurants and activities and were very gracious answering all our questions. I cannot recommend this condo highly enough. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong renting L402 oceanfront!”
Reviews.Author: Sun-and-Ski-Mom
Reviews.Content: I came across Papakea Resort unit L402 on VRBO while researching places to stay on Maui. The pictures of the condo looked great and after a quick email exchange with Janet Brashen, the owner, we decided to rent direct with her. Janet was very easy to work with, all the rental information was very timely, and the per night cost was reasonable for oceanfront. The condo must have been recently renovated with granite countertops in the kitchen and downstairs bathrooms and an all-tile floor. It also had an airconditioning unit in the living area and the master bedroom, which was a nice addition. There were a total of three bedrooms. The master bedroom was gorgeous. It had a king-size four poster bed, expansive views of the ocean and its own en-suite bathroom with double sinks/shower. The downstairs bedroom had a double bed and access to the hallway bathroom. The upstairs loft had two twin beds and its own bathroom. Having three bathrooms was a nice feature with six people. The living room, dining and kitchen area was nicely furnished and very comfortable. The best part of the condo was the oceanfront lanai with doors that opened almost to the width of the living room. We had great dinners out on the lanai, and spent every morning gazing at Molokai and the ocean. My sisters and I concluded that the reason it was such an appealing view was because of the way the palm trees and Molokai framed the ocean. We loved the resort amenities as well as the condo. We took advantage of the grills that rimmed the perimeter of the pools and grilled several dinners at the condo. We also played putt-putt every night while getting the food ready. The adults' favorite activity was to take a glass of wine out, lounge in a beach chair on grass strip fronting the ocean and watch the sun set. We have some beautiful pictures from those evenings. Our boys loved the pool and the hot tub. The other great thing about Papakea was that it was convenient to a couple of small restaurants, grocery store, ABC store, wellness center for massages and snorkel rental. So here's some tips if you decide to stay on Maui and/or at Papakea: 1. Stock up on food stuffs and alcohol at Costco - it's very close to the airport. 2. Da Kitchen in Kahului is a great restaurant with excellent food. We had lunch there after shopping at Costco and ate the leftovers for dinner. We found out about it from the Costco ladies. We were quite bummed to find out it was not open on Sunday when coming back from our Hana Highway jaunt. 3. Annie's is a little hole in the wall snorkel place in front of Papakea that had good snorkel gear at reasonable prices. Check with the Expedia tour booking guide at Papakea to get a discount coupon. 4. Okayazuya & Deli is a great place to get excellent takeout and their salmon and mahimahi dinners were superb. 5. Paragon Sailing Charters was a fun time. We did a Molokini snorkel cruise with them and really enjoyed sailing on the catamaran on the way back. 6. The Old Lahaina Luau is worth going to if you have never been to a luau, but I think if you been to one, once is enough. 7. Haleakala crater hiking is challenging but fun. We are still laughing about how insane we were to hike Haleakala and drive Hana Highway (only 14 miles of it) in the same day. 8. We had great fun snorkeling around the buoys that are about 100 feet south of the condo. I even saw a moray eel (quite scary looking!) 9. West Maui Wellness Center was convenient to Papakea and offered a nice lomi-lomi massage. 10. Surf lessons at Goofy Foot Surf School were ok, but if you want to ride a lot of waves, it would pay to hire a private instructor. 11, The ABC store in front of Papakea had the best souvenirs and t-shirts for reasonable prices - we went there almost everyday for something. Maui was my favorite island of the three that we visited in Hawaii (Oahu and Kauai being the other two). I think a large part of the reason was the great condo. Thanks Janet!

Reviews.Title: “A great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: 3july83
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time at the Papakea, and we were very pleased. The complex is well-maintained, and it full of friendly people. We had a nice two-bedroom condo (K203) which we rented through Maui Holiday, and our friends had a one-bedroom (K206). We have stayed at more expensive properties, but we enjoy the family-friendly atmosphere of the Papakea. We hope to return to Maui in a couple of years, and we will once again stay at the Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: LaborActivist
Reviews.Content: We just got back after our 12 days on Maui and stayed at Papakea the entire time. Our unit was reserved at an unbelievable rate and we expected our 1 bedroom 1 bath lodging, however, upon arrival we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom/2 bath with the loft - absolutely wonderful surprise, even if we didn't spend much time in the room. The location is excellent, right on the beach and walking distance to the small grocery stores and the park with kids' playground. Our absolute favorite place to eat was Okazuya, prices are pretty high for take-out, but food is absolutely awesome, their Japanese Mahi Mahi were a hit with our family! Resort is kept clean, but our specific room did scream for some TLC as the chipping paintsfrom the ceiling was welcoming us home every evening.

Reviews.Title: “The Lanai was amazing”
Reviews.Author: hi223344
Reviews.Content: Stayed at A-306 Papakea Resort studio with Oceanfront view. Booked through Maui Dreams Come True. It was amazing! We cooked and pretty much ate on the Lanai every sunset, saves money and great view. Booking this condo was a great money saver, we went to the Star Market the first night (overpriced grocery store) and then also Safeway about 5 miles away (better prices) and just bought wine, beer, and cooked most of the meals. Dinners on the Lanai were romantic and the sunset from the unit was beautiful. The unit has A/C, ceiling fan, washer/dryer, dishwasher, and bunch of other amenities. The resort has 2 swimming pools/jacuzzis, putting green, shuffleboard and a little area where you can enter the ocean or just lay out on beach chairs. I thank Maui Dreams Come True. Misty provides great service prior to, during, and after the stay. Randy was the guy who booked the room for me, great guy has a lot of information. Just a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Balance of Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: modad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Papakea building 'L' the first week of August. We had stayed in Napili and Kahana on previous visits and the Papakea was the best condo to date. It seems that to get true upscale, you have to compromise your view with restaurants and boardwalks and crowds. One of the great things about the Papakea is that is is at the end of the north Kaanapli beach, so you don't have all the distractions from your view, but the desired amenities of restaurants and beach are literally next door with Kaanapali Shores and Kaanapali Beach Club. Even the Whalers Village and Lahaina itself are easy drives. We rented from an individual and the unit was very updated. Location right on the water made for great sunsets and sleeping with the sound of the waves. The other units I looked in also seemed nice, but I'm sure that is unit-specific. The grounds were very well kept, lush and tropical. Parking was never a problem, and we never felt like we were in a crowded resort, like we have experienced before. We have booked for Hawaii again, and we would gladly return to the Papakea if we go back to Maui, and that is the best recommendation I can give!

Reviews.Title: “OK,Not bad,Nice location friendy staff!”
Reviews.Author: myequinox
Reviews.Content: Nice place, not fancy but clean.Nice grounds and pools.close to every thing.would stay there again,Very easy to get in and out of.The staff that I dealt with very nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: gpgirly
Reviews.Content: Great place right on the ocean, we had an older unit...and loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, POOR Management”
Reviews.Author: robertdennisbg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one month. We loved the place and the location. But my wife had her medicine FEDexed, and the front office refused delivery, didn't notify us when it arrived. I had to call Fedex and have it redelivered. Management did nothing to help. This left a Very bad taste in our mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Papakea resort in Maui”
Reviews.Author: JustNikkiCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 28th - July 2 and had a blast. We were in a condo that slept 10 it was beautiful except upstairs was really warm until the air got moving. The complex was VERY well maintained. Barbecues were clean. Pool was clean. We could walk to Star Market..drove down to Hula Grill, it was yummy and beautiful view. We also went Ziplining at Kanapalli with Eco Tours...AMAZING, the whole experience was great..the tour leaders were fun and the manger at Check in was great too...went to Kimos for lunch one day it was great too...post of it was very positive. Maui was a little too slow for me..I think I will go back to Oahu next time but totally enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I am scared!”
Reviews.Author: maliburum4545
Reviews.Content: OMG! I just called a few minutes ago to make changes on my reservation and the reservation agent was MEAN!!! I've been going to Hawaii religiously twice a year for the past five years and OMG this is the first time I've encountered a creature like that! Now, I am scared to stay in this hotel! TOTALLY RUINED MY NIGHT! With the economy right now, it's easy to find a friendlier and more efficient staff! REPLACE HER! I hope our post cruise stay here won't be a horror experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved condo L-405”
Reviews.Author: zentrail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea in condo L-405 and absolutely loved it! I had read reviews on this site and knew to look for a recently remodeled unit and this one was gorgeous. Everything was in pristine shape and beautifully appointed, and most importantly to me....perfectly clean!! You are right on the ocean and have great views from almost anywhere in the house except the back bedroom, which my sisters liked since it was quiet and a little removed from the hub bub. The kitchen is totally modern and well stocked, we loved making up Mai Tais and cooking Hawaiian meals to enjoy with the view from the lanai. The bathrooms were unbelievable, beautifully custom made cabinetry and glass enclosures that remind you of ocean waves. Just lovely. The only sound you heard the whole time was the sound of the ocean, which we all loved. Once in a while the sounds of the pool area would drift over and we all thought "thank goodness we don't have a room near the pool!" I imagine it could get a little annoying if you were subjected to that for extended periods! We used the pool/hot tub in the evening when all the kids had gone and it was very nice. The grounds are very nice and well maintained. We didn't use much of them since we had the ocean at our front door and didn't need anything else! There is a nice lawn directly in front of the condo with palm trees for shade if wanted and lounge chairs to catch some rays in, with a narrow beach just past a sea wall. The beach is very pretty but you can't really swim there unless you have some beach shoes because there's a lot of coral and rocks. But very nice wading pools develop at low tide for kids to search for shells and for adults to just hang out in. I actually did some snorkeling there but it was a little dicey walking out on the slippery rocks and all. If you walk south (make a left when you hit the beach) you will find plenty of spots to swim without the rocks....and you can walk or run all the way down to Black Rock if you want. If you go north the beach will disappear pretty quickly. But you've got the best of both worlds, you're close to Black Rock and the famous, glitzy Ka'anapali Beach strip and yet you're a little set apart so you don't have all the congestion (and the higher prices!) to deal with. We never heard any traffic from our condo, only the ocean. There's a great Farmer's Market that's open a few days a week right down the road where you can get fresh local produce, try the Maui sweet corn! Yum! And there are plenty of cute little shops close to the condo plus a place to rent snorkel gear. We did most of our shopping within 5 minutes of the condo! We didn't use the office much but everyone was very friendly and accommodating. There is a one time morning breakfast given in a gazebo close by the condo where Expedia gives a little talk about Maui and then offers you tours etc to go on. You can pick whatever day you want to do it....we ended up going on our 4th day there. The talk was informative but I didn't stick around for any of the activity info since I had read my books (and this site) and knew what I wanted to do already. All in all I enjoyed the Papakea in general and LOVED our condo there and can't rave enough about it. Just do your research and make sure the condo has been recently remodeled and you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, beautiful grounds!”
Reviews.Author: BBallRef
Reviews.Content: We stayed in C402 (privately owned) and had a great time. This was a one-bedroom, one-bath unit with loft that fit the five of us just fine. The owner was very helpful and courteous regarding any questions and concerns (we had none) we might have. The unit was clean when we arrived for our 7 night stay. We did not have housekeeping service so that was not an issue. Washing machine, dryer, plenty of utensils and beach toys created a lot of convenience for us. The A/C is in the living room but plenty of fans to pull air to the back bedroom for comfortable sleeping. This unit was back a ways from the water but, from the fourth floor, afforded a beautiful view over the grounds, pool and ocean. Very relaxing. Pool was maintained well. Not much beach in front but a short walk to the south there was plenty of sand and fun to be had. We had a lot of fun on the well-manicured putting green as well as a few sessions on the nice tennis courts. Nice place, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lakefriend
Reviews.Content: We booked our Condo through Maui Dreams Come True. Since we did everything over the internet, I was a little concerned but Misty our agent was very helpful and it was everything she said it would be. We stayed in G404 a 2bd 1 ba which could use some updating but it was very clean and comfortable for our family of 4. The views were great of the pool and ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, view and location”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn96
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents, who are in their 60's. We had a beautiful view of the gardens, ponds, and pool with the ocean in the background. Our unit was well-stocked with all the kitchen supplies we needed, and it was lovely to sit out on our lanai each morning for breakfast and to catch the sunset in the evenings. There is a farmer's market within walking distance on Mon, Wed, and Fri mornings, as well as a Star Market grocery store and several restaurants. The location is very convenient to Lahaina (only about 5 minutes' drive) for additional shopping and dining options.We booked a Road to Hana tour through the Expedia concierge and enjoyed it very much. The only negatives were relatively minor. The floors could have been cleaned better and more often. They were only mopped once at our request during our 5 days there. Housekeeping services were inconsistent--e.g,. wastebaskets were emptied some days and not others (bathroom wastebasket was never emptied our whole stay!), pillow from sofa bed was stowed in different closets each day, etc. The AC unit is in the living room, not the bedroom, which means the bedroom will always be slightly warmer than the rest of the unit. This was not a problem for my parents, who don't like the AC too cold, but someone who prefers cooler sleeping conditions might want to use the sofa bed in the living room instead. Overall the stay was very pleasant and convenient for us. We will likely stay there again in the future. The bedroom faces the parking lot so it has the potential to be noisy, but luckily we didn't experience any problems with noise during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cattwomen
Reviews.Content: we checked in May 23rd for a one night stay before out time share. The two bedroom I booked on line was awesome. We were in the G building with ocean view. It was beautiful. the grounds are superb. My husband and I woke up early and walked along the beach and grounds. Our teenage daughters got up later and enjoyed the beatiful grounds also. the rooms was very nice sized and clean and updated. the lanai was nice also. the only complaint I would have is the fact that the air conditioner is in the living room and the bed rooms were on the warm side when we arrived. The ceiling fans helped but froze in living room when bedrooms got cold. Only complaint in a very nice and beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, just make sure you know who manages your unit.”
Reviews.Author: tsirhcnitsurt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a little over a week and had a great time. Paid for ocean view and showed up to receive an ocean front. Room was upgraded with granite and a memory foam bed (Murphy in the studio). It was clean and the staff onsite were great! Walked right out onto the lawn every day to see the water and even caught a couple dozen spinner dolphins jumping all over the place. There isn't much of a walking beach right out front, but many go in and snorkel in the morning. Now one thing to mention, out of the 300+ units there, only about 1/2 are managed by Aston, so some folks aren't able to check in or get service from the front desk or onsite staff, though they try to accommodate. Know who own and manages the unit before you show up and expect the folks from Aston to be able to help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Big Mistake - Noise made it impossible to sleep”
Reviews.Author: davekathy
Reviews.Content: First three nights at Papakea were relatively quiet. However on the 4 and 5th nights it was so noisy we were unable to sleep. Kids running between rooms and across corridors, doors slamming, people yelling, tv noise, etc made it impossible to not only not enjoy outside lani we could hear all this from inside unit with air conditioner on.Complaints about noise to front desk and security were basically ignored. Too bad, this was our second visit to Papakea and will be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, awesome sunsets, a wonderful vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: becinsd
Reviews.Content: Traveling with two college boys I was a bit worried they would not have enough to do. I was wrong. We booked through Maui Dreams Come True and it was a wonderful experience. Randy was right. We loved our condo, the location was perfect and I never grew tired of the sound of the waves crashing on the beach. Never before have we stayed so close to the water. The sunsets were spectacular and after the first couple days we complained that our food was not cold enough in the refrigerator, you were out the same day with a repairman. A new refrigerator next day and microwave as the door would stick. We were very impressed with how fast Maui Dreams came through for us. Even with follow up calls. We were impressed with the whole week actually and definitely will be back. I do not want to post the unit number because then it will be more difficult to book in the future. Thanks Randy, and I finally drank your Corona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: GordKend
Reviews.Content: We had a 7 day stay at the Papakea recently. The location is nice , close to many restaurants and shopping. It is at the north tip of kaanapali beach. The unit we stayed in was oceanfront so the view was awesome. We really didn't use the facilities that much as found it much nicer going to the beach. Our unit was updated and comfortable except for the fact the bedroom backs on to the parking lot area and the noise was really noticeable. When people were talking outside, you could hear every word clearly. Secondly, we were on the third floor yet still had small ants regularly in the unit. As we did not spend a lot of time in the condo, the drawbacks were not that big. For the money we spent, the unit was likely worth it although we would probably look t other options if we went back. The front desk staff were very nice to deal with and helpful throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Rooms Adequate F405”
Reviews.Author: Can_we_go
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, which consisted of 2 married couples, stayed at the Aston Papakea 9 nights in May. We had planned to travel to Mexico but had to change our plans due to the swine flu scare. We made reservations last minute and got a great rate at the Papakea. First of all, the service from the front desk staff was the BEST!! They allowed us to check out a couple of rooms and choose the one we wanted. We stayed on room F405, which is on the top floor oceanFRONT. The view was beautiful! The condo itself was OK. It was two full bedrooms plus a loft and three bath. The only complaint we had was we were two married couples and the extra private bedroom was 2 twin beds while the loft had a queen. Not much privacy in a loft. We chose this room, though, so no complaints. The unit could use some upgrades and better quality living room furniture as well as a better stocked kitchen. The view and location made up for the rooms deficiencies. The location of the property is nice. Walking distance to grocery, ABC store, FArmers Market, etc. Grounds are lovely. Pleny of loungers, nice pools, two hot tubs, trees, flowers and koi ponds. I would recommend the management add some shade areas such as palapas or somewhere to get out of the sun when on the beach or by the pool. Many people prefer shade to sun and there wasn't much. Overall - SUPER place to stay and would highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “F 110 Beach Front, Refurbished, Bright Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Moravecglobal
Reviews.Content: Have never had anything better...and don't think I'll ever find anthing better on the beach in North West Maui. Guests are friendly We have return every year for the last 7 years

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is the one!”
Reviews.Author: Saruhhh
Reviews.Content: The unit we stayed in (L403) was fully oceanfront. Not an "oceanview". Fully oceanfront. We kept the sliding glass door open every night and we all fell asleep to the sound of the waves. We sat on the lanai and watched the whales at all hours of the day. The unit had an upgraded kitchen and upgraded baths. I recommend this unit, or at least staying in any unit in the L building. I rented the unit direct from the owner on a "vacation rental by owner" site and saved a LOT. Contact me if you want their info. The Papakea property is fantastic! It's very well-manicured and parking is free (that is a rarity). All buildings have elevators and parking was easy to find at all hours. There are two pools and it was never a problem to get a lounge chair. There are about 5 or 6 gas grills at each pool and they're in high demand around dinner time. The two large cabanas are free to "rent", with just a security deposit. Great if you have a large group. The lobby and garden staff were very friendly and helpful. The property has a lot of free perks for their guests, like water-aerobics classes, yoga classes, and putting contests on the property's putting green. There is an Expedia desk in the lobby and on your first morning, they invite you to a free breakfast. The breakfast is just some Costco pastries and the seminar lasts about an hour. It was pretty informative and they gave away a ticket for a dinner cruise (for one person, which was a little shady, but, I guess it works for them) and a bus trip to Hana. I won the Hana trip and went. It was great! You can walk to the grocery store across the street. In the same shopping center are also a dive shop for your snorkel rentals, and a very popular coffee house (Java Jazz).There is no on-site restaurant, but there is one at the resort next door, and a few in the grocery store shopping center across the street. There is also a Farmer's Market a few days a week, about a 1/4 mile down the street. Make sure to go! You'll find a few things that you can't find on the mainland. I recommend this property for anyone looking for a great time at a lower price. You'll save money cooking your own meals a few times on your trip and the units are condos. The one I stayed in was fully stocked with all the comforts of home. If you are looking to be waited on hand and foot, try the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. If you want to stay in paradise and NOT spend three months pay, stay at the Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well maintained grounds, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JannerCalgary_Canada
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the middle of the night after a 9 hour trip. Night manager was friendly and efficient. We checked in to Unit C305. The carpet is still stained and dirty (see earlier review). The next morning we requested a move. Moved into B202. All clean and fine. Grounds, pools and BBQs are cleaned and maintained every day by friendly staff. I think that every unit has a view of the ocean. Well maintained shuffleboard, putting greens and tennis courts. Aquacise classes in the pool 3 times a week. Farmers' market, mini-store (ABC) and Star Supermarket 5 minutes walk away. The management should mandate a minimum standard of maintenence in the units and enforce it for those owners that wish to rent. Poorly maintained units drag down the reputation of the whole Resort. Don't waste time going to the complimetary breakfast where the Expedia agents will try and sell you tickets to many events and tours. We paid for a couple and enjoyed them, but you can buy rush-tickets in Lahaina for the same events at discounts as big as 80%. Tourism is down by 15% from February last year, so you can get evening cocktail whale trips for $8 (last-minute) compared with Expedia's $44/each. We paid full price for a dinner theatre show of Ulalena (Cirque de Soleil) followed by dinner at Ruth's Chris's Steakhouse. Both were excellent. If you want a quiet place, this is it. Not recommended for all-you can-drink or night life at the Resort. Saw a few families with 2-3 year old kids, but wouldn't recommend it for families with active, mobile kids or teens. We would return to Maui and Papakea again.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea K303 is Fabulous - Can't wait to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: SKSD
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Papakea unit K 303. This 2 bedroom 2 bath was perfect for our family - Grandma/Grandpa, Mom/Dad and 2 small children. The huge master had a comfortable king sized bed, 2nd bedroom had two twins, and a comfy hide-a-bed in the livingroom. The condo was very clean and nicely updated. The view from K303 was fabulous!! We enjoyed having breakfast every morning on the very private lanai which overlooks the pool area and out to the ocean - we even watched whales from our lanai! The grounds are beautifully maintained with fun amenities like shuffleboard, putt putt golf, and ponds filled with koi. The heated pool was fantastic as was the hot tub. This unit had all the necessities for cooking in, which we did most nights. We loved using the gas BBQ's which are down by the pool too. The Star Market is within walking distance which was very convenient for getting our groceries. The beach is wonderful and great for small children because it is protected by a small reef. This was the perfect family destination - we're already planning our return!!!

Reviews.Title: “decent condo, great location”
Reviews.Author: lilbass
Reviews.Content: The resort was perfect for us! The property and location were great. If you are looking for something quieter, this is perfect! Our unit was adequate. Maui Dreams Come True was wonderful to work with! We would certainly return to this location. There seems to me much variability in the condo units depending on ownership.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: dewey.nikhu
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We booked this condo through a travel agent after we were overwhelmed by the number of condos for rent in Maui. We stayed in a wonderful 2 bedroom oceanfront third floor unit (L305). The condo unit was very comfortable for six people. Good sized kitchen with modern appliances. Washer and dryer was very handy. The lania provided wonderful views of the ocean and Molokai. The Papakea resort was great. Very friendly staff. Very kid friendly. The resort was right on the beach. Never crowded. The resort had two pools neither of which were very crowded. One of them was right next to our building. The resort was minutes away from many other excellent beaches and "downtown" Lahaina. I would definitely come back to stay and wished we did not have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Cate23
Reviews.Content: Do not book any units with "Maui Dreams Come True". This was our second stay at Papakea. The properties were booked through a management group known as "Maui Dreams Come True". On our arrival, both units were dirty at 4pm which was the check in time we were given. Multiple phone calls to this management group and no calls back. I finally found the cell phone number of the property manager Misty, and when I called her, she was in a bar on SuperBowl Sunday and had deliberately not returned our frantic calls. One of the units was finally ready at 6pm and the other was ready 4 hours late at 8pm. So my elderly in-laws stood around in the parking lot for 2 hours until our unit was cleaned and then had to wait until 8pm before they could finally relax in their unit. This management group never returned any of our calls. I would not recommend using this group as our experience was apparently a common one:according to staff at this resort, this group always refuses to return calls when there is a problem. One unit, C-305, was somewhat updated, but carpets were stained, pillows were like pancakes, mattresses were poor and linens were unmatched, worn and poor quality. The other unit, L-107, was badly in need of an update and had stained carpets and similar mattresses and linens. We will not stay at this resort again, and will not recommend it to anyone we know after this horrible experience and after the disrespectful way that we were treated. On a good, note, the staff at the registration were very helpful and empathetic about our frustrations with the management group.

Reviews.Title: “Love Papakea, but be careful which room you book!”
Reviews.Author: AdamsAmbers_Grandma
Reviews.Content: We recently reserved 3 condos with Maui Dreams Come True at Papakea for ourselves, and our 2 sons and their families. 2 of the 3 condos were very nice--remodeled, clean, great view of the ocean! We were very happy with these condos: B-307 and C-208. But, then there is F-209. This condo is absolutely terrible! F-209 is in bad shape. First, it needs new carpeting as the carpeting that is there is dirty--stains everywhere, and it smells. Then, the dishwasher is falling out of the cabinets, so it can't be used. The condo really needs to be remodeled. It's a great location--ocean front--but, it's just not worth the money. We called Maui Dreams Come True several times to get the dishwasher fixed, and to discuss the condo, but they were not very responsive to our complaints. They said they had reduced the price on this condo--but they certainly didn't tell us that, and it was the most expensive of the 3 condos. Overall, we love Papakea and we've stayed there 2 years now. We have already booked a room for Jan., 2010--but not this condo, or with this company. Papakea is a really lovely place and it's worth checking out. Just get as much info as you possibly can if you are not booking through Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Maui vacation 2009”
Reviews.Author: Buffaloguyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 15 nights at our condo G202 at the Papakea. The unit was ok although not as good as previous units we have visited. Recently painted and freshened up the unit had problems: 1. the fridge struggled to get into the safe zone for food 2. the bathroom light fixture only worked occassionally (likely a failing ballast) 3. hair blocking the drain in the bathtub reluctantly let water drain (not our hair -I'm bald and my wife has little hair loss 4. the second floor view is compromised by the tree outside- offset by some increase in privacy 5. the smell in the kitchen was offensive - old original cupboards not helped with fresh paint- very old compared to other units at the Papakea the agent was very responsive to our calls and friendly in dealing with. their policy of payment within 90 days of our stay turned out brilliantly as cdn currency at best level saving us over 18% vs later conversion rate. Our stay was very enjoyable in spite of unit issues and we are already talking about returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “holiday with good friends”
Reviews.Author: alwayscold
Reviews.Content: We showed up from the frozen tundra they call Canada and were not disappointed, the holiday was wonderful. Our accommodations were more than adequate although not as nice as our friends who had a icemaker,yes a icemaker so we spent alot of time there. It was a nice quiet place and the pools and grounds were very beautiful,the staff was more than accommodating and very friendly they took care of our every concern. I had read some of the bad reviews that were written about this resort and concluded that these people would complain if you hanged them with a new rope, if you want 5 star then open your pocketbook and be prepared to spend.

Reviews.Title: “rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: lisated_8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 25th anniversary trip stayed Nov 14 thru the 21st The floors in our 1 bedroom condo(j306) were so bad I can not believe the owner of this unit allowed the floors to be uncovered when the rooms were plastered and painted You could see the hardened plaster on the tile in the kitchen We washed the floors but it did no good As for the carpet you would think that it would have been at the very least vacuumed or replaced before say 1970 we rarely took our shoes off yucky!!!! daily maid service is a way for managment to make sure YOUR not screwing things up They NEVER once vacuumed or made bed just took garbage so the ants were not a problem and took old towels and put up fresh towels the location of this property is fantasic the grounds were beautiful parking a breeze but really the units are in need of updating some units had the furniture on the balconies so I would guess they were being remodled but my guess is that you get what you pay for great rate bad room top rate good room sorry but not that impressed spend a little more go to another place

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: alatka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Papakea on our honeymoon in Maui. We had a one bedroom ocean-front unit in building F. The property is lovely, well maintained and is easily accessible to the Ka'anapali Beach area. It appears as though all of the units have some amount of ocean view from the balcony. They have 3 buildings that are ocean front (balconies face directly to the ocean). In addition, the property is only about a 15 minute drive from the Front street area of Lahaina (the area with lots of shops and restaurants). It is also very close to a strip mall with a 24 hour grocery store. Upon checking in to our unit, we had a number of small issues that were rather irritating. The key maker wasn't working, so security had to let us in our room whenever we left. In addition, the stove wasn't working properly (burners wouldn't heat up), the toaster was broken, the dishware door was broken, the shower wouldn't drain, etc. Thankfully, the management and maintenance staff were more than willing to do whatever it took to improve our stay. They even offered us our choice of two other units (however we chose to stay in our original). The management quickly fixed or replaced all of the appliances that weren't working, along with the shower drain. They also gave us a discounted rate on our unit. The decor of the unit was a bit outdated. Mostly it was in need of a coat of paint. The walls were banged up from where luggage and/or furniture had been moved in and out. However, it had a lovely tile floor throughout and the ocean front view simply could not be beat. We were on the 3rd floor of building F which is directly on the ocean with views of the northern end of Ka'anapali beach, the islands of Lanai & Molokai and the northern shores towards Napili. We had a gorgeous view of the sun setting over Lanai each night and woke up to sun lighting the green mountains of Molokai. The two pools and jacuzzis where well maintained. The property has a sea wall instead of a beach, but it is in walking distance (less than 5 minutes) to the northern end of Ka'anapali beach. They also provide stairs with sea shore access during low tide. There were also tons of lawn chairs for sun bathing near the sea wall. For experienced snorkelers, there is a lovely reef about 100 yards off the sea wall. Getting out there can be tricky depending upon the tide, but we were able to follow the shoreline down and see many tropical fish and eels. In short, what started out as a nightmare honeymoon ended up being a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is Great”
Reviews.Author: JennErationX
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! I stayed at the Papakea 5 years ago, and while I loved the location and grounds I was totally unimpressed with the condo itself. When I was booking a trip to Maui for my husband and I this time around, I was hesitant to book the Papakea, but did so because I loved the condo grounds, location and convenient (free) parking. I booked directly with ResortQuest and was reassured by the girl on the phone that I would get a recently remodeled condo. When we got to the location, we found we had been upgraded (for free) to an Ocean Front studio. It was recently remodeled with a slate shower and granite kitchen (unit F107). We loved it. We often slept with the door open listening to the waves crash on the beach. The view of Molokai was breathtaking as were the often seen rainbows over Molokai. I've attached photos. Of note, if you're looking for crowds or to sip Mai Tai's served to you on a beach, this is not the location for you. (there is no beach to speak of) But, if you're an adventurer and will be spending most of your time outside of the condo (hiking or doing activities) and looking for a hot tub to relax in after a long day, then this is it. We will always return to the Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkid86
Reviews.Content: Wow!! Papkea is perfect, we booked throught the resort itself, and got an amazin apartment -J203!! it was perfect, newly decorated, one bedroom had a king bed, the other had 2 queen beds. such a comfortable apartment, with all the amenities. the only thing is you cant smoke anywhere, the only place you can smoke is the carpark, which is conjunction with the law, so cant complain about that!! Would definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation at the beautiful Papakea Resort”
Reviews.Author: bpatters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea Resort for a full week in mid-August and had one of the most wonderful vactions we have ever had. The resort was incredible with breath taking views of the ocean and of the fantastic gardens at the resort from our one bedroom suite. The staff did a great job taking care of our every need. The expedia.com team that helps guests with their activities were very helpful and honest with all their recommendations. We went to their orientation on our first morning there and in a fast paced effort so as not to waste any of our valuable time provided info that helped us make selections about what we wanted to do and confirmed all our choices. They also made several reservations for us during the week. We all participated in the onsite activities such as yoga by the ocean and water aerobics several mornings. The resort is located just north of the Kaanapali area where all the major chain resorts (Sheraton, Hyatt) are located which made it great so you could avoid all the hustle and noise there each night, but close enough that you could be in the middle of it if you wanted to. The staff at the hotel did a great job of cleaning our room every few days without any charge, they changed our beach towels at the front desk as often as we needed them changed when we came back from all the beautiful beaches that were close by and were as helpful as they could be. The room had everything you could possibly need and it was very clean and comfortable. The beds and pillows were really nice. The pools at the resort were fantastic with plenty of lounge chairs and grills to cook on. The resort has well manicured grass that goes right up to the ocean retaining wall where you could stay out of the sand if you wanted to and still walk down the steps and you were in the waves. We couldn't have had a better time and enjoyed every minute of our stay. We really missed the Papakea Resort duing the next week when we went to Oahu and stayed at the Embassy Suites there on Wakaki Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, beautiful grounds, great unit!”
Reviews.Author: bpgartman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Papakea resort just north of Ka'anapali in Maui. We loved the location - close to Lahaina (ten minutes) and within an hour of Makena and Hookipa. Our unit, G102, was a ground floor unit, which I was initially hestitant about, but we ended up loving it! The easy pool and beach access and gorgeous view of the koi pond were wonderful. After arriving at night, waking up to the stunning view of Lani and Molokai was tremendous! For a beachfront condominium complex, the Papakea has some really pretty property to walk - many of the condos just seem to be slammed up against the beachfront and very crowded. The management company (we rented through VRBO) and Papakea personnel were great (the owners are very friendly, too! They checked in with us about our stay)- never had any problems! The kitchen had recently been remodeled and had everything, which was great because we cooked in alot. The property has many grills, too. We liked that it wasn't a huge complex, but it was very family oriented. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: travelerinscottsdale
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous about staying here after reading the many mixed reviews. We booked directly with the owner and the unit was wonderful - 1 bedroom w/ a loft. Remodeled kitchen w/ granite counters, new cabinets and new stainless steel appliances. Remodeled bathrooms w/ granite counters. The wall air-conditioning unit was more than adequate to cool the unit - upstairs and down. Beautiful grounds - less than 300 feet from the ocean. Just sitting on the lanai was so peaceful and relaxing. I have to admit - looking into windows, the units are varied. Some still have the old white cabinets w/ laminate countertops - ugh.
