I wouldn't be a happy person if I was staying in one of those units. I want a nice place when I'm on vacation We went to the breakfast orientation - DO NOT go to the Hyatt Regency luau. Contrary to what the Expedia concierge has to say about it - it's ovepriced, they use cheapest alcohol I've ever tasted (reminds me of 10c alcohol night in college) and the food is yuck.. You can't even get a blended drink - don't you want a Pina Colada when watching a Hawaiian dance?? For more than a $100/person - it is the biggest scam on the island. Get the "Maui Revealed" book - it's invaluable and we used it all the time. Every restaurant we tried had a good review - Penne Pasta, Flatbread Company in Paia, Fred's Mexican Cafe in Kihei, Cool Cats for burgers. All great - We are coming back here again and will stay in the same place. Happy vacationers Scottsdale Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is just okea!”
Reviews.Author: AnninAZ
Reviews.Content: We booked the Papakea thru Interval World after reading many of the reviews here. My daughter and I arrived as we were celebrating her graduation. We were in bldg B which had an excellent view of the garden and the ocean. We spent our time outdoors much of our stay, so with that respect, we loved the grounds of the Papakea, wide open, green and floral. We walked the beach past other condos and agreed that we much prefer the smaller resort to large, highrise ones with massive parking areas and very little grounds to enjoy. Our room was a 1 bedroom and though it was plenty of space for the two of us, it defitely had the 70's look and feel to it. Overall it was clean with the exception of some very small speckles of mold over the shower (mini tub) and when the sunlight cast through the sliding doors, you could see the wall of glass had quite a bit of dust accumulated. We weren't aware of any maid service until we found our bed made by the 3rd or 4th day. I was a bit surprised that there was no dish soap for the kitchen sink, only dishwasher. We purchased a small bottle from the ABC market and left it for the next guest. However, when I saw housekeeping cleaning out the condo across from us, I had the feeling they take anything left in the condo. We enjoyed our meals on the lanai, and enjoyed the yoga classes by the ocean. The host meeting regarding trips was worth it and made it easy to pick and choose what we wanted to do. I would highly suggest the Road to Hana trip (our favorite) and we took a day hike -waterfall trip too (enjoyed). We had great tour guides on both. We highly recommend the Pacific whale foundation Eco tours - though not too impressed with molokini, we loved the turtle town portion; overall an enjoyable trip. The Hyatt Luau was okay, but not worth the money. As you can see, we spent most of our time outdoors, and it was nice to return to the Papakea in the evenings to relax. I have to say, the queen size bed was quite comfortable, but the entire unit is defitely overdo for an update. We just took it all in stride and accepted the 70's look. It was such a great location and the price was right so we would consider returning there again. Hopefully we could get an updated unit the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: kristencrts
Reviews.Content: Having traveled and stayed at many resorts in Mexico and the Caribbean, I had high expectations of Papakea Resort. When arriving and checking in we were greeted with a friendly Aloha, given our key and â€œfree breakfast ticketâ€� (you have to listen to a 30 talk on different tours to take). When walking up to L408 we noticed many construction workers and cats. We walked into our condo and saw plastic covering our ceiling and the dÃ©cor was from the early 90â€™s. Our â€œtwo bedroom two bathâ€� was also disappointing. We had requested one king and one queen. We received one queen bed and two twin beds that were located in a loft area. The only really good thing about our room was the view. Feet from the beach and ocean were definitely worth the 10 hour trip! Cleaning service was not what you would expect. They will change your sheets and sweep the floor if you write them a note. Otherwise expect only clean towels! That was even hard to come by. We ended up going to Star Market and getting our own cleaning products and taking care of our moldy showers and dusty tables. The pool area was fun and I would recommended getting their and relaxing before the children arrive! The pool security is really strict on the no floaties or beach balls in the pool. You can get beach towels at the front desk and be very careful with them. We placed them on the lanai one night, had high winds, and one flew off. The unethical grounds crew picked it up and did not turn it in. Needless to say we were charged 25 dollars. The grills had some kind of governor on them which would only allow them to get to 300 degrees. So plan on having dinner be cooking for a long time. Trust me we tried to turn them up and we found that the two end grills were the best. Having traveled many places and having and high expectations made me realize that Papakea was not a 5 star resort. My recommendation would be to ask to a fully remodeled condo, be prepared to clean, and buy a beach towel at the ABC store. Any questions or to see pictures feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Small and cramped.”
Reviews.Author: Badger22
Reviews.Content: For a family of 4, the units are cramped. With only one bathroom to use, there were some challenges. The staff was accommodating, however not overly informative. Extra charges for golf clubs to use on the putting green and for the safe key was dissappointing. Nickle and diming an already pricy getaway was sad. The unit we stayed in had a half tub and rotting wood around the floor as well as water stains in the ceiling area. While the location was great and the views were really nice, we would only stay there again if we are provided pictures of our room and guaranteed that room once we reviewed the pictures. Understanding that some units have been renovated more recently, it would be suggested that all units maintain a certain level of amenities and are renovated on a periodic basis.

Reviews.Title: “No privacy!!! Will never stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: MARRIEDATLAST
Reviews.Content: Rented a condo here for a week for my honeymoon. Was completely disappointed when we saw our room. Dirty and rusty with bugs flying all around. The second night was very unpleasant as there was a bunch of drunk teenagers having a party right above us...before we knew it the party moved outside-which then escalated into a drunken brawl on the stairs. Hotel security and cops made an appearance...a very long and disruptive night. The fourth day my husband and I took a snorkel tour, prior to leaving we had placed the "privacy" card on our door. We do not like people in our room when we are not present. When we returned to the condo there were two housekeepers in our room! I immediately called and spoke to the housekeeping manager who mentioned that the Papakea's policy is that a housekeeper MUST enter each room every 48 hours. However, that is NOT written in any of their paperwork, nor was it ever brought to our attention upon check-in. IT IS ILLEGAL TO ENTER A ROOM THAT HAS REQUESTED PRIVACY!!! I WILL NEVER BOOK A ROOM HERE AGAIN!!! THINK TWICE BEFORE MAKING RESERVATIONS HERE!!!! THERE ARE PLENTY OF NICER PLACES TO STAY IN THIS AREA, THIS NOT BEING ONE OF THEM. GUESTS ALSO HAVE TO PAY TO USE THE SAFE, WHAT A JOKE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: kartik_la
Reviews.Content: ResortQuest at Papakea Resort is total worth it!!...I had booked an ocean view room from Cheaptickets. Before going to Maui, i had called up the hotel and mentioned to them that i am travelling with a kid and would like a good and clean room. I was pleasantly surprised to see the room when i entered. It was just perfect. I stayed in G208, The only the thing between the lanai and ocean was some grass. This room has a perfect clear view of the ocean. The room was clean and had all the facilities needed, including washer dryer and cooking utensils. Whenever we were in the room, we spent majority of the time in the lanai...Having a good lanai is the most important as relaxing in the lanai was the best thing to do and gazing at the ocean. The employees at this hotel were very understanding and courteous. Housekeeping was great and punctual....

Reviews.Title: “Anti Smoker Hotel - Smokers Should Boycott”
Reviews.Author: hutchie69
Reviews.Content: Not Good if you're looking for a tropical Hawaiian setting. This place is more like apartments on the beach. Actually some are apartments. A lot of older people (70-90+). Beach is tiny to non existent at high tide. Swimming is hazardous. I consider myself a courtious smoker but this place goes overboard. Smoking is discouraged anywhere on prop even though Hawaii law permits smoking more that 20 ft from a building. Other Hotels allow smoking as long as you're away from buildings, I suggest if you're a smoker to ask first.I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: P_Julie
Reviews.Content: One word: cockroaches!!!! As soon as we checked in and got to the door we found a notice about "regular pest cleaning". The notice said that if guests had a baby they could be exempted from the procedure but then all roaches would move to that condo. We had a toddler, and asked to be exempted since he would put everything he sees in the mouth. The reason we stayed was that we thought if they did this procedure on regular basis then the pest problem could not be that bad. We were wrong! Every time I turned on lights in the bathroom or kitchen I've noticed little "crawlers". The condo was very old, kitchen was awful and empty. We had to buy everything starting from dishwasher liquid and detergent, and finishing with salt, sugar, oil, e.t.c. Well, all was for nothing, after cockroach encounter I just did not want to cook at that place. We tried to be out as much as possible. The sofa bad we slept on had a plastic wrapper on it, and a fitted sheet on top. We finally took it off on the third day of stay. Changing resorts was not an option since it would be very expensive for us. One positive thing - a cleaning lady. She was extremely nice and did her job beautifully. The place next to Papakea - Ka'anapali Shores seemed to be much more neat and upscale, and was selling for the same price at Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Great time but will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: jry-i
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding and the view is perfect. The staff is very rude when they decide you aren't going to buy a timeshare. A mistake with reception had us having to move out of our room into another for the final night. It wasn't until my husband complained enough that they decided to accomodate us. Things like that happen but not with the horrible attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Papakea”
Reviews.Author: lem218
Reviews.Content: Over the past 10 or so years, we have stayed at 4 different properties in Maui, all in the Kahana. So, I feel that I have a basis to compare our stay at the Papakea with other properties in the area. We are a family of 4. Our room E-310 was an Ocean View room. I found the room to be clean and roomy. Our room was a one bedroom with a full kitchen and a stacked washer and dryer. Our children slept in the bedroom so we could fall asleep to the sound of the ocean (on the sofa bed). The sofa bed was pretty uncomfortable... but fortunately we were tired enough at the end of each day to be able to sleep on it! The room was clean. We did have an issue with ants in the kitchen. That was taken care of after we notified the hotel staff. I learned that Resortquest is one of four management companies for the investment units in Papakea. Resortquest as a whole has certain standards that must be met for the units they manage. Since Resortquest manages the largest percentage of units at Papakea, they run the front desk for all the units at this resort. This may explain some comments by others regarding their experiance at this resort. I don't know this for sure... but perhaps they were staying in a unit that was not being managed by Resortquest. Though Papakea does not have a kids camp on-site, you can sign your kids up at the Resortquest resort next door. Also, I noticed that there were tennis courts on the property. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Papakea and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love Papakea A 202”
Reviews.Author: maui4whales
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we've stayed at Papakea in A 202. It's the fifth time we've stayed at Papakea overall. It's a great place for us! It has beautiful mature grounds with some of the biggest koi we've ever seen. We prefer a quieter property with the ammenities that are most important to us. That includes a nice pool area, grounds and of course great BBQ areas. We chose A 202 the first time because we wanted an oceanfront unit to watch whales from. That was in February of '07. We were so pleased with everything we found that we booked it a year in advance to make sure we could come back! This unit is located away from most of the "outside" hallway traffic. It has a beautiful view and the owner clearly works hard to make sure everything is clean and in order. We had a small problem when we first checked in this time and called the owner to ask for help. She called back 43 minutes later and APOLOGIZED for taking so long to call me back. That's CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! The problem was solved immediately, well beyond our expectations! We're so pleased with everything that we've already booked for February of 09.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: In-Love-With-Maui08
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip ever to Hawaii. I expected it to be a bit like the southern CA area with the beauty of palm trees and exotic flowers and plants. We were most definitely surprised by Maui's utmost beauty. We spent 11 marvelous days. We stayed in the ocean front condos in a corner unit and it was gorgeous! Our condo was very homey and nice. The kitchen was clean with modern appliances and it faced the ocean when preparing food on the counter. The living room was comfortable with a nice tv, sofa and big round dining room table. We put together a jigsaw puzzle on the table and enjoyed evenings in that living room. The decor was tropical with wicker furniture and artificial orchids (which looked real). Our bedroom was nice and roomy with a big closet and dresser to keep our things in and also a safe in the closet. There was always a tradewind blowing through our room at night to keep things cool and although the days would get warm (about 82*), we never needed to use the airconditioner because of the breeze. The bathroom was very large and clean. The tub/shower was small, but we only took showers so that didn't bother us. The towels were nice and thick and soft. Some of our best memories will be sitting out on the lanai and watching the whales swim within a hundred yards offshore. They were breeching and showing us their beautiful tails. The sunsets were incredible and we took pictures every night of those. Also...the rainbows. We saw more rainbows in our 11 day stay than we have ever seen in our whole lives before. What memories! We had wonderful time and loved it there. We didn't ever want to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Papakea!!”
Reviews.Author: workerbeeColorado
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 12 day stay at the Papakea. The condo was comfortable and clean. We had an awesome ocean view. We have recommended the Papakea to several friends and we look forward to another trip to Maui and another stay at the Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Get an ocean front room”
Reviews.Author: Jyoji
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was only feet from the crashing waves, with only grass between our door and the water. The room itself was fine. The furniture and decor were nothing to write home about, but the point of this place is the view. The grounds of the Papakea are nice. The BBQ's that are available for anyone to grill on were nice, and helped save a bit of money. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: calliebear
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Papakea was very nice. I would rate the surrounding property as excellent. It is spacious, neat and peaceful. Condo: We had a 4th floor ocean front unit - it was pretty, but needed a lot of TLC. The fridge didn't work and was finally replaced on our 6th day. The sleeper sofa was about 5 years past "worn out" and couldn't be used as a pull out. The toaster didn't function properly, the knobs on the washer and dryer were so worn that I couldn't read them. Our cleaning person was so-so until the weekend when Leon had our room and he was great. I would def. return to the Papakea....it was adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Langly
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights and had the best time! Our room had direct access to the garden, the pool and the beach. The rooms were very clean, the hotel was calm, and they solved a little problem we had with our room almost instantly, and even gave us a box of macadamia nuts for the inconvenience!

Reviews.Title: “Papakea was great!”
Reviews.Author: ajp3130
Reviews.Content: First of all, everyone who rates this place negatively must have unattainable standards. Who cares what color the carpet is or the date of the art on the walls? For goodness sake, it's Maui outside! You're not going to be spending much time indoors anyway. Our room was newly renovated and looked very nice. It was very clean and was perfect for our 1 week stay. If others who were dissatisfied with their outdated rooms had looked around, they would see that many rooms were still in the renovation process. Before long, all rooms will be renovated, so it's not like Papakea is not taking action on older style rooms. It rained A LOT the week of our stay and water did come in to my parents' room. However, this was record breaking rainfall that Maui pretty much never sees, so a little water coming in the room was permissible and certainly did not spoil our vacation. The resort is in a perfect location. A lot of necessity stores are close by and Lahaina town is right down the street. We had a great time in Maui and at Papakea despite all the rain. Others should learn to let loose and not let little unimportant things ruin their vacation in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MCEBY
Reviews.Content: We used a package deal that included airfare and studio condo for a week. The unit we had was B103. The location was great because we looked out into the beautiful flowers surrounding the pool. The side view from the lanai was of the ocean and Moloka'i. We loved the ocean breezes at night and enjoyed sitting out on the lanai for dinner. While much went on in the pool, the noise was subdued similar to a family gathering. We were surprised at the level of furnishings in the condo. We had a comfortable bed, the kitchen was well appointed and free wi-fi allowed us to send pictures home to friends in the cold snowy north. A previous writer mentioned difficulties finding parking and problems with the front desk. As the evening progressed, spaces closest to the units would fill but we always found a spot within a reasonable walk. The front desk people treated us very well and were a terrific source of information. There is a free orientation put on by Expedia on the first morning. This is a great place to get a feel for what is available. Troy from the Expedia desk in the lobby is extremely knowledgeable and gave us wonderful advice on both tours and do it ourselves trips. The only problems we had were minor. The toilet ran when the flapper valve broke one night, the floor was clean but could have been cleaner and the card key door lock broke. The housekeeper did a fine job with the exception of the floor. The front desk called people in immediately to repair the other two items. We had a wonderful time, met great people and really look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: Hugemaniac1
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a quiet and relaxing vacation. The grounds are beautiful and the units are condo style, well appointed comfortable and spacious. The fourth floor units have a loft with two single beds, great for kids. The views across the channel to Molokai are incredible. The nice thing about this property is that it is not beachfront, making it more quiet & serene. The beach is a 2 minute walk towards the neighboring Kaanapali Shores. The grounds are beautiful, one can pull a lounge chair on the grass up to the sea wall and take in an incredible view or better yet take a nap. The resort has a more docile and sedate clientle than some of the neighboring properties. The Papakea is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Papakea”
Reviews.Author: vacationwithgirls
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay in Maui. I treated my two young daughters (11 & 14) to a surprise vacation and was a little worried about staying at Papakea after reading some of the reviews. The accomodations completely exceeded my expectations. Our room, D209 must have been recently remodeled and could have not been more perfect for us. Everything was spotless and I was impressed by how well stocked the kitchen was with cook ware, dishes, electric appliances, etc. Yes, our building was under construction during our stay, but to be honest, we were only aware of it when we went outside and saw the contractors working. I think more noise was created when the garbage trucks came in to empty the big dumpsters. When I vacation with my children, I tend to look for something a little funky as opposed to really fancy and this definately fit the bill. Beaches were close by, our view of the pool and ocean were good, walking around the resort offered views of the sun going down we couldn't see from our room. WHO WANTS TO STAY IN THEIR ROOM ALL OF THE TIME ANYWAY!!!!!! Had a small issue with the deposit. Although I had paid for my room in advance, I still had to leave a large room deposit which I was not prepared for. Bill at the front desk was not very pleasant about it. His attitude was, "That's your problem, not mine." Travel Tip: Network with the other people staying there. If you need salt and pepper, sugar, condiments etc. and you have extra milk, butter, coffee etc., barter with your neighbors. With the cost of food over there, you can save yourself a lot of money and reduce food waste if you can do some trading.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Papakea So Far”
Reviews.Author: pericles2
Reviews.Content: We just checked in today, but are very impressed. Read reviews that were not good, but had already found it to be the cheapest hotel for our needs so were willing to take our chances. Love the place!! Room is clean, fully equipped (biggest complaints--can't find the remote for the TV and no salt or pepper). Great ocean view, nice lanai. Property is beautiful, clean, well maintained, quiet, and just about perfect. Construction on some of the roofs might change my opinion, but no construction on our unit. Our unit is privately owned, so that might also be different than some other units. Would highly recommend unit K207.

Reviews.Title: “Try Aina Nalu!”
Reviews.Author: tchrkim
Reviews.Content: The unit we stayed in was old and outdated. The pans were horribly scratched (unhealthy bits of teflon in our food!). We stayed 7 days and only got housekeeping service once! One morning, there was a dead roach by the inside of the front door. I'm vacationing in paradise, but this is hell! For this price, check other locations!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: boukee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea one night Sept. 12, 2007 and that was enough! Unit D109. Garden veiw, Jackhammering in the room right above us and it felt like we were in an apartment complex. Then the next morning jackhammering again and we were in a studio so the bed is visible by the front door. I was laying on the bed and at 10 am housekeeping came walking in and I was not dressed! Then fifteen mintues later they were knocking at our door. Checkout is 11 am! No unless you are in the front buildings facing the ocean, with that breathtaking veiw, I would not recommend the Papkea. Then maybe the jackhammering wouldnt have been so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kaiandchris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Papakea from 9/8-9/14 and absoultely loved it. I have to admit, I read all of the reviews before we arrived here and I was a bit sceptical. However, we stayed in D203, which was a oceanview studio. The studio was very clean and very accomodating to our needs. The view was fantastic and the grounds of the hotel our beautiful. The hotel staff was very friendly and cleaned our room on a daily basis. There is no beach in front of the hotel, however, if you walk down the beach you will find a beach about 2 minutes away. We went to other beaches most of the time to snorkel, so it was no big deal. The hotel is incredibly quiet. You never hear other people in thier rooms or outside in the pool areas, playing golf, etc. We would stay here again on our next trip to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lilk8tob
Reviews.Content: The ResortQuest at Papakea was a great deal for the amount we paid. We booked directly through ResortQuest and got a much lower rate than we were able to find online. We stayed in F207, which was an ocean front room. When researching hotels, I was slightly disappointed that Papakea did not have a beach in front of it, but this ended up being one of my favorite things about the hotel. When standing inside our room and looking out the window, it actually looked like we were on the water (see photo). The building itself is about 30 feet from the sea wall- if there were a beach there the building would be much further back and we would have seen/heard the people at the beach. There is a nice beach a short (2 minute) walk away. The room itself was small but looked nice. We had a kitchen with fridge, microwave, stove and dishwasher (pots/plates/silverware included). If you are considering getting an ocean front room, request building F. The ocean front building next to us had two units being remodeled - construction noise would definitely take away from a relaxing Hawaiian vacation. Your first morning at Papakea you are invited to a free breakfast where you get a lot of information on activities to do- if you don't have your trip planned out, I would go to this to get some ideas. I didn't take the time to figure out if their prices were good- but it was convenient to not have to book things myself. Black Rock beach is a short drive away (park in the parking garage at Whaler's village - go to ABC store and buy $17 underwater camera and have your parking validated). From Whaler's village it's about a ten minute walk to Black Rock beach with amazing snorkeling. We rented our snorkeling gear from the shop right next to the Papakea- you can go through the gate in the parking lot and the store is loated to your right - $5 for the day- store opens at 9am. To get back through the gate you need your room card. Beach towels are available but you have to check them out at the front desk. If you want to access the internet, you have to walk to the hotel next door- the office is located behind the restaurant- it costs $.20/minute and seemed to be dial-up. I only have a few negative things to say about our experience. The housekeepers seemed to do a good job, but for some reason the bottoms of our feet were always black after walking around the room (there is no carpet). When we were checking out, we were told we owed a much higher price than we were expecting. We booked with a 4th night free deal and they had not given us our free night. When we pointed this out, the front desk guy (who I think was new) seemed annoyed and never apologized for almost overcharging us $225. All other front desk staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Papakea”
Reviews.Author: MuskokaBarb
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read kdavis's review of the Papakea Resort. Last year, we booked directly with the owner through the Vacations Rentals By Owner website. We were thrilled with our oceanfront 2rd floor studio unit, A building Unit 203, $109 per night for 6 nights in September 2006. Not only were the resort grounds gorgeous, so was our unit. Our lanai looked directly across to island of Molokai. There was a grocery story conveniently located across the road at the back of the resort. I would absolutely return to the Papakea. It was recommended to me by a work colleague who had stayed there for 2 weeks and I have recommended the Papakea to friends traveling to Maui. Barb Thomson Gravenhurst, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: kdavis8339
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to getting to Maui since I paid $486/night for a 2 Bdrm/2 Bath Ocean front condo. I was so disappointed I wanted to cry. One of the bedrooms (A406) was a loft bedroom (no privacy). There was only one small window unit to A/C the upstairs loft and back bedroom. The furniture was outdated, no decent lighting in the bedroom, the smallest tub/shower known to man downstairs, and there was a broken toilet that made the loudest noise every couple of minutes (came to fix but still water ran in toilet constantly) that it prohibited sleep. There were several fans in the unit. When I went to plug one in behind the headboard of the bed, I saw more dust and cobwebs than you can imagine. The kitchen did appear to have been updated and the grounds were nice enough, but there was no beach. We only had a seawall in front of our unit. I would not recommend staying here if you are expecting it to look like an almost $500/night accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Be informed”
Reviews.Author: FolsomMauiMom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from week stay at Papakea...the grounds are very nice and the pool areas (there are 2) are small, but kept clean and were never very crowded. Not much beach to speak of, but plenty of sand just a short walk down the beach. Spotted a 5-6 foot shark about 15 feet from shore on our last day right in front of Papakea! Scary but exciting! Good location for us. We went through Maui Dreams Come True and paid $220 a night, had to switch units after the second night so I'll talk about both units. G303, great ocean view, needs updating, moldy showers/tub areas- otherwise OK. D401, stay away-partial ocean view. Had 2 very large- 3 inches(one still half alive) cockroaches to great us when we checked in. Other little ones visited us occasionally. We kept all food in the frig just so we would feel safe that the roaches weren't trying to eat it also! White towels were no longer white and were frayed and falling apart, beds not made when we checked in, towels still in the dryer, dirty sheets on fold out couch, floor turned our feet black so we wore shoes while we were in the unit, a lot of mold on shower curtain and shower/tub tiles, microwave smelled of burnt popcorn the entire stay, sliding screen didn't slide so well and lounge chair on lanai had a large burn hole and tear in it so it was not useable. Noisy area by the front office- got the late nighters coming in and the early risers leaving. Didn't feel comfortable while we were in the room, so it's a good thing we were out enjoying Maui most of the time! Writing this review so other travelers can be informed about what's out there and be careful when going through private companies that offer discounts. You don't always get what you pay for and we definetly didn't get it this time.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Love the Island--Not the Room”
Reviews.Author: bradyrama
Reviews.Content: OK, the room wasn't that great, but get over it. IT'S MAUI!!! If you are using Interval to get here, like we did, you need to be aware that this might be a different type of timeshare than the norm. We weren't exchanging with the resort. We were exchanging with an individual condo owner. We wanted more pillows and contacted the front desk, but they would not help us because we weren't exchanging with the outfit that actually runs the joint. Our room had the owners personal property. There was dry food there that was either left by the owner or previous tenants. We weren't sure. We just avoided it and kept our things on the counter rather than in the cabinet. With a pull out bed in the closet, there was very little closet space. Of course, the thing about the Papakea is that there are multiple outfits running things in there. The posted check out time was noon, but our unit check out time was 11:00 A.M. I saw at the front desk that some of the rooms had AC, but ours didn't. As we walked around the grounds, we could see that some of the rooms had pretty horrendous decorations. On the other hand, we saw others that were being renovated. We also had some difficulty finding the place, but that might have been just us. The grounds were quite nice. The pools were small but never overcrowded. We spent a good deal of time enjoying them. Access to the ocean was great. Not a lot of sand, though, but I was OK with that . A coral reef kept the water really mild, which was great for playing in the water with our daughter. I must say that when we got there, we thought that the grounds were amazing; however, we saw more impressive pools and beaches all over the island. We had a great time in the pool, at the beach, and on our lanai/balcony. Because that room offered NO temptation to stay inside of it, we probably had a better vacation. Our room was clean but below expectations. You can definitely find much nicer places to stay on Maui, but you can definitely have a great vacation with Papakea as your home base.

Reviews.Title: “Run down Papakea”
Reviews.Author: HonestTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 10 day vacation at the Papakea resort in Maui. We stayed on the fourth floor with a beautiful view overlooking the koi pond, pool area, and the ocean. That was the upside of things. Our room was less than spectacular. It had not been cleaned when we checked in. There was hair and dirty foot prints all over the bathroom and kitchen floor. The refrigerator had so much rust in it that I was scared to put my food in there.......not to mention there were no shelves in there either! The downstairs tub reminded me of a tub you would find in an RV.....relaxing only if you folded yourself up!! There was AC in a tiny window unit but since we had the fourth floor loft room it was really hot anyway. The windows in the downstairs bedroom did not close all of the way and more mornings than not the trash dumpster was emptied at daybreak! Halfway through our vacation we were told there was a booking error and we had to pack up and relocate to another building. There we found an AC unit that leaked into the condo and the deck floor was soaked at all times. We really felt like the owners of these condos were able to allow the condos to run down with no penalty.

Reviews.Title: “nothing great, nothing terrible”
Reviews.Author: CTSF
Reviews.Content: I can't say we loved this place but we didn't hate it either. We paid about $250 a night for our one bedroom, garden view room (Room D101) which felt expensive for what we got. Overall the unit was clean enough and spacious enough but the unit was very dated. We noticed other units have been updated or were in the midst of being updated. There is not much of a beach to lie out on and the two pools are nothing exciting and there is no kiddie pool. Our unit was on the bottom level on the corner so there was not much privacy on the lanai. I would probably not stay here again and would only recommend it if you got a very good rate. The staff was very nice and we did get daily maid service (but some days they didn't clean the condo until 4pm).

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: Rosetta13k
Reviews.Content: This is a resort that is nothing fancy, however, we didn't expect it to be because we only payed $150 per night (we rented directly from a owner). The condo we stayed in was in the dolphin building. We had a decent view and could see the ocean and grounds of the resort, but could also see other guests out in their lanais, so no privacy. I noticed that it does get a little warm in the condo as there is only one window unit and it's in the living room. The bedroom had no a/c but did have a ceiling fan which made it a little more tolerable. The bed was very firm and the sheets were scratchy. I also noticed that it wasn't as clean as I had hoped. There was mildew around the bathtub and the bathtub itself was so small, it's just big enough for a toddler to take a bath in. Also, be aware that if you rent directly from an owner, you do not get daily maid service as well as extra towels it needed. We were only given 5 towels for three people and stayed there for 4 nights. We had a small washer and dryer, which took a couple of hours to do one load of clothes, but at least we had that, otherwise we would not have any clean towels! Would we stay here again? Probably not. We had a chance to visit some friends of ours who were staying at the Kapaula villas, the ridge section, and it was on a compete different level. It was around 1000 sq feet with amazing views and the unit itself was beautifuly updated and clean! They payed $170 per night for this and also was from an individual owner they found on vrbo.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Ohiophyl
Reviews.Content: Two teens, parents and grandmother spent 10 days at Papakea and all 3 generations were pleased with our accomodations. We had 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, 2 sofabeds, a fully equipped kitchen (even small boxes of detergent for dishwasher and washer), 2 TV's and the refrig had an ice dispenser in the door which the kids loved. The unit was beautifully furnished, the beds very comfortable. Everything was clean when we arrived and a nice housekeeping staff kept it that way. The landscaping was so beautiful, and although the beach was small, the kids spent a lot of time there every day, The pools were really nice and we enjoyed the aquacize classes offered there. The front desk staff and Concierge staff were very helpful. My granddaughter's only complaint was that the birds woke her up too early in the morning. Otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Family to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy3145
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papkea Beach Resort in June 2007and had a very enjoyable time. It was a great place for our family to stay on our vacation. The grounds were very well kept, the pool was nice. The beach was not really swimmable, but very pretty to walk along or if kids want to play in the sand. Lawn chairs by the beach if you wanted to lay out. We thought the location was great, just a short drive to beaches, shopping, places to eat. The staff was friendly and helpful in planning activities to do while we were there. The units are individually owned, so details of units probably vary. Ours was nice, clean & fit our needs. (J302) If you are looking for a nice, quiet place to take your family, I would recommend the Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: kobywaldo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the papakea resort for 7 days in April of 07 for our honeymoon, and it could not have been more wonderful. In addition to the condo being beautiful, and just the right size for the 2 of us, the grounds were immaculate, too. The pool is centrally located, with a nice poolhouse and plenty of BBQ space. The lawn by the beach has an absolutely amazing sunset view, don't miss it!! As far as we were concerend, the best part about this establishment was the customer service. The ladies at the desk helped us get last-minute tickets to a luau, horseback riding, and a dinner cruise! Don't be afraid to use the concierge services! The property is also conveintly located adjacent to an ABC store, which came in handy several times. In short, we loved Papakea, and are looking foward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: molly0111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Papakea in Aug of 2004, we have booked another trip for August of this year and I was going to wait to rate it after that. But there are a few bad reviews on here and I decided to write now. This is a quiet place to vacation. We do not care for the loud busy resorts, this is perfect. Even when alot of people at pool it is still relaxing. The staff was great, even when we locked our key in our room at midnight. The location is so close to everything. The view of Lanai and Molokai could not be any better. We cannot wait to stay here again and are counting down the days until we are back this summer

Reviews.Title: “Resortquest- bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Richard54SanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Resortquest at Papakea during the week of April 21 to April 28, 2007. There were many areas in which either the facilities did not live up to the promises made, or the staff simply did not do an adequate job. First, we paid extra for an ocean-view condo. What we actually got was a condo from which we could not see the ocean at all, unless we went out to a far corner of the balcony from which we could catch a glimse of the ocean. Both bedrooms actually faced the parking lot, with the added benefit of listening to cars coming in and out all night. When we requested a different room which might actually have fulfilled their promise, we were told there were no other rooms available, and since we had paid for the accommodation in advance, were stuck with what they gave us. The condo was very poorly maintained, with the paint literally peeling off the walls and rust everywhere. One morning we woke to find the carpet soaked as the line feeding the icemaker was evidently leaking. The last weekend we were there was the capper to our experience. Apparently the resort rented a condo to a group having a party, directly below our condo. At 2:30 in the morning, they had a large group of people talking and smoking directly beneath the windows of our bedrooms. When the group refused to quiet down after several requests, I went to the office who said they would take care of it. However, the noise and the smoking went on until after 4:00. My warning to others is that price and value do not always go hand-in-hand. While the price of this resort was certainly less than other facilities, the value was much, much less.

Reviews.Title: “Good landscaping, dirty & unremodeled room”
Reviews.Author: Ohtiger
Reviews.Content: Three bedroom had soiled carpet, laminate counters badly chipped, cheap mattresses, stove that should have been replaced 15 years ago, worn woodwork, etc., everywhere. Clearly, the resort spends time and money on maintenance of landscaping, but it's also clear they don't require unit owners to spend any money keeping the rooms nice. It's not that much of a bargain when you really compare cost to the quality you receive from a top notch hotel chain. Spend a little extra and avoid this eyesore.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a moderate accomodation”
Reviews.Author: DavidEmily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the papakea resort in April and had a wonderful time. We didn't have the nicest greeting though. Upon check in we were told that we weren't official Resortquest Guests cause we rented from vrbo.com, That is where you rent directly from the condo owner, therefore we didn't get the kids packs or anything else that resortquest guests get. Condo, c402 was where we stayed and it was o.k. Room was great for the value. Don't bring heavy pj's as it got pretty got a little warm at night. We had the windows open but still got a ittle warm. THe garbage truck and other construction vehicles started very early waking me about 7am wich was fine cause I loved the mornings on the lanai with the beautiful view of the ocean and whales. People that want to sleep in may not like this room. unit itself was a little outdated, but all in all it was good for the price we paid. The Maui To Do list that Jan provided us was so helpful. I would definately recommend renting through vrbo.com however realize that the front desk may not treat you like you would get treated if you rented directly from a travel agent or the hotel itself. THe pools were great, but kids weren't aloud to play games like Marco Polo or such. Older folks that own places there get a little testy, to testy as far as I'm concerned. We tended to ignore as our kids weren't causing any problems, just having fun. The beach was great, cause we didn't like sitting in the sand all the time. We would sit on the green space above the grass. We didn't get sand on ourselves, and the breeze from the ocean was great. The view from our C402 room was the best. Wasn't ocean front, but when it says oceanview, it means oceanview. Fantastic. I loved watching the ocean early in the morning and at sunset. Great value!! Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but pricey”
Reviews.Author: dazoonie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this condo resort from April 10th to April 15th 2007. The grounds truly are beautiful and maintained every day. Our group was three couples so we had booked a 3 bedroom condo. Imagine our surprise when one room had twin beds. The unit was not very clean. Some of the bedsheets had holes in them, the toilet leaked, the doorhandle fell off the dryer and the kitchen did not come with everything we had hoped for, such as a pair of scissors or sharp knives. The dishwasher also left a lot to be desired. The beds were only made once for us, and although we received clean towels, they did not bring facecloths. We made the best of it and had a wonderful time. The pool and activities were fun, as was shuffleboard and snorkelling just off the beach. This resort is close to shopping and downtown Lahaina. I would probably stay here again, however, I would try to make sure that I knew what I was getting with the unit. All in all, I found that the price did not reflect the value we received.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful getaway”
Reviews.Author: MABorntotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea for nine glorious nights from Feb. 16th through the 25th. We had a remodeled one bedroom ocean view unit (called and requested it one week before we arrived). It was clean and comfortable. The resort is very quiet, but there is a grocery store and a few restaurants across the street. The location is convenient to both Ka' anapali and Front St. in Lahaina. I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants to relax in peace and quiet and avoid the overcrowded beach in Ka' anapali. There is no beach in front of the resort, but just a short walk away. We bought beach mats at the Star Market across the street and walked down the beach and snorkeled off the reef and watch the whales daily. If you want a peaceful break try the Papakea!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mommiesbabies2
Reviews.Content: We booked through AA Vacations and stayed in C203. It was a very nice room. We had a king size bed in the room w/ a pull out sofa for the kids. There was an a/c unit that cooled the whole place and a view from the balcony of the ocean. We were very happy here no complaints at all. If you have a chance to stay here it's awesome. Beach/pool towels are given, free newspaper each morning, newsweek magazine and close walking distance to a market, video store and Hula scoops the ice cream shop. I have nothing but high regards for this place. Honestly I shouldn't be advertising our room because we will never have it available to us it was so wonderful! lol

Reviews.Title: “Love the Papakea. Will Return!!!”
Reviews.Author: oceanjuli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 3 year-old stayed here in January of this year. We loved the Papakea!!! The check-in process was rough but this was not Papakea's fault. We were booked through a company called Vacations International who completely screwed up our reservation. But I am not giving a review of them but, rather, the resort itself. Suffice it to say, because of Vacations International's mess up, we had to be put in a "Resort Quest" room until a Vacation International (V.I.) room became available at the Papakea. However, because of this, we had an excellent opportunity to see how the resort is run by Resort Quest vs. V.I. How a room is furnished including the type of deck furniture that comes with it, the type of toiletries and bath towels, and whether or not you get maid service has everything to do with the company that owns the unit. The Resort Quest unit was very nice. It had carpeting throughout the unit which was unusual but welcome. The furnishings were basic "beach decor". Kitchen appliances were a little outdated but no big deal. The toiletries were above average and the towels were thick and fluffy. It had daily maid service. And the unit was very spacious. Two T.V.s and one DVD player. Patio. A/C. Washer & Dryer. All in all, a lovely unit. The only complaint I had about this unit was that it was on the ground floor and in my opinion, any unit on the ground floor lacks privacy. The only other thing about Resort Quest rooms is that they charge a hefty fee to make any phone calls from the unit, even local calls! However, this wasn't a problem in our case, because we just used our cell phones. Also, if you are a Resort Quest guest, you can avail yourself of the concierge and he/she will make any reservations for you, so you don't ever need to make a local call. When we were finally moved into our "real" room (a Vacation International-owned room), it, too, was nice but not as nice as the Resort Quest unit. We had an ocean view one bedroom so we had the privacy I require. The view was incredible and, frankly, I wouldn't want an ocean front room. It's a lot more interesting when you can see the ponds and palm trees with the ocean in the near distance. No carpeting in this unit. No daily maid service. The toiletries were very basic and I didn't use them. And the towels were rough and "scratchy" compared to the RQ towels. There is no A/C in any V.I. unit. Surprisingly, the appliances were better than the Resort Quest appliances but only marginally. There was a washer & dryer in this unit, too, so I assume every unit at the Papakea comes equipped with a washer & dryer which is very nice. It also had a DVD player and two T.V.s. Overall, the room was pretty decent and if I hadn't seen the Resort Quest room, I wouldn't have known there was anything better at the resort. The one plus of staying in a V.I. room is that local calls are free. But big deal. We had our cell phones. I don't believe, however, you can use the concierge if you are a V.I. guest. And any maintenance or maid issues must be dealt with via phone call to an off-site office. Basically, if your unit is owned by anyone other than Resort Quest, the management on-site at the Papakea wants nothing to do with you. (On-site management is Resort Quest only.) The grounds themselves were superb. Two putting greens. Two swimming pools. Chaise lounges dot the lawn right by the ocean which offers a great view and they are never crowded. When I looked at other resorts in the area, they are all high-rise and the grounds are limited compared to the size of Papakea's grounds. All in all, it's a very low-key resort that caters to families. My only complaint is that there is no restaurant on the premises. However, you can walk one or two resorts down and find restaurants. Besides that, we always go grocery shopping during the first day of any trip and stock our unit for the week so we are not "restaurant dependent." Tiki torches are lit throughout the property each night. And there are huge koi ponds just loaded with fish. Very idyllic setting. We definitely intend to return to the Papakea but will make sure we book a Resort Quest room next time. I was told during check out that oftentimes, V.I. guests who are staying for 3 weeks are made to switch their room two or three times. The whole point of staying in a condo. is to make it as much like home as possible including being able to unpack your stuff. Anyway, Resort Quest is on top of their game and since they own 70% of the units at the Papakea, you can't go wrong booking through them plus they offer a discount for staying multiple nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: jaybirds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea for a week in February, 2007 and just loved it. We had a 2br/2ba condo unit that opened with windows front and rear so the trade winds and surf lulled us to sleep every night. The layout was very nice and gave us all plenty of elbow space to do our own things. A very nice pool, hot tub, gas barbecues, putting green, and beach were steps from our ground floor lanai door. The beach had a nice coral reef 20 yards offshore for snorkeling but was not otherwise a swimming beach although it was great for sunning, wading, listening to the surf, sand castles, etc. There were also 3 nice tennis courts that we all used every morning as well as as a shuffleboard court with a million dollar view. Our kids who grew up with video games seemed fascinated by ...shuffleboard...and played it every minute we were not doing something else. Go figure. The Papakea was a very nice, quiet, friendly, low-rise homey place to stay and is an especially great place if you have kids. There were several nice restaurants, including two at neighboring high-rise resorts, as well as Star Market, shops, ABC store, etc all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: ECTVancouver
Reviews.Content: I booked my 7 night stay at the Papakea via Resort Quest central reseravtions in December of 06. I originally booked a Garden View Studio, using the Entertainment Book discout I got a very good rate (Get one, it rules!). Upon arrival we found out that we had been upgraded to a 1Bd. I asked the very kind Night Manager if there was any chance of an upgrade. The Front Office Manager just happened to be there, we chatted and he upgraded my wife and I to a Studio Ocean view but we couldn't move until the 2nd night of our stay. The first night we stayed in the 1Bd Garden View. It was not very nice but I could have survived. The 2nd night we moved into an awesome 1Bd Ocean View. We were upgraded again! I should mention to all you travellers, people who work the front desk of a resort or hotel have to put up with a lot of crap from guests and they do it with a smile (most of the time). You will certainly get more flies with honey than you will with vinegar. A well placed bottle of wine or $20 tip can go a loooong way. Trust me on this, they keep records on who is naughty and who is nice! Anyway, don't go expecting modern contemporary design in Maui. Everything is going to be bamboo and tiki tourch's unless you build it yourself. Get outside! Enjoy the beach. The Papakea is right across the road from Star's Market, the only full service grocery store. There's a dive shop in the same strip mall as the market. They have 2 pools and 2 putting greens. Concierge on staff. You also have access to the facilities at the ResortQuest resort next door. The beach and view is beautiful, you'll be more than content to sit on the lawn and watch the waves roll in. Everybody is happy, staff guests, taxi drivers. I love Maui!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this place like the PLAGUE”
Reviews.Author: captaingary
Reviews.Content: This "condotel" is the worst place I've ever stayed on Maui! They adverstised this terrific beach and water activities. The brochure was really slick and was FALSE advertising. When we arrived, we found the beach was completely gone! In order to find a beach we had to drive to Kannapali. It was our honeymoon and as soon as my wife saw the "view" and "beach," she wanted to find another hotel! Management was extremely arrogant and refused to refund any of our money if we checked out. We made a BIG MISTAKE by paying for the place in advance through our travel agent. So, we were stuck in this dump for a week. I guess "rooms" are different depending on whom owns the place, but our room stank from the smokers. We complained about this to no avail. The owner's closet was unlocked and we could have walked off with a bunch of valuable stuff. Instead, we told the manager to come and lock the closet. He was rude in being put off to do even that! We wish we had read TRIP ADVISOR and stayed at a much higher rated place. This lousy place should be #36 instead of #26! AVOID IT!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: graciegirlie
Reviews.Content: After extensive research I chose the papakea resort based on reviews, guidebook recommendations and the value:price. The resort was beautiful, gorgeous landscaping plenty of lounge chairs, two seperate bbq/cabana areas as well as two separate pool/hot tub areas. you could fit like 20 people into one of those hot tubs, we enjoyed a soak every night along with admiring the amazing view of the stars. The beach that fronts the reort is not the best, the sandy beach is not longer than 10 feet or so. there is a seawall which provides a nice place to lounge and enjoy the view and sounds of the ocean. there are plenty of fabulous beaches very close. Within walking distance there is a market and a few restaurants. The units at papakea are all privately owned, we ended up getting a better last minute deal through the management company listed in frommers than from any of the websites. we had a studio that was a little dated but really very comfortable and met all of our needs. a full kitchen, murphy bed, and a nice lanai with an ocean view. I was very happy with the resort and would stay there again. FYI there are some units that have been updated beautifully and not much more expensive, they were not avaliable to us as we were last minute travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SHBlack
Reviews.Content: I spent November 14th-20th at Papakea. I was a bridesmaid in my friend's wedding and I stayed at one of the ocean front 2br/2bath condos with the bride and two other bridesmaids. It was nicely furnished and even had a new washer/dryer for us to use and with 4 girls sharing the condo there was plenty of laundry to do. We enjoyed leaving the sliding door opened at night to let in the cool breeze and listened to the waves as we went to sleep. We didn't stay around the condo much seeing as we were busy with wedding plans, but when we did get to enjoy the pool and beach we were pleasantly pleased with the temperature of the pool and the access to the beach. We also liked the convinience of the ABC store just down the road and the short drive to other beaches and shops in Lahaina. One find we were very excited about if you a bargain shopper is the flea market that sets up on the side of the main highway as you are coming down towards Lahaina. It was there Monday, Thursday, Friday. It had wonderful hand made jewlery that we took advantage of for great prices. Great for bringing back gifts. Also you have to go on Front Street - they have lots of wonderful shops and restaurants. Forget worrying about having a restaurant at the resort - get out and see the island and discover many different places. Overall we were pleased with our stay and would concider staying here again if the opportunity comes back around.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: ardent
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite. I had called and booked over the phone, they told me I'd have two queen or larger beds. Instead I got a queen and 2 full beds. Bath is joined in the master bedroom only. The big problem is that this condo resort is owned individually so it's hit or miss, big time. Our unit was overall unsatisfactory cleaned upon arrival. Everything was in working condition but it definitely needed a more professional scrub. It was obvious other things in the unit were aging and in need of repair, but as cleaning and maintenance doesn't own the property, I can only assume they don't want to replace anything they don't have to! Overall it was an average stay. Paid $265 for the 2BR for a one night stay at the end of Nov 2006. If you are staying for longer periods of time and want a condo, try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: louannjustice
Reviews.Content: We booked through Orbitz and this place is nice to stay. The room was smaller than expected, but clean. The appliances were older, but we didnt use them anyway. Bed was just the right amount of firmness...not too soft, not too hard. Staff was very nice and met our needs. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Papakea”
Reviews.Author: Cheleigh
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a conference to attend on Oahu, so we decided to extend the vacation and stay a few days in Maui. We used some timeshare credits and after reviewing mid-level timeshare reviews right here on this site, I made the decision to stay at the Papakea Resort in Lahaina. It was the perfect location for us. We rented a car, and we didn't have any problem with parking during our stay--we have a disabled tag, and we always were able to park close to our condo. Our condo was appointed in a typical time-share way (I think this was an owner/timeshare unit)--nothing was extraordinary, but everything was clean and well maintained. We had a one bedroom unit with full kitchen with a view of the courtyard (and a bit of the ocean beyond) from our lanai--oceanview property. We took the recommendation from another reviewer (04/05) and stayed in a room in the F building. We had no problems with bugs, including roaches. The grounds are quiet at night, the beach is nearby (note that at high tide the beach is no more) and most importantly for us, the property is across the street from a grocery store and a few restaurants. We could walk to the store, grab some food items, and make our own breakfast/lunch. We spent most of our time in Lahaina, so it really worked out well. The staff was friendly and the concierge was knowledgable and helped us book tickets to all the events/activities we wanted to see. This property is not an all-inclusive resort, and I wouldn't select it if I wanted a high-flying, romantic vacation, but this property was perfect for us to spend a week in Maui. I would definately book this property again--especially if I could book the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: shernmark
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon. Our room was not ready, but staff gave us pool towels, showed us the change room and we lounged a bit by the pool. Our room was a comfortable, light & airy with all the conviences. My sisters room was a little dated and dark. She mentioned this to the front desk and they changed her room next morning to another prize. We really enjoyed our stay at a pleasent resort that was low preasure, clean and we found close to everthing but Hana! The grounds were kept up very nicely and there was a lot of room to spread out and lounge or play lawn games. Most resorts were packed in side by side and strait up so this was a plus in our minds. No charge for parking either.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Welovepapakea!!
Reviews.Content: Wow!! This resort is fabulous!! We have been staying here for 15 years and have never had a problem with anything. The condo was right on the ocean and the resort offers so many activities all day. The pool, huttub, shuffleboard courts and putting greens are great for the kids. The landscaping was beautiful and everything was very well kept. Lahaina is less than 10 minutes away, and this is a great location. I would not stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vcb624
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a vacation package through Hawaiian Airlines. I was weary of the hotel due to the reviews on this website, but it was one of the best that they offered, and I was keeping my fingers crossed that we got one of the nicer condos. Apparently, no amount of finger crossing could help me on this trip. My boyfriend and I were hoping for a romantic, week-long vacation in Maui. When we arrived at the Papakea on September 6, they gave us a partial ocean view room on the second floor. I admit that I have high standards, but I don't think I am wrong in the fact that I was immediately disappointed with the property. It only got worse when we got to our room. The bathroom was pretty gnarly, the couch cushions on the futon were stained AND ripped, and the room was just overall dirty. I was excited to have a kitchen for the week, but I knew immediately that I would not be using the kitchen in this condo. Anyway, the worse part was the bed...it couldn't have been bigger than a double!! I can't believe they gave us a room, knowing that there were two of us, with a double bed. I called downstairs to tell them about the mistake and request a room change, and of course, they were "completely booked". They said that they could get us a roll-away (for an extra charge, of course), but that there was nothing else they could do. Yes, that was exactly what I was picturing for our romantic Hawaiian getaway...to sleep in different beds! He claimed that they did not have anything less than a queen sized bed, but I have pictures to prove it. My boyfriend, an average-sized 24 year old, basically took up the entire bed. So I ask what the damage would be if we cancelled our reservation and they said that they would charge us for one night. I then called Hawaiian and they booked us at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (which I LOVED and highly recommend) for an extra $900 (in addition to the first night paid at the Papakea). Needless to say, I was disappointed that we were not better accommodated and were penalized for a mistake that was not our fault, but I was not willing to fight the charges and gladly got the heck off that property. We were only there for about 20 minutes, thank GOD!! It was a pretty horrible way to start off the trip (after an already long day of traveling) but I am very glad we made the decision to switch hotels. I hope others have a better experience than we did!

Reviews.Title: “Scary bug infested little condo”
Reviews.Author: chicagoborn40
Reviews.Content: First, the condon we had didn't look anuything like the pictures, but it was still nice. That is, until we returned around 9pm our first night. Flicked on the light and roaches everywhere. I couldn't kill them fast enough! We have a young baby and refused to stay in this room. We called the desk, and a very rude woman informed us thatroaches are common, 'cause, hey this is Hawaii and a tropical environment. that may be true for tropical roaches whic are enormous. These are the roaches that show up in urban areas of inner cities- not normal! After contacting Hotels.com, whic was no help at all and the front desk refused to contact the manager, we fled with our baby at 11:30pm to the Maui Ocean Club (see our review of this property). Hotels.com acted as if they were afraid of the property owners and didn't do a thing to help us. We had to find another hotel to go to in the middle of the night and then spent two hours on the phone the next morning strong arming the Papakea to refund our money and forcing hotels.com to payt the difference between the two hotel costs. Do not use Hotels.com. use Expedia. Always better service and their computers are not down when they need to do something to get their customers out of a jam!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Papakea”
Reviews.Author: Iuli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Papakea this summer & truly enjoyed the property. We have been to Maui about a dozen times & have stayed in many condos. We really like the low key atmosphere & beautiful grounds. The unit we stayed in was terrific...not ocean front, but secluded behind a gorgeous koi pond with a partial view of the ocean. We liked being tucked back just a bit for privacy & enjoyed the attention we received from the friendly koi & relaxing sound of the fountain. Being on the ground floor was a big plus too. The unit was dated, however, the manager said it was to be fully redecorated in early fall 2006. She said the new decor will include granite kitchen & baths . I can't wait to go back to the new & improved G102. (Hope they don't raise the price too much:) We rented the unit from VRBO.com & found that their prices were better than resort quest prices. It had two bedrooms & two baths with an additional queen sleeper in the living room. King & two twins in the bedrooms. Loved the miniature golf on property & enjoyed the pool, jacuzzi & barbecues. The resort is only a ten minute drive from Lahaina & Whalers village. There is a terrific take out that the locals turned us onto about 2 blocks away called Honokowai Okazuya. Reasonable & delicious take out dinners when you have had a long day of sight seeing. Gee, can't wait to get back...could be a long winter!

Reviews.Title: “Russian Roulette”
Reviews.Author: martha zapp
Reviews.Content: The photos of the place are right on...but photos. Each room may be differnt is style and cleanliness. Felt like this was a motel not a hotel on Maui. The best thing they have going is the expediafun seminar each morning. Troy was our sales person and he gave us a lot of inside information on the tourist traps that really saved us time and money. The Best Luau is the WAIKAPU VILLAGE Luau. Small groups (150) and lots of true Hawaiin culture. The next best thing was the trip to Hana furnished by DiscoverHawaiiTours. Be sure to ask for Dennis. He made the entire trip (12 hours) very enjoyable!! Best advise is vistis the real high end hotels, eat and drink there and then go back to your ecomomy hotel!!! Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is a good value”
Reviews.Author: LovedMaui
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Maui and enjoyed our stay at the Papakea. We had paid for a one BR ocean view and upon checking in early we were told we were "lucky" and had been "upgraded" to a one BR oceanfront. That sounded great! Until we got settled in to the unit and a drill hammer went off three floors above us. The management at first was reluctant to move us but when I asked for the unit I paid for originally, they agreed to let us move. They were very cooperative and understanding when I explained (nicely, of course) that we had come a long way for peace and quiet. The second unit was not quite as nice as the first, but overall we were satisfied. The view was beautiful - complete with palm trees, pool, and beach. The furniture and fixtures were a little dated but the most important things for us were cleanliness and comfort. We were not disappointed in this regard. There were plenty of good quality towels and the bedding was nice and clean. We enjoyed a quiet stay! The grounds are well-kept. And the activities desk coordinators are knowledgeable and helpful. At the time we were there (August 29- Sep 2) the resort was fairly quiet - plenty of room at the pool and on the lawn next to to the ocean. We would and have already recommended the Papakea! As others have mentioned, this is not a property for those seeking luxury and spa-like amenities. It is a well-kept older property with an incredible ocean view. Three tips: the ResortQuest Kaanapali is next door and has a restaurant (The Beach Club) that runs coupons in the Maui This Week travel guide. Also, the small restaurant across the street is called Soup Nutz and we had a delicious, not ridiculously-priced meal there. And the Rusty Harpoon in Whalers Village has an early bird dinner special for $16.95 - great service there but you have to pay for parking. The Whalers Museum is located there and it's free. Definitely worth looking through. (OK, that's four tips!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - But Rooms Vary”
Reviews.Author: FishFindHer
Reviews.Content: We selected Papakea mostly due to comments and pictures found on the web. We wanted a smaller location and not a big high rise hotel. We also wanted a condo for more of the "home away from home" feeling and something that was on the beach and would still be within 10 minutes drive of Lahaina was important. It seemed like this a good spot, however, I was really concerned with the room we might end up with due to some of the comments found on the web. I booked in January and paid for an upgraded ocean view room. Once you get there you may notice that almost all of the units have some sort of ocean view. Anyhow, to appease my concerns on the room, I called Expedia a month before we arrived and they said that the rooms should all be similar to what is represented on their web page. They also recommended that I call Papakea and convey my concerns to them. I did this and was told by the women who answered the phone that the last week of March is their off season and that moving would not be a problem if I was not happy with our unit. I thought - okay - I'm not going to stress on anything before I'm even there and just let it go. Fast forward about a month....we were there the last week of March when the unusally heavy rains were making national news and Kauai had serious flooding problems. Maui was much better off, but we still had a fair share of rain. When we arrived at Papakea it was the night of a horrible storm - even the locals were talking about how intense it was the next day. Poor visability (driving 2 mph under the street sign and we still couldn't read it due to the rain!) made finding the resort a real challenge so it was 1:00 a.m. by the time we arrived. Upon check-in I mentioned that I had concerns over the condition of the room (which I had yet to see) as I had read about the differences in the units. The older man working the desk said that they were FULL and that this was always a very busy time of year (so somebody lied to me) but if I wasn't happy with the room to let him know and that he would relay the situation to the morning manager. At that point, I didn't care, I just wanted a bed to crawl into. The first unit they gave us was E302, really close to the water, but OLD, OLD, OLD. Nothing had been done to the place and it was NOT what was shown in the expedia web-site. Sent the hubby back to the night desk clerk to inform him that the room is not what we expected and we will need the manager in the morning. Woke up, sun is shining, the room still is not satisfactory even though the rest of the family said it was okay. I go to discuss the situation with the extremely helpful young male manager. He didn't hesitate to offer another room, gave me the key and said check it out before we move all of our stuff and to just let him know if want to keep looking at other units. The first alternate unit, C-209, was great!!! CLEAN, new upgrades, flat screen TV, lots of dresser storage...in fact, it is so much better that even the family admits I was right to move when they see it!!! I thanked the manager and happily moved over to the new spot, which is not as close to the ocean, but the ocean view is still great. It kind of sounds like a downer until now, but really, it still wasn't all that bad. It was just very memorable - we still laugh about it. Everything there (well, anywhere) depends on your attitude. The locals and the tourists are all very friendly as long as you start out being nice to them. Papakea was perfect as the units are only four story buildings. The grounds are as beautiful as any we others we visited. My husband and our boys (ages 14 & 17) loved hanging out on the putting green and by the pools. It was close to Lahaina. The B-B-Q pits were really handy and you could always meet friendly folks that were also grilling their dinner. The beach wasn't much, but due to the rains and the large amount of sediment in the water (which we were told can be more attractive to sharks) we didn't go in the ocean much. When you look into other rooms, which is easy to do at night, you get a good feel from how different the unit styles are. We will be sure to stay here again, I will just specify a certain room the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Papakea”
Reviews.Author: lizzy29
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from a stay at the Papakea in Maui. We were very happy with the condo, the location of the property, the parking, the cleanliness and housekeeping service, the grounds, and everything else...with one exception. The air conditioner is a single window unit in the living/dining/kitchen area and doesn't do a good job of reaching up to the loft (second bedroom) or the master bedroom. Otherwise, no complaints! The pool was never crowded, nor was the hot tub. Access to the ocean was right there, although all along that area, the beach is rather narrow with rocks right off the shore. We shopped for food at the Star Market (close enough to walk) as well as the Safeway (ditto on getting a membership). We went to the beaches up and down the west side of Maui, from Lahaina (the town) to north of Kapalua. They all have their advantages and disadvantages, but overall, they are great! The shopping (tourist/souvenirs) is great in Lahaina as well as all the ABC stores. We enjoyed several different restaurants as well as having the choice of cooking in our condo. Overall, it was a fantastic family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “My 4th Trip”
Reviews.Author: December29
Reviews.Content: In September I am taking my sister on her first trip to Hawaii. We are both in our 60s. This will be my fourth stay at the Papakea and I am counting the days. There have been times I have visited Hawaii and have stayed at other resorts. However, for me, Papakea is always my first choice and I can afford to stay pretty much where I choose. It is a very family oriented resort. The views are beautiful. The staff is extremely kind and helpful. The parking and the walk to my rooms are no problem. The Papakea is conveniently located to grocery shopping and other necessities. I find the Papakea a wonderful breath of fresh air because it meets all my ideas of what an island paradise is all about. Since 1975, I have visited the islands many, many times. Maui is my favorite island and the Papakea is my favorite resort. Do get the ocean view. My family has watched whales while sitting on the Lanai! I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea was great!”
Reviews.Author: hogies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea last week (June 2006) and enjoyed our stay very much. I didn't really know what to expect, and kept reading the reviews on this site which were very helpful! We had three families traveling together (14 of us ) and they did not get our rooms by each other, which was initially a disappointment, but it really wasnt that bad. We stayed in K305. We had requested rooms with twins in the second bedrooms, but only one room had them. I think it worked out well in the end also, because the lofts seemed to get a little warm for the other families and our two boys did just fine, one in the second bedroom and the other on the pull out couch. It was very clean and the grounds were beautifully kept. We shopped a lot at Safeway in Lahina. Make sure to sign up for the Safeway Card, it saved us over fourty dollars! I didn't think that groceries were really all that bad. Didn't have any problems with any of our three rooms. The hot tub and pool were all great.
