A few cats running around, but not bad like some people had written about. Didn't snorkel off the beach there much, but if the tide was high it was easier due to the rocks there. We drove most the time to other beaches. This is a great property and still oceanfront if you are willing to drive just a little to bigger beaches. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Papakea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned this morning from a 5 night stay at the Papakea. Our unit (D202) was immaculate! It was stocked with everything we needed (silverware, boogy boards, 2 TVs, etc.) which really helped a lot. The condo itself had a view of the Molokai Pool, putting green, as well as the ocean, which was very pleasant and had a very nice, obviously well maintained interior. From what I have read it seems like it depends which unit you get (since they are privately owned) that determines the caliber of your stay. If you are looking for a beautiful, reasonably priced, 1 bedroom/1 bathroom condo then I highly recommend D202. My one complaint would be that there really isnt a great beach at the Papakea. This problem was easily fixed by taking the 1 dollar shuttle from the Embassy (less than a blocks walk from Papakea) to Whalers Village, which is the location of the beautiful Kaanapali Beach as well as shopping and a few restaruants (loved Leilanis). Kaanapali Beach was great to swim at, relax on the beach, and Black Rock (in front of the Sheraton Hotel) provided some great off shore snorkeling. The concierge at the Papakea was extremely helpful in booking activities (we booked the Royal Lahaina Luau through the conceirge and got seats in the very front), etc. There is also a Star Market right across the street that is open from 5am-2am that has all your grocery needs, which helps cut back on money spent on food. All in all, it was a fabulous vacation and the Papakea was a great place to stay. Oh, and one last tip, I highly recommend renting a car or using airport shuttle service and the Maui Transit for transportation, as taxi rides are extremely expensive. It costed us 90 dollars from the airport to the Papakea, and 12 dollars from Whalers Village to Papakea (which is a 1 dollar Maui Transit Shuttle ride). Just a tip!

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui in June '06 for our honeymoon and stayed at Papakea. Papakea was perfect! A beautiful view, friendly staff, Papakea had everything we wanted! I didn't want to come home! Before booking a hotel in Maui we read reviews of several places and compared prices. We were scared by some of the reviews (the ones about dirty old rooms) but it seemed most people really liked Papakea. The price was really reasonable for an ocean front studio, so we decided on Papakea. When we arrived, we immediately loved Papakea. It was close to a shopping center with places to eat and Star Markets plus it was right next to the ABC store. Perfect walking distance for us, although we drove most of the time. The grounds of Papakea were well maintained, although two of the ponds were empty and being cleaned, the pool/bbq area was very clean and well maintained. When we went to our room in building A we found we were given a one bedroom instead of the studio which was great! It had all new appliances in the kitchen, a washer and dyer, a nice patio set on the lanai and most importantly it had an absolutely beautiful ocean view. There was nothing special about the bathroom or bedroom and no tv in the bedroom but why do you need it, you are in Maui! We read the reviews about the people complaining about humidity and heat and having to drag their mattress in to the living room, this is one reason we wanted a studio, but we didn't have this problem at all. We slept with the doors and windows shut and air conditioner off and it didn't get stuffy until about 7am but when we woke up we opened the huge sliding glass door and the room immediately aired out. Another reason we loved Papakea was because on our second day there we were pleasantly surprised by a bottle of Champagne and a card welcoming us and congratulating us on our marriage. The Papakea is not for people that want a five star hotel with restaurants and entertainment. It is for people that want a simple, quite, friendly place with beautiful views. I would definitely stay at the Papakea again!

Reviews.Title: “Papakea Resort review-mixed”
Reviews.Author: 3girlsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea Resort G206 from May 28-June 5, 2006. I had mixed feelings about the property and the unit itself. I booked it through a private owner on [--].It is a 2br/2ba unit. The owner was terrific to deal with, but I must admit the unit itself left something to be desired. The carpet appeared very dirty, as was the couch in the living room. The kitchen area was nice, with nice cabinets and adequately stocked. It had all the necessary appliances and they were in good shape. The furniture in both bedrooms was very basic. The towels were a real mish mash and all had a very strange smell to them. I had to wash them before we could use them.There were beach toys and boogie boards in the unit for your use. The view from the condo was terrific, though. You can see the ocean from the lanai and had a full view too. The unit was located right in front of the elevator, which was a plus and a minus. Plus for ease of use(but the stairs were close by and faster to use), minus in that you hear the ding of the elevator as it goes up and down all day and night. There was a safe in the unit, but no key for it. The ceiling fan in the master bedroom was very dirty and made very loud clacking noises on anything but low speed. The property grounds were very well manicured. They really don't have much of a beach area and what they do have is kind of icky in both sand and water. The pool area is nice, but the water in the pool was always cloudy and that concerned me. The hot tub was nice, though and the water in it sparkled. They keep chaise lounges near the ocean to lie in. They have a number of BBQ grills near the pool to use. They also have a putt-putt course and shuffleboard. My biggest complaint about Papakea is the noise level. The walls in these units are VERY thin. We could hear our neighbors using the toilet! You can imagine what other kind of sounds we heard. Also, the windows in the bedrooms of all units are horizontal slats at the top of the wall. The air conditioner is in the living room, so in order to help keep it cool, you have to open those slatted windows, because the air conditioner doesn't really reach well into the bedrooms. But opening the windows allows every outside sound in. The walkway is right outside the bedrooms, so you hear people talking as they walk by, doors slamming and such. The buildings are laid out in such a way that the sound echoes throughout. Also, they have huge plantings of trees in the "courtyard" area between the buildings and there are tons of birds that like to start singing VERY early. Twice during our stay we heard crying children at night and it was clear they were not near us. The layout and thin walls just makes the sound carry. I heard other people that were staying in different buildings talking about it too. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Papakea G206 was $220 per night, and while it was certainly reasonable for Maui, I think there are other properties that are equally reasonable and are a better bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am often baffled when I read the reviews. I stayed there for 6 nights last year and am going back this December again. Yes, I saw cats now and then but certainly heard no disruptive noises nor were they a bother. We had some issues with the dishwasher being loose and repairman was there within a few moments. Some light bulbs were burned out by previous tenants and they were replaced immediately. I understand some units are more worn than others, since they are privately owned it's basically up to the owner to make the decisions regarding the unit. We found the maid service and personnel wonderful. The key is treating people with respect and being appreciative if there is something they can do. Though it is not a deluxe property by any means, it is adequate and provides relief from having to run out for meals all the time. Stock up on food and liquor and enjoy the beauty and warmth of Hawaii. I believe your expectations are what may lead to some disaapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Papakea”
Reviews.Author: sacoward
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Papakea back in November and it was great. We rented directly from the owner of unit Unit F-308. Sheila was great to deal with and flexible with us not being able to stay an entire week. The room was nice and perfect for our stay. It is of cource not a 5 star, but I can't imagine expecting it for the price. My wife and I read through all the reviews of the place and came to realize some people have to high of expectations for the price. The grounds were immaculate. We never had a problem getting a lounge chair. (one note: Papakea is directly on the ocean, but does not have any beach to speak or swimmable area. But that was fine with us. There were plenty of beaches within a short drive. And it was kind of nice to lay out by the ocean and not have to worry about getting all sandy!) Make sure you get an Ocean Front room . . there is quite a difference! Make sure you take the road to Hana and make sure you rent a convertable. it is well worth the money. And on the road to Hana make sure and take it all the way around. it gets a little bumpy, but was very managable in a convertable. Go to Hawaii and Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “big variation in quality of rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a B-102 a one bedroom unit in February. We were very impressed with the grounds and the resort in general. Our problem was that our unit was terrible, it was very run down and the beds were so bad we woke up aching every morning. Our friends were right beside us in 101 and there unit was beautiful. It really depends on if the owners keep up the unit or not. The thing that doesn't seem fair is we paid the exact same as they did. We were even talking to some owners there and they also have problems with this, some people spend a lot of money on their places and they get rented for the same price as places that are run down. They should have 2 levels of rooms a std and a deluxe and then you get what you paid for. If we had to go again I would rent directly through an owner and not resort quest, that way you know what unit you are getting. The manager at resort quest was horrible. We booked 8 months in advance to guarantee 3 rooms together as we all had little kids and wanted to be able to get together once they were in bed. He said this was no problem, but as soon as we arrived we only had 2 rooms together. Our vcr and stereo didn't work, our unit was missing a lot of kitchen items and each time he said he would send somebody nobody ever arrived. He kept avoiding us and did nothing to help. Bottom line is the resort could be beautiful if you got a decent room and didn't have to deal with resort quest.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week in Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Prior to selecting the Papakea I did lots of research. We wanted a place directly on the beach with nice grounds and wanted to avoid high rise hotels. The Papakea seemed to meet all of those criteria. When we arrived and saw other properties in the area, we believe that we made a good choice. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. All rooms have great ocean views. Our unit consisted of living room/kitchen, bedroom, bath and lanai (balcony). The size of the unit was adequate, the bed comfortable, and the kitchen fully equipped. I could complain though that none of the knives would cut and a sharpening stone in the drawer would have helped. The buildings are older than most right on the beach. It they were newer, I'm sure that the complex would be a high rise and the landscaped grounds smaller. The unit was clean, but could use a fresh coat of paint and replacement of some chipped floor tiles. There is a wonderful supermarket across the street, so we chose to eat most meals in and dined on our lanai while enjoying the view and the coking activity. (Gas grills surrounding the pool proved to be very popular.) Overall, it was a memorable vacation and I would personally recommend the Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea staff went out of their way to please us.”
Reviews.Author: atticusinmaui
Reviews.Content: When we first stayed at the papakea last year we fell in love with unit L-101 ( 1 bedroom ocean front, ground floor), and had high hopes of returning to the same unit....but the unit was already booked. The staff put us in a 2 bedroom loft (F-404) at no additional charge and gave us a free meal ($60.00). What a outstanding room, everything brand new, new carpets, tile work, you melted into the brand new bed. It was very quite on the top floor. During our trip a bottom floor unit opened up and they let us move to it, again it was a 2 bedroom unit (L-103) and did not charge us anymore money. The staff was very nice at all times. You could see the whales from shore, jumping and playing, you could hear them "talk" to each other. If your looking to stay at this resort anytime soon book it now! This is the place to stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aloha -- just arrived home in cold upstate New York on the 24th of January, 2006 from beautiful Maui, Hawaii. Three of us stayed at the Papakea Resort managed by ResortQuest which was formerly Aston for two weeks. Before I went there I read several average reviews and I was a little skeptical as to what the resort would be like. It was absolutely beautiful. We stayed in E403 and I couldn't have been more pleased with the 3 bedroom 3 bath accommodations. Maid service was excellent and the grounds were beautifully kept. The condo had a beautiful kitchen and living area and the bedrooms were huge. All of the management staff were very polite and accommodating as was the concierge staff. All and all I can't say enough about our vacation at the Papakea and am already thinking about returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Papakea is a great place to bring kids. Ours are 4 and 7 years old. The pools and spas are well maintained and beautiful. The grounds (koi ponds and gardens) are gorgeous. The staff was nice. The beach there is not good for kids but you can easily go to Kapalua Bay, Old Airport Beach or Kaanapali for the day. Our only disappointment was in the quality of the room. It needed some upkeep but with kids we were glad that we didn't have to worry about dinging the walls. Overall, a fun place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Papakea”
Reviews.Author: candyWI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Papakea for 7 nites in November and loved it! The condo was tastefully furnished and the bed was very comfortable! When you step out onto your lanai, you are surrounded with beautiful gardens with many flowering bushes. They have two pools and whirlpools that are kept up very nicely and are heated. The staff at Papakea, from the front desk to the maitenance staff were very friendly and helpfull. We never saw anyone that wasn't smiling! We will be returning next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending five nights at the Papakea. I got pictures from the booking agency prior to going, so I had an idea of what to expect. We stayed in E-401 which is a corner unit. It was nice and clean, and had everything we needed. It was older looking and the furniture wasnt very comfortable, but the queen bed in the bedroom was comfortable. The loft had two beds & a bathroom which was nice for our two sons. Our unit had a full ocean view to the left, pool & spa view in the center and the putting green, fountain & beautiful mountain views to the right. Our unit is individually owned so we didnt have maid service, which made the price really reasonable for a weeks' stay. To save money we bought groceries at the Star market across the street and barbequed down by the pool. Everything is very expensive in Maui as I learned in the first couple of days, so shopping for gifts I went to the ABC stores. To save on parking fees we went to Kanapalli beach down by the Weston, which is for public parking, no fee. We had a really good time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned a couple of weeks ago from a long awaited trip to Maui. This was a trip to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary(of which the resort was made aware of before we arrived). We expected somewhat of a special greeting because of this, but nothing, not even a lei. I called four days before our arrival to make sure we had two bedrooms with two queen beds, as their were two couples staying in the condo. I was assured that the room would be ready for us. Upon arriving we found a two bedroom condo, but one bedroom had a queen, and the other had two double beds. It took a couple of hours to change us to the correct room. The room we were moved to only had air conditioning in the living room, the bathrooms were like saunas. These units seem to be seperately owned, and ours was in need of extensive repairs. Also, the tile floors were filthy. The toaster didn't work and you almost needed to be a rocket scientist to open the kitchen cabinets. It is posted around the complex that quiet time is from 10:00 pm to 7:00 am. We were told the TV was too loud at 11:00 pm, but every morning from 5:00 am on the maintenance workers were out with their squeeky carts and talking loud. I do not usually complain about things, but this was just not acceptable. The staff was very unfriendly, and never apologized for any of the inconveniences. I highly recommend NOT staying at this resort. The Kanaapali Shores next door was the only high point of the property, and the view(ocean front room).

Reviews.Title: “A great condotel”
Reviews.Author: Goodkid
Reviews.Content: The Papakea is a delightful place to stay. I had read several reviews like this one before we booked, and they had it from 'Awful' to 'Fabulous'. I would lean to the fabulous side, but not too far. Our place in the 'D' building was clean and well kept up. It had a renovated kitchen with all the amenities. Some wear-and-tear in parts of the condo were evident. If you are used to the Ritz-Carleton level of service, then you will be less than happy at the Papakea. Our daily maid service quality depended on who the maid actually was. Unfortunately the excellent maid was ours for only two of the ten days we were there. We were on the 2nd floor. Having been there now, I would have preferred the 3rd or 4th, and never the 1st. The 1st is ground level. As I walked to the pool I could, and did, look into the various units to see how they were outfitted. Not much privacy, as I was often looking at people looking at me. The grounds were kept immaculate, with fallen leaves and debris cleaned up daily. The pools were beautiful, the hot tubs hot. There is not much of a beach, especially at high tide, but I considered that a plus, since I could sit next to the sea wall, and therefore next to the sea. There was a full beach we could use a couple of minutes walk away. The front desk was very helpful with any questions. The negatives: We had several friends in other facilities and I found it annoying that I had to pay $1 for every local call. The air conditioning consists of a window unit in the living room by the balcony, not much good for the bedroom. We tried it for the first night, then opened all the windows in the place on the second and subsequent nights, and slept much better. Fortunately October begins Maui's winter season, so the humidity was not high. The Aston Papakea was an excellent value for the money. You don't get the Ritz, but you don't pay the Ritz prices either. Within a two minute walk of the entrance is a full size grocery store, which we found very convenient (after the 'sticker-shock' of a box of Weaties for $7, but high food prices are the norm for Hawaii).

Reviews.Title: “budget accomodation with great views”
Reviews.Author: anono
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in room a 2 bedroom apartment with my husband and 3 kids-9,7,2. The accomodation was clean and had fantastic views as we were beach front. The kitchen was fully equiped and in excellent condition. We had a couple of problems though, the airconditioner kept flooding the floor and we reported it twice on the first day but no one came to fix it for the lenght of our stay. We had to mop the floors every evening! It was also very week and kept the room stuffy. Neither bedrooms had views, the second bedroom was upstairs with very steep stairs which was a problem keeping the 2 year old off them, also I found that the blinds let all the light through which ment our infant was up at dawn from the sunshine. Room service was OK however only 1 coffee satchet was given and not replaced (was told it would be $1 per satchet after the first one)and none of the toiletries were replaced either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived from Maui and stayed at the Papakea Resort. I was scared, cause I had read some of the reviews and they were not good. I was very impressed. We were upgraded to a one bedroom with loft, it was very roomy, the A/C was wonderful. The grounds were kept up very nice. Loved the pool area (both of them). It was quite, not a lot of noise like you might find at a bigger resort. Our only complaint they have no bar by the pool. However we survived and are planning on going back in March of next year and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice For Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: AdRock011
Reviews.Content: My wife and just got back from staying at the Papakea for 8 nights this past August for our honeymoon. I must say that I chose wisely. After utilizing Trip Advisor to evaluate and make an informed decision, I feel everyone's comments pretty much on the mark. Upon arriving at the resort, we were pleased to find that that grounds were pristine, with lush and well maintained gardens. The staff gave us a warm reception and the bonus was that they upgraded us from a garden view to an ocean front - FREE OF CHARGE! I imagine we lucked out because the availability happened to work in our favor but they will do what they can to accomodate you. So our room was excellent and clean. That being said you must realize these are individually owned and rented condos so quality of furniture and accessories will vary. We arrived in a clean and bright room with plenty of light coming through the sliding glass door to our balcony overlooking the ocean - (SEE PICTURES). So accomodations were a plus with adequate service. Only drawback is the beach. There is virtually none in front of the property as the water comes up to the sea wall. No problem though, there is miles upon miles of public beach all over the island. So no problems here... We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would reccomend for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location And Great Value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was really scared when I read some of the reviews about this resort, but I have to say..... IT lived up to my expectations and BEYOND! We had a studio one bedroom kitchenette and it was soooo nice. I was iffy about the murphy bed thing so I called and made sure we didn't get one! If you are looking for a nice place to relax with peace and quiet then the papakea is the one for you. Great location, just minutes away from lahaina ($15 cab ride).Plus the pools and jacuzzi were not filled with crazy hyper kids(like the hyatt). Great romantic getaway. Only downfall is there isn't a bar or room service but that is easily fixed by the Star Market that is literally in walking distance to the resort (right across the street). So, please enjoy. If this helps any I am definitely staying at the Papakea every time I come to Maui. It's awesome!!!!!!! Just remember... If you are looking for quiet, beach front, relaxing maui experience..... Papakea!

Reviews.Title: “Great family place”
Reviews.Author: mkd4444
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Papakea and had a great time. We rented our condo in building A directly from the owner--it was on the 4th floor and very nicely equipped. One of the bathrooms was a little dated, but every other room was nice. You do take your chances when you rent sight unseen. As we were leaving we talked to a family that had rented A-401 and were leaving because it was so terrible and dirty. Other family members had units in building L--and all were fine. Other reviewers have talked about noise and cat problems. We had neither. The place is quiet from 10 pm until 7am--and I saw only 2 cats while there. The grounds are nicely maintained. One nuisance, is you need to pay for tennis rackets, putters, and shuffleboard equipment. Seems like those items could be provided (especailly the shuffleboard stuff since one of the courts is in need of repairs). The beach in front of the Papkea is narrow, but the snorkeling is great there. Our family felt it was better than either Black Rock or Molokini both of which we visited. So you can just step outside and do some quick snorkeling. And you can get to wider beaches by just walking a short distance south. Lots of lounge chairs on the grass bordering the beach. Papakea has a great concierge--very helpful. Be warned that they push the Expedia stuff since they are an Expedia member, but you do get discounts. Skip the luau at the Royal Laina unless you have lots of kids who can go for free. The submarine ride was great as was the Warren & Annabelle show in Lahaina. Skip the Aloha Mixed Plate restaurant in Lahaina. Rude servers and refusal to give separate checks to our large group of 3 families. Vino in Kapalua is wonderful--and very reasonable. There is a farmers market 2 blocks away on M/W/F mornings where we got great pineapples and mangos. The Star Market is right across the street, and while expensive, it was very convenient. Just be sure to go to the Costco near the airport to load up on snack items, juices, and beer. Remember that Papakea is not a five star resort, but a comfortable place in a great location. It is a great family resort. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Papakea and wanted to Stay longer”
Reviews.Author: Soccer_dadnatl
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip in July back in December. I was looking for a reasonable ocean front condo for $200 or less. Being cautious about renting from pictures on a website , I was a little worried it might be a dud. It WAS NOT! We rented unit G 408 which was a 1 br loft. The loft had been converted to a bedroom and a full bath. It rented for a one br price for less than $200! The complex is older (1970's) but was beautiful. Well landscaped and maintained. The unit was VERY clean and well maintained. The cabinets and appliances dated the unit but were in all working order. We had all the amenities we needed. The complex had gas grills poolside and we cooked there a couple of nights. They were all in great working order and enough for everyone that needed one. The kids enjoyed the putting green, Pool, we had a great view of the water.The location of the complex was good too. Off the busy highway. I cant imagine someone not liking the place. I like luxury but $350 + a night for a hotel is a waste of money. Besides, the condo was quieter and more relaxing than a hotel. The beach was only at low tide, but the condo next door had a wider beach. It didnt matter because we rode up and down the coast to sample several beaches. Now if you wanted a kids program, room service, valet parking, etc. then go to the hotel. Otherwise this is the way to go! Ive seen some postings that were critical but not of this unit. I got a brochure in the office and saw what Aston was charging for the units they were renting. A one bedroom would have been $265. We rented for #170 a day. My suggestion is to find a rental through another agent not Aston. Do an internet search and there are several for Papakea. The Aston site pictured a generic condo. The site I rented from showed the actual unit to rent. the pictures were accurate. There was shopping across the street but save your money and go to the Safeway store in Lahaina. The prices and selection were much better than the Star Market.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful! You don't know what you are getting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We initally booked 6 nights at this location. My inital impression was that the grounds were more run-down that I had hoped, yet everything should still be fine. We arrived in our room and couldn't find the bed! It was a murphy bed!! It wasn't even made - we had to search for pillows and blakets, move a glass kitchen table and chairs to flop down the bed. (Was it even queen size??) I knew this wouldn't work since my husband already has sleeping problems and I didn't think I'd even be comfortable on the bed. Next, I sat down on the 70s style couch as my husband attempted to turn on the air and watch tv -- these two things couldn't be done at the same time! We had to ask mgt. for an extension cord which they kindly gave us for the evening, but said it couldn't stay b/c it was a fire hazard. The stairs to the rocky beach had a chain across them so I was afraid to even go down to the beach. Needless to say, we left after one night and went to the Mariott in Wailea (highly recommend that hotel-it made a world of difference.) The staff was friendly and offered to try to find us another room after we had stayed in our room night, but it wasn't worth it to us. I do believe though that the other condos were much nicer as they are all individually owned. I believe only 5 or so have murphy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Take the Kids”
Reviews.Author: Random9thoughts
Reviews.Content: This place is the least kid and family friendly place we've ever stayed. They have a two page listing of rules that you don't see until you get there and have checked in. These include no 'boisterous' play which is interpreted to mean whatever the the owners who are there at the time want it to mean; no "Marco Polo" in the pool, no water toys in the pool, no sitting on the beach wall and watching the sunset; etc. If you are an older adult and want complete quiet and control than maybe this is the place for you... although my wife thought it seem more like a run down tenament. We left after two days for better and cheaper digs.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo”
Reviews.Author: goosenest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week at the Papakea while we were visiting Maui for a family wedding. Details on the trip posted on a trip review forum. The Papakea met our needs perfectly. Close to the water, quiet, A/C, clean, great location, good price. We stayed in A103 oceanfront, and only about 30 ft from the beach (seawall). It was a studio with the bed in the living area, well equipped kitchen, nice bath (with great shower), plenty of storage and closets, walk-out lanai with table, chairs, and beach lounge. Staff was friendly and helpful. Grounds were fantastic. Pool with jacuzzi (we never used them). Beautiful landscaping with koi pools, and putting greens (I used that). We walked the beach early almost every morning. Great walking in both directions. I snorkeled right out in front twice. Not beautiful snorkeling, but lots of colorful fish. Still worth doing, and it was so easy---just jump in. Easy drive to north and to Lahaina. Parking was a problem later at night, but always available with a nice walk across the grounds. Nice shopping center with food store within walking distance. We would recommend Papakea very highly and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Papakea has, and always will be a home away from home for me. Having visited Maui about 13 times now, staying at Papakea each trip, I believe it to be obvious that I love it there. Beyond it's beautiful, true, Hawaiian atmosphere, Papakea provides a safe and relaxing sense while vacationing there. Although it may not be the average high scale, fancy resort, I think that adds to it's beauty. It is unique to Hawaii and perfect for all ages and anyone who truely appreciates Hawaii. After my most recent visit to Maui, in which I stayed in a resort just down the beach, I found myself returning to Papakea, just to lay out by the grassy, oceanside view, I like to consider my home away from home. It truely is paradise...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, average location.”
Reviews.Author: coopertrooper2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were great from arrival, we got an excellent room C307 (the rooms are owned individually, the chain manages them so you may get an outdated/worn room). The hotel has two pools and two putting greens, tennis courts and stuff all were in excellent condition and never crowded. There is nothing (in walking distance) to do at night. Lahania is a 5 minute drive (loads to do there its great). The beach is narrow and has coral/rough water (typical of Maui). The only minor negative point from me is the exterior of the hotel needs painting a different colour it looks well dirty when you first turn up and its a little dingy at night as the lights in the hall ways are not very bright. Go enjoy a decent value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family oriented condo”
Reviews.Author: DOuglasW_11
Reviews.Content: My sister and I and another couple stayed at the Papakea from June 1 to June 8, 2005. We had originally booked a two bedroom ocean front condo thru our travel agent. When we arrived we were assigned A407. When we entered the condo it was actually a one bedroom with a loft and a broken down hide-a-bed in the living room. The stairs were narrow and steep to the loft and it wouldn't work for our situation. Two of us are somewhat disabled so we went back to the front desk to arrange for switching to another room. The manager immediately jumped in realizing our problem and assigned us two separate units, A104 and A106 on the first floor of the same building. You couldn't have asked for nicer accomodations. Ocean front and all of the amenities of the larger single unit. One of the units was a one bedroom and the other was a studio unit, both with fully equiped kitchens. Our units had been upgraded by the individual owners and needed very little. The Papakea is convenient to local shopping with the Star Market across from the entrance and the complex was quiet at night. It's not a luxury resort, but it appears to be well maintained, nicely appointed and met our needs. I would recommend the Papakea Beach Resort to others. The beach is small, but enough to walk along. Those who want to jump in the salty ocean would have no problem with little interference of rocks. Those that want larger beaches to lie on can find them a short distance from this resort. If you're looking for a medium to upper grade condo this is the place. If you want high luxury book somewhere else. The pictures in the adds gives you an idea of what the units look like and are probably pretty to true to form.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jam530
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews. We stayed at an oceanfront unit and it was the best. I am not too picky, I do not expect 5 star amenities when I am staying at a moderate property. The grounds were well maintained and it was enjoyable to walk around the property. You can walk on the beach and there is a pathway that takes you south to other properties with beaches, shops and dining. The location is North Kaanapali so you are close to a lot of attractions, restaurants and shopping but not too close. The 1 bedroom unit was pleasant, having a kitchen was convenient for some meals and between the ceiling fans and the air conditioner with a sea breeze coming in it was very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: gibblet93
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights last month. Overall, the resort is very nice and the grounds maintained well. Our unit was okay, the kitchen is old and had kind of a smell but the bathroom looks like it was recently remodelled. The AC was only in the living room area and was on a 3 hour timer so it was a bit annoying, but I found the temperature comfortable in the bedroom with only a ceiling fan. It was nice to have a washer and dryer in the unit. And the shopping center across the street wtih a supermarket was very convenient. The housekeeping in this facilty was very bad though. The tile floor was not very clean when we checked-in, there were spots on floor that needed wiping and some traces of sand. And of course they never cleaned the floor the whole time we were there. That didn't bother us as much, since we were also tracking sand and dirt inside whenever we came in and we don't walk barefoot. What we found very annoying and frustrating is that for 8 out of the 10 nights we were there, we had to call for extra towels all the time, especially annoying when you come back to the unit late at night. We called the head of the housekeeping dept and also talked to the people in the front desk but it was still the same story every night for 8 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea is great”
Reviews.Author: olcese
Reviews.Content: Great resort, we originally booked an ocean view room and were upgraded to an ocean front room for free upon arrival. Great staff and the concierge was very helpfull. Do make sure to attend the continental breakfast/ presentation if it is your first time in Maui and don't know what to do. When looking for a resort, I read great reviews of Papakea but not enough pictures were out there so I hope these help. Overall it was a very pleasent stay. I would definately consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gotthetravelbug81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got married on Maui and all of our family and friends stayed with us at the Papakea the week prior to the wedding. This was my second time and my husband's third time at the Papakea. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and the sunsets are amazing. We loved the putting greens, pools, and BBQs. It was great to BBQ in the evenings and relax at the pool. The Papakea is such a wonderful place and we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Maui and stayed at the Papakea. We had an oceanfront room. It was beautiful. The room was clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. The only complaint about the room is the air conditioning. It is located in the living area and doesn't reach the bedroom very well. The grounds are lovely. The pool and hot tubs are well maintained. It is convenient to Kapalua and Lahaina. The parking lot does get full, but we didn't have a problem finding a spot. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Papakea”
Reviews.Author: rawhide
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Papakea and would recommend it --- We had an oceanfront unit with an awesome view and fell asleep to the waves every night --- we did not spend a lot of time at the hotel pool but instead travelled to snorkel or boogie board with the kids every day-- We had no complaints at all and really enjoyed our time there --- spent our last two nights at the Westin so the kids could have the "big pool" and it felt way too crowded, expensive and touristy after our stay at the Papakea

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Papakea”
Reviews.Author: TravelingE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay at the Papakea and I would probably not return. As we booked a unit through a property manager, the on-site personnel were uninterested and unfriendly. A defective doorlock became a huge problem as they were not "authorized" to provide maintenance. I would still be locked out if I had not gotten very assertive. The local cat population was a problem: loud mating calls on many nights resulted in lost sleep. Our ground floor unit opened onto the putting green which was constantly being mowed. And the parking is abysmal - far too few spots for the number of residents; returning to the condo after 8 pm resulted in walking from one end of the complex to the other - if a spot could even be found. There were many covered cars and boats in the lot which appeared to be in temporary storage for owners - relocating those could free up daily spots. The unit we rented was in need of some repair - painting, thorough cleaning. Several things did not work, refrigerator leaked. For the money, I have stayed at other condos in west Maui that were by far a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Dan54669
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Papakea Resort Jan. 16-23, 2005 and like our previous stay we enjoyed it greatly. Have you every returned to a place that was a great experience and been disappointed that the second trip didn't live up to the memories of the first ? When we decided to return to Hawaii there was no question in our minds that we wanted to go back to the Papakea. What we didn't know was if we would be disappointed. We weren't. We booked an oceanfront room (L-301) thru Maui Resort Management and we found the room very exceptable. Sunsets, whales breaching and the sound of the ocean coming ashore all make this a very special place. So special that I even called a co-worker back home to gloat and let him hear the ocean. Room L-301 is located on the 3rd floor at the outside edge of the resort next to the canal. This was a great location because it tended to be quieter (not that noise is a problem) and the side window of the living area gave us a beautiful nightly view of the sun setting. When I booked the room Maui Resort Management e-mailed me pictures of the room so I knew exactly what I was walking into. I found this a great comfort so I could avoid the dreaded, SUPRISE! One really neat thing we tried this year was Zip-lining through Skyline EcoAdventures. This was a real neat experience that had the boys asking if we could go again. With the kids starting high school next year I doubt that I'll be able to take them out of school to travel back to Maui for a few years but when we do go back I feel very confident that Papakea Resort will be part of our travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Papakea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's stay in Maui. Being our first trip, I did a lot of research and reading so many positive reviews, decided on Papakea. Upon check-in after a very long flight from Houston, the general manager greeted us with the news that she had upgraded our reservation from a garden view room to an ocean view room. I thanked her, explaining that this was our first trip, and that we were celebrating our 25th anniversary and would be renewing our vows in a couple of days. She then tried to upgrade us to an ocean front room, but none were available. Everything about the resort was perfect. The room, a studio, was perfect, very clean and well maintained. From our lanai, we had a view of the ocean with Molokai in the background. Really enjoyed sitting outside at night, the grounds lit by the tiki torches and listening to the waves breaking on the shore. Excellent housekeeping staff never missed a detail, and the grounds are beautiful. All in all, our experience could not have been better, and when we return, we will be sure to stay again at the Papakea.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful condos with an even better price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Papakea. The property grounds are gorgeous and are well kept up. The condos are neat and clean. This condo is located on the ocean where there isn't really a beach. I have never found that to be a problem, because there are many other beaches in Maui that I go to for snorkeling, swimming, etc. Papakea never feels overly crowded either, at other hotels there are many people sitting at the pool and lounge chairs galore around the property, that it is almost difficult to walk. There are grills by the pool, so you could grill out if you wanted. There is a grocery store basically across the street from the condo; the prices are a little high. Both times that I have been to Papakea, I have stayed in an ocean view room. My sister has stayed in the oceanfront. We both agreed that we like the ocean view because you can see the gorgeous grounds and also the ocean. She liked the oceanfront because all you can see is the ocean, but for cost she prefers the ocean view. I feel that the staff at Papakea is very accommodating. We made our reservations a year in advance because we would need two rooms. Because all the condos are personally owned, they never know which rooms will be available and when. We wanted to have our rooms in the same unit. However they couldn't put us both in the type of room we had reserved, so they upgraded one of the rooms to keep us in the same unit. We also had a problem with the toilet one night and someone was at our door within 5 minutes to fix it. There are cats located on the property, but they don't bother anyone. They are there to keep down on rodents and are fed by the resort. So they are not bothering people for food. The only negative that I can think of is that it isn't located near shopping and restaurants. So you need to drive around 5 minutes to get to them. I would recommend this resort to anyone, especially families. It is beautiful and the condos are very large.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding at the papakea”
Reviews.Author: atticusmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the papakea nov 29-dec 6, in room L-101, which I feel was the best room in the whole resort. Ocean front on the ground floor, corner unit, what a wonderful view!!!!. The staff was very nice( you have to be nice to them if you want to be treated well) and treated us well. Our room had everything we could want and then some. My daughter wants me to state for the record that the sofa sleeper was very uncomfortable, the springs were sticking out, and the A/C was on a 1 hour timer. I really didn't find those things to be a big deal, and we are planning to head back to the papakea in Feb 2005, I just hope we can get the same unit. P.S. Were leaving our daughter at home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Papakea Resort”
Reviews.Author: vacationfun_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea Resort Nov 19-26 and had a great time. After reading some of the reviews we were a little skeptical but it was great the grounds are very well kept up and the staff was very friendly always willing to help and answer all my questions. We were in building K and we had a wonderful view of the pool and the ocean the room we had was a 2 bedroom with a ocean view there was 6 of us and it was very nice and comfortable. We went across the street to the Star market and bought groceries and cooked breakfast there and by the pool they have many BBQ's for your use we went and got Steaks from the Star Market and had a BBQ one night by the pool it was very relaxing. There is also an ABC store in front and we bought many gifts and items from there I would definetely stay here again we went to the Hyatt just to check it out and the Hyatt is a four star hotel but it was so crowded you could not find anywhere to lay by the pool or the water so we just looked around and left right away I liked the Papakea because there was not many people and we always had seats by the pool and by the water it was great . The only thing is if you are looking for a resturant there is not one at the Papakea but we did walk next door to the Kannapali Shores and we had breakfast there one morning, they also serve lunch and dinner. And there was a lot of rocks out in the Ocean in front of the hotel so the kids did do a lot of snorkeling saw many great fish but they did have to wear water shoes because the rocks were rough and there really is no sandy beach to lay on but they do have a nice grass area and I really liked that. Also you are very close to Lahania with many resturants and shopping it is in a great location. I do recommend the Papakea Resort and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aloha -After spending days on this site and reading about all the different resorts we went ahead and booked at the papakea through our travel agent. This was the first time to Hawaii for the whole family. We spent 7 days at the Papakea and had a wonerful time!! Three families went, there were 10 of us in our party so we had 3 condos. When we arrived they had us all in different buildings so we asked if we could be close to eachother, The manager was very helpful and changed all of our rooms immidately. The condos were clean and the one I had was recently remondeled and it was beautiful!! The Papakea is centerally located and it took no time to get to Lahaina.The Papakea was clean and beautiful. It's true the beach is not the best in Maui, but they have tons of chairs by the sea wall and it was fablous. It made it fun to go and explore and see all the different beaches in the area. We bought Maui revealed and it helped alot with the different activities. We went on the blue water rafting trip and the kids loved it!! Overall the papakea was wonderful and we are all planning our trip for next year!! Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located to Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from several days in Maui for my daughter's wedding. First time in Maui. Maui is great if you prefer rest and relaxation and tours of naturally occuring sites such as waterfalls. If your preference is historical siteseeing tours or nightime action, this is not the island to be on. The resort is approximately 10 minutes or so from the heart of Lahaina. Great if you have rented a car. I am not sure what the cost of a taxi would be each way. The grounds are nice but the beach is very narrow. At high tide the water comes right up to the retaining wall leaving very little or no beach. One is better off at another condo and/or hotel if a large or wide beach is wanted. At high tide, the only option is the resort's two pools. You have the option of eating in or out here. If one eats in then you can walk across the road to a supermarket or several fast food restaurants. There is also the option of calling Pizza Hut or the like. Most of the better restaurants are in Lahaina requiring you to drive or call a taxi. One more thing. Although the resort indicates that it has air conditioning, the only one is in the living room. However, the air is essentially blocked by the sofa and does not extend to the bedroom. In the bedroom there is no air conditioning. Only a ceiling fan which does not do it. When the day and/or evening temperatures are in the 70's or 80's with humidity the lack of air conditioning in the bedroom requires one to stay or sleep in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanylynnsanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papakea about 5 years ago. When we arrived they told us they had no room, despite the fact that we had confirmed reservations, and sent us to another hotel. The other hotel was awful and had bugs. After throwing a fit we were able to move to the Papakea after two nights at the other hotel. We wrote a letter of complaint when we returned and received a response giving us two free nights at the Papkea on our next visit. We are now preparing for a trip to Maui. The general manager at first said they would honor the letter but were very busy and would call back in a few days to make reservations. We never received a return call. We left several messages, e-mails, and faxes to no avail. Finally we gave up and made reservations elsewhere. Their customer service obviously has not improved. While the facility is a nice one at an affordable price, they don't seem particularly interested in customer satisfaction or in honoring their word.

Reviews.Title: “Papakea feels like home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely two-week vacation at the Papakea. We had a very large 3BD/2BA unit on the 4th floor of the "K" building and it was absolutley fantastic. We had a beautiful ocean view and the condo itself was very comfortable. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed and we frequently walked across the street to the Star market to pick up something to grill on the poolside BBQs. No restaurant has a better view! The beach is narrow, but was perfect for our small children, as there were no huge waves. Those who want the bigger waves can simply walk down the beach a short way and it is substantially wider. My kids loved the pool, the koi ponds and the big grassy areas at the resort. Bottom line is, if you book through a smaller rental company like Maui Dreams Come True, you know in advance exactly what room you will get, so there are no worries. We have already booked our favorite unit again for next year!

HotelInfo.Name: Aston at Papakea Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3543 Lower Honoapiilani Hwy, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761 (Formerly ResortQuest at Papakea Resort)
